VB-169353

VW2020 SP3.1 Crashes on Launch in Catalina

This customer cannot successfully launch Vectorworks 2020 SP3.1 using their existing MacOS user account.

Creating a new user account, the customer can launch Vectorworks but it's undesirable to move back and forth between user accounts to use the app.

Attached is a screenshot of the splash screen immediately before crashing. Also attached is the customer's system report. 

 

 

 

  		Ian Lane
VB-169871

Unclaer Situation with the Data Manager and Project Sharing

Hi Vectorworks
If employee "A" use the data manager and employee "B" do the same before employee "A" has sent the changes, then employee "B" will lost all changes in the data manager. I think in this case there should shown a conflict dialog (like for symbols).
Best regards, Marc 		Mihail Rizov

VB-169223

File & backups corrupted for unknown reason. "Unexpected end of file"

Hi team, I need an urgent assessment on this one. The user's main file AND 2 out of the 3 perpetual backup files have twice become corrupted now. Opening the Vectorworks file every time raises the error, "Unexpected end of file encountered during file read operation. (Failure on attempt to read file)" 

Here's the setup. It's a little suspect but things have been going fine until recently: 
* .vwx file kept in Vectorworks Cloud Services folder
* Backups are put in the macOS iCloud folder
* Autosave was set to 'every 3 minutes,' keep 3 recent backups. 
* This is so the boss can access files as-required (not very often and they _usually_ communicate with each other), but License Session History indicates there were no concurrent usage attempts at the time. Definitely not this second occasion. 

The first time this happened (Wednesday 25th) the user (Rachael) was placing a texture bed when Vectorworks froze. Rachael force quit Vectorworks before enough time would have lapsed for Vectorworks to have made even one backup file, but with today's occasion nothing unexpected occurred. Rachael writes: 

"The new file has done what the old one has. After i spent most of the morning fixing it. It didnt crash or anything i saved it as normal and have just reopened it. The two most recently backup also had the corruption but the third was fine. I have resaved the third one and shut all the other files. The problem happened between 9:41am and 10:02am (between 2nd and 3rd last saves)" 

https://ordercenter.vectorworks.net/licenses/sessions/?license_id=NZ-G0AY37

License: G0AY37

Version: 25.0.2

*What's causing this? How can I diagnose or help the customer?*  		Bozhidar Stanchev

Have tried this in both 2020 and 2021 with the same result.

I have added this as a QRT because if we can get a resolution it will greatly increase our chances of a sale.

[https://analytics.vectorworks.net/crashes?serial=EFXBEZ-KZDT4T-Z4Z3YR-G0N1B5]

 

Hi tech support,

This client has been experiencing some crashes lately. Joseph suggested to take it to Jira.

The client started in VW25.2.2 and collected some crash reports. Yesterday, he called us to report another crash. I collected his user log and the file he was working on at the time. I suggested he would upgrade to SP3 and he did.
Yesterday afternoon he called again, saying his VW had crashed again. He had saved another crash report and I copied both the crash report and his updated user log.
You can find all the files attached.

Time stamps of some of the recent crashes:
04/21/2020 11:03:58
04/21/2020 14:52:28
04/22/2020 07:16:51 > should be this file
04/22/2020 12:40:54 > a different file in which he had only just imported a DWG and zoomed out

Most of his files are based on geolocation though. The user centre and internal VW centre match but his drawing is somewhere far away from that.
His computer matches all the requirements for VW2020 high end-use.
He uses a Landmark version while his coworkers use a Fundamentals (all localized NL versions). They have had no problems yet.
​
Do you see a pattern or anything that might cause the crashes?

{color:#c1c7d0}Reminder Yana: ticket 22090{color} 		Josh Loy
VB-167659

Vectorworks Crashes when navigating between design layers

Steps:
# Download and unzip the attached file.
# Open the test plan vwx file
# Change to a 3D view and make sure you are using OpenGL
# Start changing between the various design layers
# Change to the references tab and right click > edit the OpenGL.vwx reference
# In the layers sections, enable all the layers and select OK
# Navigate back to the design layers and start switching again
# Select one of the newly added layers and again go back to the OpenGL.vwx reference options and remove all the layers but OpenGL
# Again, back in the design layer start sifting through the design layers

_Notice the application eventually crashes after sifting through the design layers, often after the first change._

_NOTE: I was not able to reproduce this in 25.0.2_ 		Josh Loy

VB-167781

*VW CRASHES WHILE DOING MENIAL TASK

See attached crash log and file. This (or similar) crash has occurred at least 5 tiles recently. It happens when double clicking a VP to enter/edit design layer. Totally fast and unexpected with no hang prior to crash.

Just in case anyone cares, it is my general experience that the more detailed and developed a drawing set gets, the slower and more crash-prone VW's becomes. I am so used to it it is sad. Always seems to happen when I am actually trying to work quickly and actually get something finished. Lots of cursing (ask my wife!). No software should crash this much. Ever. Please try to fix. Thanks. 		Justin Hutchison

VB-174903

Custom View pane displayed incorrectly, when opened in Vectorworks 2021 SP1, regression from SP0

-Open test file in 2021 SP0 and note the right view pane is displayed in a Custom View (2021_SP0.png)
-Open the attached test file in 2021 SP1 and the right view pane says it's in a Custom View when it's really displayed in Top Plan
-Zoom in/out on the right view pane and you'll notice the grid is turning black for some reason also
-Even though the right pane says, "Top/Plan" change the view to, "Top/Plan" again and zoom in/out, you'll notice the grid is restored back to blue, instead of black.
Josh Loy

VB-176046

Crash After VSC Updates then Strange GPU Message : JBC

This customer has nine seats of Architect 2021 SP2 on VSS (ZCZ 7315 4077 345) and have recently upgraded from Vw 2020 to Vw 2021 on a bunch of fairly new iMacs (specs in attached image).

!Machine Specs.png|width=575,height=347!

All the iMacs are experiencing this issue but only in Vw 2021. Note they are not using VSC for anything.

Initially this appears:

!First Message.png|width=424,height=396!

then this:

!Second Message.png|width=580,height=394!

then this:

!Third Message.png|width=578,height=381!

and finally this message:

!Final Message.png|width=575,height=223!

at which point Vw crashes. This happens multiple times a day and apparently quite randomly. I repeat, it does not happen in Vw 2020.

I have had them uninstall and reinstall Vw including removing the user folder and deleting the VCS app. The only thing that will stop the crashing is if they remember to quit VCS immediately after launching Vw.

Thanks. 		Gunther Miller

VB-175311

force quit vectorworks - file disappears

 

I tried to update a section viewport. I had to force quit VW due to the update taking too long.

I went to reopen the file and it was gone. It was nowhere to be found.

I've never seen that happen before. I kept the file on dropbox.

I was able to get a backup copy from Time Machine.

Unknown to me, the file was also open on a colleague's computer and he performed a 'save' which was saved as a conflicted file. Dropbox had not yet synchronized his conflicted file with my computer when I had force quit. My file was deleted by the force quit. (or so it appears)

  		Rick Berge

VB-174481

Update Hidden Line Viewport Hangs

User has submitted a file in 2020.  I have tested it both in 2020 and 2021.

When updating the Elevation of the Fireplace, Vectorworks seems to go through a series of icons flashing, mostly in the attributes palette as you select and deselect the rendered viewport.

The files seems to be constructed from a poor workflow, but I am not 100% sure if this is the root cause.  Looks like only a few layers are set up to be at elevation with the site, where as everything else has a 0 elevation but is offset in the Z axis.

I have included a video of my computer showing the weird anomaly after the viewport is rendered. 		Charlene Mao

VB-170336

Timeout for generating animations after 24 hours

Hello Iskra,

According to the help instructions, time limit for generating animations from Vectorworks in the Cloud Services is 48 hours, but our clients gets a time-out error message after 24 hours.
She would like to get the results similar to those presented here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Ofnfm8WSGRE&t=3s

She can generate animations within 24-hours with settings illustrated in the screenshots, but the results are not satisfactory. Unfortunately, better rendering options cause time-out error.

Shouldn't she have 48 hour time limit for generating animations?
Which settings should she use to obtain high quality movie and manage to generate it within time limit in the Cloud Services?

VB-169055

Referenced IFC files are not updating properly with project sharing

There are several issues with updating IFC files in a project sharing workflow. We are currently working on a server, with the two IFC files in the same folder as the project file on that server. One IFC file was referenced BEFORE the project file was created, and one was not. The second one was referenced by a user in her working file. Layer referencing has been used, and the reference file locations are set to relative to the original file. When trying to update the first reference using a working file, there have been several issues, including layers of the IFC file not being recognized because their names have changed so the new layers are simply not being referenced. We were forced to delete and re-reference the new file instead of trying to update. After recreating this reference and creating the new reference for the second IFC file, all changes were committed. When another user refreshed his working file, the new and existing references were listed as up to date, but the existing reference did not show any changes to the file and the layers of the new reference were not showing up at all in the layer list in the Organization palette. Vasil Kitanov

VB-170668

Added formulas in a worksheet don’t work properly

You'll see a worksheet and two space objects. Each area function contains two criteria, one of which is (L<>'REF*'). Each area function by its own gives the correct result as does the sum of the corresponding cells. But when you add these area functions in a single cell the result is that of the latter.
When the second criterion (L<>'REF*') is removed from the addition the resulting sum is correct. So there seems to be an issue with that criterion in an addition. Please investigate.
Karthick Chilaka

VB-167730

The texture set for the Component of the Roof Face (using Roof Style) displayed on the Viewport is not reflected even if it is changed by the [Classes...] setting of Viewport.

The texture set for the Component of the Roof Face (using Roof Style) displayed on the Viewport is not reflected even if it is changed by the [Classes...] setting of Viewport.

--------------------------
Target environment　　　　　
--------------------------
Win Mac　
It occurs in v2020, v2019.

--------------------------
Target Tool
--------------------------
Roof
Roof Face
--------------------------
How to Reproduce
--------------------------
1) Open this file and select the displayed Viewport.

2) Press the "Class ..." button on the Viewport.

3) Press the "Edit ..." button on "Component-Ext Finish Dampproofing"

4) Select "Texture"

Change a current texture on the "Object and Component Textures"to another one.

5) Close all dialogs with the OK button and update on the Viewport.
The changed texture has not been reflected.

*Remarks*
-This problem is not occur with the wall components.
-The Component's texture of Roof Style can reflect when it edit from Resource Manager.(movie10591-02.mov)

Please refer to "sample10591.vwx","movie10591-01.mov","movie10591-02.mov".

Best regards,
Rie Ichimura

VB-175958

I marked the Customer Importance as critical because the cases described here are extremely common cases.

*See the attached video at the 19 second mark:*
I have two roof faces with a rectangle clipped from the edge of them.  This effectively changes the boundary poly of the roof face.
It doesn't seem possible to join more than on edge between them.
Note:  this may be a technical limitation, but it's a very common need.

*See the attached video at the 53 second mark:*

VB-171202

Bounded Slabs Become Un-Bounded to Walls after Working in File for a while

I have seen this problem in Mainline (builds 549720, 549935) for the past two weeks, therefore I'm submitting a bug report for this even though I don't have concrete steps as to how to reproduce the problem.

In this case I opened the file and created a viewport in 3D view then edited the Annotations. After Exiting the annotations, and updating the viewport, the slabs became un-bounded to the walls on both stories. 

Steps to reproduce the problem [not always reproducible]

-Open test file 

-Go to the sheet layer "A2.2 - Elevations" and edit the Detail viewport annotations

-Draw a space object (or a structural member or a wall). Then exit Viewport Annotations.

-Go back to design layer '1 - Floor layout' and create a viewport in 3D view on "A2.2 - Elevations" sheet layer

-Render viewport in Hidden line and make sure to Update (this is what will show the problem)

-The slabs become unbounded from the walls 		Christopher Graye
VB-167414

*Landmark: If Site Model visible then editing Landscape Area set to texture bed crashes when reshaping

http://analytics.vectorworks.net/vw-crashes-mac-523565-b03b7809027ed43f5850f897c1520b4f-3b15bcacf8cda4c1b1ce844e1b9b04e9.html

Hello (and Happy New Year!),
In the enclosed file editing the Landscape Areas on the 'Soft Landscapes' layer with the Reshape tool is very tedious and often crashes Vectorworks.

The Site Model is on it's own layer. If that layer is made invisible then editing the Landscape Area works fast as expected - please see enclosed movie.

Once thing I have done is rename the Soft landscapes layer, update the Site Model then rename the Soft landscapes layer back to the original name and re-update the Site model. This seems also to work with the Landscape Areas for both the user and myself. However I am since unable to repeat it to get it to work. The only workaround is to make the Site Model layer invisible.

Cheers,
Peter

VB-175979

Curtain Wall window has incorrect geometry at corner posts (Brake Metal)

I am using a Curtain Wall to model a steel post-and-beam screened porch; vertical and horizontal members are 3"x3". The insect screens are larger than the openings by an inch all around, and surface-mounted with self-tapping screws. I created a Window Style for the screens, and made them "Curtain Wall Windows" as part of the style, such that they would automatically accommodate the openings regardless of post spacing. So far, so good.

In order for the corner posts to appear correctly, I defined the Start and End Boundary Frames as Brake Metal with a very small Width (0.1", since 0" is not an allowed value).

In the attached file I have two such Curtain Walls meeting at a 90° corner; see Saved View 1. In this view, the two Windows nearest the corner in the left-hand wall are Curtain Wall Windows in the "alum screen" style. Note that the corner post models incorrectly, as both the upper and lower units are too wide and reduce their respective "corner post" width by half the frame depth, in this case 1 1/2".

The Right-hand wall's two closest units (in green) have been converted to Unstyled and changed from Curtain Wall Windows to "normal" windows. Their widths have been manually adjusted so that the corner post (Start/End Boundary frame) models correctly as a 3"x3" "post". For a clearer view of the issue, look at Saved Views 2 (inside corner) and 3 (close-up with windows turned off).

A Curtain Wall Window should size itself to the widest dimension of a Brake Metal Start/End Boundary frame; I cannot see the logic of their not doing so. 		Christopher Graye

See attached file.
On the Interiors layer, you will see a screening room. There are double doors on one wall. While trying to edit the door, the follow is now happening.
The door is visible, but not selectable.
If I move or nudge the wall, the door disappears.

OpenGL is working fine on the other layers.
I think this also happened with another door I was tweaking. I moved the door, and then tried to undo the move, but the door stayed where it was.
I have restarted VW and also my PC and still having these issues. 		Christopher Graye

Normally, the door and wall and window tags are drawn correct relative to the layer scale at which they are drawn. For an unknown reason, when viewed from a sheet layer view port the scale of the tags becomes very small. They should remain a consistent size and not rescale.

VB-167785

In the attached file I have a styled window object with Renderworks textures applied to various components. Note the glazing is by class and should be clear. VB-176047

Major loss of geometry in design layer upon exiting symbol edit (3D)

I wish to document here that I could observe a total loss of geometry in a design layer ( slab and most 3D geometry) after editing the 3D mode of a symbol.

The symbol "D-Rand Recht West" was edited from the Resource Manager and the edit involved
* pasting in the symbol's 3D component a 2D geometry to be used as shape for an extrude
* create the extrude in top view, by cmd + E and entering a value of 1m
* setting the view to a custom 3D view using the flyover while in wireframe
* selecting the push and pull tool and choosing the face edit mode
* refining thus the upper face of my extrude as needed, snapping to the rest of the 3D symbol comps
* right-clicking on the new extrude and some existing geometry > solid subtraction

Upon exiting the symbol definition, most 3D geometry in the design layer "LE58a-06-OG" was gone. Survived: a few curtain walls, a few extrudes. I lost the slab and all elements involved in slab holes, such as a Flat Roof Skylight and various HVAC elements.

Attached
* a backup file "LE58a-Proj-backup" which must have generated just after this event. Please go to the design layer "LE58a-06-OG" and compare with 
* file "LE58a-Proj" which is correctly displaying the items

VB-175519

Spotlight cable tools cable duplication issue

When duplicating a cable object created with the new cable tools, the cable objects label is not updating its label to display the new cable run ID until the label is manually moved using the blue move handle.

this affects every type of duplication except copy and paste 

to reproduce

select the cable tool in the preview toolset

select any cable style

toggle auto numbering on and set the cable run id to auto increment.

draw a cable

next duplicate the cable (control  drag, move by points ...)

in every case except using copy and paste the cable object will auto increment the cable run id field in the properties but the cable label will display the new cable run ID, until one of the cable object labels is moved using the blue reposition handle 		Kevin Linzey

VB-175517

Spotlight cable tools, cable objects not calculating toatl weight

As the title says the new cable object is not displaying the cable objects total weight, in the load information section of its properties, the distributed weight displays but the total weight field is empty.

According the the manual the cable objects total weight should be the total weight of the cable parts it contains.

To reproduce

activate the cable tool from the preview toolset

select any cable style

draw a cable

the total weight field in the cable objects OIP will be empty, the distributed load field will contain the correct data drawn from the cable parts record

  		Kevin Linzey
VB-172822

Vectorworks not Exporting MVR with Vision Video Source

*+Found during Acceptance Test (worked correctly in build 554670):+*  When using *Export MVR* in Vectorworks build 556793, the exported MVR file does not contain the Vision Video Source.  Vectorworks build 556793 correctly exports ESC files containing the Vision Video Source.

Use the attached Vectorworks file _TestFile 3_3 v2021b210.vwx_.  The extruded square on the left has a Vision Video Source attached to it (Spotlight>Visualization>Select Vision Video Source).  When this file is exported to MVR and opened in Vision, the video is not present.  

I tested the Acceptance Test MVR file from build 554670 in Vision and the video is present, so this is not an issue with Vision.  Included the MVR that has the video source from build 554670, the MVR without the video source from build 556793, the ESC file from Build 556793 just to compare. 		Kevin Linzey
VB-175660

Spotlight bridle tool use part preference does not work correctly

The new bridle preference option to use a specific bridle part for leg 1 does not work correctly.

If a part is chosen the bridle tool uses this as the designed length, when in reality the user wants this to be the required leg length.

for example a 3m bridle part is chosen, the real world rigger will understand this to mean that total designed length needed for the bridle leg will be 3m + the effective basket length

When in reality the bridle tool is using the part length directly as the designed length without accounting for the effective basket length. Which results in the default leg parts always being far longer than the calculated required length of the parts for the leg.

Effectively this makes the option unusable, as the bridle geometry created will bear no relationship to the actual bridle on site if the rigger uses the default parts list to build it

 

to verify this (change the number of house points for other bridle types)

in the bridle preference select the bridle part as the default and select an appropriate bridle part from the drop

insert a truss or pipe

add 2  house points configured with a basket

insert a bridle using the tools

open the bridle configuration dialogue 

look at the bridle geometry on the left hand side of the dialogue

the designed length will display the same length as the bridle part chosen in the bridle preferences

the required leg length will be displayed (designed length-effective basket length)

now look at the leg parts pane

in the selected material the leg will use the chosen part from the bridle preferences + a shackle, which is what the user wants,

but because the chosen part has also been used as the designed length, the total length of the selected bridle parts is longer than required leg length and results in a parts list that cannot be used.

If the user has assigned basket dimensions to the house points the bridle is connected to this has to be taken into account when using this insertion preference

  		Kevin Linzey
VB-172385

spotlight cable tools Manage cable parts filters

The filters in the manage cable parts dialogue do not seem to be functional,

no matter which filter is active all of the possible parts are displayed 		Kevin Linzey

VB-174374

Truss Hinge Malfunctioning When Angle is 180°

In the attached file the book hinge is setup properly with a minimum angle of 0° and a maximum angle of 180°.  The hinge functions properly from angles 0-179° and allows truss to connect to the appropriate side of the plate.  However, when the angle is set to 180° the truss on the left (or fixed) side of the hinge symbol does not connect to the proper side of the hinge.  It instead is connecting to the interior of the hinge where the pivot point is located.  

File and video attached, one hinge is set to 179° and the other is set to 180°. 		Kevin Linzey
VB-172891

Spotlight Bridle configuration problem

If the Bridle tool is set to use the new insertion preference 'Bridle Part' The bridle doesn't correctly calculate the bridle parts in the Bridle configuration dialogue.

Specifically the basket for leg one will use the part defined for the leg.

for example if the user sets the bridle preferences to use steel 300

the basket will use this part no matter what the basket dimensions are (custom , etc...)

The bridle geometry for leg 1 is also incorrectly displayed, the required leg length (should be the length of the bridle part specified) is displaying as the designed length minus the basket length.

  		Kevin Linzey

VB-175579

*crash in Batch destructor - a lot

[https://analytics.vectorworks.net/crashes?category=108917&build=672648-vectorworks-win]

-pick flyover tool

This is rather annoying and looks potentially dangerous.

VB-170457

T02122 - DataVis wall components don't match wall-related criteria

In the attached file, the middle viewport is using component classes to draw DV overrides.

If the criteria is broad (any), the components draw in color.

If the criteria is wall-specific in any way (type=wall, or wallstyle=x, or component is present) then the components don't participate and do not draw in color. 		Rick Berge

VB-175124

Aligned Hardscape: 2D and 3D are not the same size/location

Please open the attached file. 

I have selected and zoomed to the problem element, which you can see in both 2D and 3D. 

I have been working in Top/Plan view and receiving Site Modifier Conflicts where this hardscape meetings the larger piece of paving. I carefully moved the grade objects on the surface of the larger hardscape to ensure they are not overlapping the smaller piece. I also reshaped the smaller piece to leave quite a large gap - so that this piece is definitely not overlapping the larger piece. And still, I get the conflict. 
Looking at it in 3D, you can see why. The 3D element of this smaller hardscape IS overlapping the other one, so there IS a modifier conflict.

I have not had time to create other test files, but wanted to get this reported as soon as possible. Clearly it's critical that the 2D should match the 3D.

What is causing this? Could it be anything to do with the georeferencing in the file?

Or the curve on the larger hardscape? Let me know what else you need from me to test this and narrow it down.  		Bozhidar Stanchev

You’ll see in the IFC and vwx file 3 Walls - one with recess and no component offset which is fine, one with no recess and component offset which is fine and one with both which fails in a strange way that some Wall components get detached from the Wall as separate objects and are no longer cut by Windows. 

The Wall is corrupt somehow, when I copy it into a blank file, the problem persists. If I create a new Wall from scratch using the same Style and insert same Window Style then create the recess, it exports correctly. Nothing I tried to reset this Wall worked, including running a wall reset script provided by Bruce Ferguson on an earlier similar issue.

VB-171461

The view changes when the Plant style's 3D image is changed. It seems that the selected image is not remembered in the dialog.

--------------------------
Target environment
--------------------------
Mac/Win
v2020
--------------------------
About Problem
--------------------------
Steps:
1)Select "Plant Tool" and put it on the screen.
Set "Right Isometric" view
2)Click "Edit Plant Style..." of OIP
3)Click "Create from Image..." of Visualization pane.
4)Change the Image, and click "OK" of Create From Image dialog.
5)Click "OK" of Plant Style dialog.
6)The view changes from "Right Isometric" to "Front" and is deselected.

Also, the selected image may not be recorded in the "Create from Image" dialog.
(Motion is not constant)

Please refer to "sample12250.vwx","movie12250.mov".

There is a discrepancy between the Mode Bar and the Menu.
Refer to "check_view.mov", "check_view.vwx".
When I zoom in and out with the mouse, the view returns "Right Isometric".

*Remarks*
*When Standard View is "Top/Plan" view, the selected image is displayed for a moment.
*In v2017, v2018, the view does not change, but the selection is deselected.
*In Windows, the image may not be reflected on the screen. (Motion is not constant)
Refer to "Win_Disappear.mov".

*Add*
The user said that the meaning of Note in "Create From Image" dialog is difficult to understand.

He said that
"I don't understand the meaning of the Note, "determine the size of the created image prop inside the plant 3D geometry".
Are these values a note to write down the original size? Or does the value here affect anything or anywhere?"

Even if I change the value here, the placed shape will reflect the size specified in the placement options. (As written in Note)

Does changing the value here have any affect other than "Edit Current Graphics"? Can I see the change in the value somewhere?

Rie Ichimura

VB-168013

DWG export not exporting geometry located in Referenced Viewports

Hi There, 

We have an issue being raised from one of our biggest Vectorworks users here in the UK. Assael. 

They are experiencing issues when trying to export a sheet file from a current project they are working on to DWG. 

The issue is geometry isn't being exported, the geometry originates through a viewport reference from another file. The working process they use is:

Resource File > Working File > Sheet File > Publish/Export from the sheet file. 

The main geometry that's not coming through is the Doors, Windows, Balcony. 

Somewhere along the line, these are getting lost through the referencing process to the sheet file. We can't quite figure out what is going on here. We believe it might be to do with classes not being exported and maybe class overrides on viewports.

The only way they have exported the correct information on the DWG is by ticking the Export Design layer viewports as separate files, this isn't an ideal solution.

Please find attached the file in question and the relevant references. Also a screenshot of their referencing process and also the DWG export options. These are in 2020 format but we do have a link to the original 2017 files if needed.

We have been able to replicate this issue within Vectorworks 2017 which is the version this project is within, but also within Vectorworks 2019 and 2020 also. 

The Sheet file is: A2494 2100 Primary Setting Out

Sheet layer I have been testing with: CST-AA-BLA-01-DR-A-2101

I hope i have supplied everything that's needed,

Any help with this would be much appreciated. 

Many thanks 

Helen, Luka, and Adam.

VB-173558

Hardscape: Aligned Slab does not display surface hatch

Hello

A customer just asked this on the forum, so I looked into it with the attached file:

[https://forum.vectorworks.net/index.php?/topic/74356-question-re-surface-hatches-on-hardscapes/]

I have applied a Renderworks texture which contains a surface hatch to two hardscapes. One is a Slab and the other is an Aligned Slab. The Aligned Slab does not display the surface hatch in a hidden line view.

So, I tried various different types of 3D geometry, including Extrude, NURBS, 3D Polys, Mesh and Subdivision. All of these types DO display the surface hatch - even the Subdivision, which doesn't display the texture.
I am guessing that the aligned slab is actually a mesh under the covers. Is there any way it can display the surface hatch?
If you look at the forum post, the customer has included an image which shows why this is important.

VB-175823

ODBC: Connection fails from Vectorworks via CData to Airtable

Hello

I have a customer who wants to connect Vectorworks to Airtable, via ODBC. My first thought was that this can't be done. But there is a driver for Mac, made by CData, specifically for this purpose.

Airtable is a cloud-based database system. I've set up a trial account, which you are welcome to use:
[https://airtable.com/]

[tslatter@vectorworks.net|mailto:tslatter@vectorworks.net]

gaut6vat.HER7stot

APIkey: keyYUwtoCw5HraV1P

BaseID: appt77jzUh9mwIUds

Tablenames: Furniture

Within Airtable, I have created one of the example databases called Product Catalog, which has a table called Furniture. I thought this would be a good test to connect to some furniture symbols in Vectorworks. 

Now for the driver. It's not free, but you can get a trial licence. The driver is specifically for Airtable, and I have been able to successfully install it, and set up a user DSN, which tells me it has been successful. The key information I needed was the API for my Airtable account, an ID for the database, and the table name, which I have configured as in the attached screenshots, using the following instructions:
[http://cdn.cdata.com/help/JAF/odbc/pg_connectionodbcmac.htm]

When I test the connection within the ODBC manager, I am told that the connection is good and that I can use it.

Next, I go to Vectorworks and use the Tools > Database > Manage Databases command. I am able to see the DSN, so I select it and add my Airtable login credentials. The connection fails. 

When I attempt to refresh the connection, Vectorworks hangs.

I have attached a Spindump and Sample Process of the Vectorworks process when this happens in the hope that it might be useful.

Any idea what is going wrong here? User error on my part? 

I would love to get this going, as the Airtable product looks shiny and modern, and it's unusual to see a modern updated OBDC driver for Mac like the one from CData.

Any advice gratefully received.  		Vladislav Stanev

Following the acceptance test:

Using search mode find "Washington Monument".

Enable "Set the drawing origin at the selected location" and exit with OK.

The origin gets changed properly but the objects aren't placed correctly on the map. 		Vladislav Stanev
VB-168775

Hardscape | slope planning

Hello all!

Create 2 rectangles, convert them to hardscape, setting for hardscape = aligned, not interpolated, thickness 30cm. Click on the upper rectangle, use "Edit Surface Modifiers", create at each side one grade, use the red figures for grades. Check always the figures in the object info because sometimes the values of point 1 and point 2 have changed while closing the dialog box with "OK". Do the same with the lower rectangle in the file. Once you are ready "Exit Surface Modifier" change to a 3D ISO view and realign hardscapes. Look at the upper hardscape. The grades on the left and right side have changed. I did exactly the same with the hardscape right to the first ones. I always got a strange result. If I'm thinking wrong how to use the tool, please correct my approach. If I'm right the tool has no practical use for planning purposes.

See movie and vwx file.  

Kind regards

Frank 		Bozhidar Stanchev

VB-168898

Custom Cabinet object should not insert to wall centerline and break walls

# Create a new Blank Document
# Place a wall
# Insert any of the following objects into a wall:
Base Cabinet, Wall Cabinet, Utility Cabinet, or Shelving Unit
Notice they all only insert on a wall Edge with No Break - as expected.
# Insert a Custom Cabinet object in the wall

Notice the Custom Cabinet object only inserts on the centerline of the wall with a full break.

This is not expected.  The insertion should be the same as the other objects listed in step #3.

I set this as High Customer Importance because it disrupts the user's workflow and forces them to fiddle around with the Wall Insert and Break settings for each object after insertion. 		Konstantin Lalkovski
VB-172984

Clipcube rendering shows up in unrelated section viewport

I noticed this when editing my model and then updating a section viewport. I used the clip cube to isolate an object so I could edit it, and then while in multi view I updated the section viewport that showed the object I had edited. The section viewport had already been created and it was totally unrelated to the clip cube I was using in the model. The background rendering of the viewport is set to OpenGL and the foreground rendering is set to Hidden Line. When I updated the viewport, the red cut of the clip cube I was using in my model showed up in the OpenGL background rendering. This should not happen as the viewport rendering is based on the viewport settings, not the current model state.

There is a video and file attached. (The first half of the video shows other issues related to the clip cube but they are not addressed in this bug, please focus on the second half of this video for the purpose of this bug.) 		Justin Hutchison
VB-167626

Create Space Object from Shape does not adopt 3D height from Properties Dialog

As seen in the attached video, when creating a Space object from a shape, the resulting Space object does not take the 3D height set in the Properties dialog that is provided during the command.

In contrast, manually drawn Space objects do take on the 3D height set in the tool's defaults. 		Christopher Graye

Invoke the Create Objects from Shapes command
Set Object Type to Hardscape
Turn on Delete Source Shapes check box
Click Ok to close the dialog
Note that the hardscape isn’t visible on a drawing area but it’s selected in the OIP

VB-168420

Previous-Version Hardscapes Lose By-Class Texture Assignment in SP3

Note: this looks like it was caused by the 527831 change, which fixed VB-167570

I've attached a movie and test file that show this in SP3 build 527568 compared to build 528138. The file was created in VW 2018 and contains a Hardscape with a by-class texture applied in the Hardscape Settings dialog.

To reproduce, open the file in each build and go to the Draw 3D tab of the Hardscape Settings dialog.

In the older build, note that the Main Texture is set "By Class", which matches the 2018 setup.

In the newer build, note that the Main Texture has changed to a directly-applied texture.

If you open the file in VW 2019, save it, then open it in 2020 the problem doesn't happen, so this only seems to occur with older-version Hardscapes. 		Bozhidar Stanchev

VB-170163

2D Symbols: not selectable and disappear with Good Perf. and Comp.

The attached video shows the bug being reproduced.

The attached .vwx includes 2D Symbols of people, some of this Symbols are not possible to be selected. This same 2D faulty Symbols disappear when we change Navigation Graphics to Good Performance and Compatibility.

Like it is shown in the video, do the following:

1. Have Best Performance active, to see all 2D Symbols.
2. Try to select the ones shown in the video
- It will not be possible
3. Switch Navigation Graphics to Good Performance and Compatibility.
- The faulty Symbols will disappear from the drawing
4. Change to 3D View still with same Navigation Graphics
- The faulty Symbols will re-appear. 		Josh Loy
VB-175432

You will see the the IFC4 model exports the site model 97 metres away from where it should be. It is worth noting that if all other layers are deleted from the file, then the issue does not occur.

VB-169847

ALA: Data Manger / IFC data workflow inconsistency / questions

There are some things that aren’t really clear when it comes to some workflows concerning IFC data with and without the Data Manager in Vectorworks.

When we have a symbol (like a shower tub for the sanitary area) and want to attach IFC data to it, there are two ways that are available to our customers:
1. through the resource manager or
2. through the data manager

open attached file

1 - Resource Manager
a) right-click a symbol in the resource manager and select „IFC Data…“
b) type in „terminal“ and select „IfcSanitaryTerminalType“ > OK
c) click OK —> Error message: „The following field is mandatory and not set: PredefinedType“
d) As Enum value for selected property select „Shower“ > OK
—> message: The „IFC Data“ command will attach IFC data to all existing and future instances of a symbol. > OK

After inserting the symbol it has the IFC data attached as expected.


2 - Data Manager
a) Open Tools > Data Manager…
b) on the left side (objects) select the symbol definition
c) click „Add Data Set…“
d) type in „terminal“ and select „IfcSanitaryTerminalType“ > OK
—> notice: we weren’t asked about the „mandatory“ field >>PredefinedType<<

After inserting the symbol it has no IFC data attached. Why?


Further questions:
Are both ways working as they should?
If they aren’t, how should they be working?
Which workflow has which benefits over the other?
What should we tell our customers?

 

[~fsaenger] 		Mihail Rizov
VB-169141

There are 2 bugs:
1. Walls that run across the slope do not adjust correctly with the 'Fit Walls to object' tool.

2. The same walls are not exported correctly in the IFC export. 		Mihail Rizov

-> The group stays at its original position.

-> The rest of the symbol is where you have moved it to. 		Mihail Rizov

VB-175928

FS: IFC4 Export Options Separat Instances of Walls with Openings

In IFC4 it is not possible to export the components of a wall with openings, although in the Data Manager the setting "Export Options" - "Separat Instances" is set to "True".

If the wall has no openings like windows inside the components are separated.

If you use IFC 2x3 the components are separated also in walls with openings inside. 		Mihail Rizov

VB-168061

Incorrect attributes applied to aligned hardscape on IFC export

When exporting an aligned hardscape to IFC, it takes the color attribute from the bottom component of the slab in the hardscape and applies that to the whole hardscape. Mihail Rizov
VB-167391

FS: Export IFC - No value in IfcWall(StandardCase) / Pset_WallCommon / ThermalTransmittance

Hi - first of all: Happy new Year 2020 !

I don't know if this is a real bug....:

I can not find a possibility to leave this field completely empty:

IfcWall or IfcWallStandardCase / Pset_WallCommon / ThermalTransmittance

 

Usecase:

If you use a IFC file for a thermal calculation, the inner walls mustn't have any value, because they have to be ignored. The goal is really to leave this field empty - a value like 0,00 means that the wall has an infinite good value. 		Mihail Rizov
VB-167424

Symbol Loses IFC Data When Copy/Pasted to Another File or Referenced

I've attached two test files that show this. The "Original Symbols" file contains a bunch of symbols with IFC data attached, which were created by a user. The "Pasted Symbols" file has the same symbols copy-pasted into it.

To reproduce:

-Export both files to IFC format
-Open the exported files in Solibri or another BIM app

Note that most of the symbols fail to show in the "Pasted Symbols" file, since their IFC data was removed during the copy-paste.

The same problem occurs if the original symbols exist in a referenced source file, and an IFC export is done from the target file.

The same thing happens in previous versions. 		Mihail Rizov

VB-170222

IFC: What relevance does geographic location have?

Please find attached, strictly confidentially, an IFC from a project in Paris.

We have successfully until now coordinated all our model data.

We have just received this IFC and I am unsure of how it has been issued and subsequently edited.

You can see if you view the IFC in Solibri first, that the file is georeferenced, but also located correctly in terms of X and Y coordinates.

It is also located correctly relative to the Z axis.  The reference elevation is 58.25m and the geometry reports dZ value of the same on the ground floor of 'BatB'.

However, if you import this into Vectorworks 2019 or 2020, none of the layer elevations are correct, when compared to the IFC levels.  These are actually the levels set by the user in Revit.

I have the Revit file also but probably cannot issue it.  If you have any questions about the settings let me know. 		Mihail Rizov

VB-170564

With the dimension selected chose the 2D reshape tool

Place a selection window around one end of the dimension

Notice the dimension does not stretch, instead the entire dimension moves.

A&A 		Josh Loy
VB-167579

DMX address and Absolute Address are not properly reverse translated if the file is created in 2020

If you create a new file in 2020 and assign Universe, DMX address, Absolute address in 2020 and export to 2019 only the Universe value is preserved.

On export the DMX address should be mapped to the U Address in 2019

The Absolute Address should be mapped to Address in 2019.

Files converted from 2019 to 2020 back to 2019 don't have this issue, it's only files that began in 2020 that will show the problem.

Files 		Kevin Linzey

VB-174284

Plugin objects created within a symbol are created at wrong elevation

See the attached test file

3D and hybrid objects within symbols can be assigned a very un-useful 'Z' elevation at creation.

Frequently, constantly, all the time, I create unit plan symbols that I use to assemble apartment buildings. 

Frequently, the hybrid objects (walls, doors, windows, coat rods and others) are created at an elevation relative to sea level. They should be created relative to the symbol origin.

Huge problem, unnecessary and makes VW very hard to use in 3D.

Please make it a priority to fix this. It has been an issue since VW 2010. I would be happy to help resolve it in anyway I can.

  		Rick Berge

VB-172662

Focus Dialog Lighting Device Feedback Not Shown In Multiple View Panes

When using the new Focus Lighting Devices dialog with Multiple View Panes, the feedback is only displayed in the active view pane. In previous betas this was not the case. There is a great advantage to being able to see the focus feedback on two different view panes as you can clearly see the height of the tilt as well as the spears of the pan. This important functionality has now been lost and it makes the new focus dialog less desirable.  Josh Loy

VB-174610

A customer has contacted me saying he has been experiencing random crashing with his Vectorworks.

I have attached a crash log generated and there are a couple of crashes reported on analytics with these serial numbers:

EGXMKZ-TZXKQL-ZCZNZZ-G0NW0T

EFXMKZ-9Z0K6R-Z8Z0ZH-G0NW0T

The customer says the only similarity with the crashing is that all files use the same template that has been with them since 2019.

 

They have also said that the crashing causes there to be no back up files generated. They are saving the files onto there G drive. The back up files are not being backed up to the server.

I have a hunch that the crashing is linked with the file being saved in the G drive that is being synced with there server.

I have made sure that Vectorworks has full disk access. We have tried reset user folders etc. But I am stumped what could be causing the issue.

 

I wonder if you can shed some light on this from the crash logs etc.

VB-176038

Open user1.vwxw. Update the viewport (I changed scale). Save and commit.

Changing the layer or zooming fixes the problem.

VB-168091

Styled Wall Thickness can be edited in Object Info palette when selected with unstyled Wall

# Open the attached VWX file
You will see an unstyled wall and a styled wall.
The styled wall is at the bottom of the stacking order.
# Select both walls
NOTICE the Thickness parameter is enabled in the Object Info palette.  It should be disabled.
# Enter a new Thickness (make it larger then the styled wall so you can see the change)
NOTICE the styled wall's thickness incorrectly changes along with the unstyled wall. 		Christopher Graye
VB-169474

VS SetObjWallBreakMode: fails on round walls, needs a regen and redraw

The vector script routine SetObjWallBreakMode should set the break mode of an inserted symbol or plug-in instances.

 

Please open the attached file, it contains two scripts: one for changing an inserted symbol in straight walls, one for round walls.

Walls: SetObjWallBreakMode takes a regen of the wall + a redraw to show the new settings

Round Walls: SetObjWallBreakMode fails altogether!

Tested on VW 2019 and 2020.

This was one of the most difficult tasks to be resolved in VS without SetObjWallBreakMode, took years to have this routine! 		Christopher Graye

VB-173687

Multiple selection: impossible to enable/disable icon buttons while key pressed

In a list browser, for example the details class list of the organisation dialog, you wish to select multiple rows and change something in the visibility buttons.
* While the shift (Mac) /ctrl (win) key is pressed, select some rows -> the rows are selected
* click on one of the visibility icons

--> Mac: the chosen visibility option is performed for all selected rows (see screenshot)

--> Win: you must release the ctrl key in order to be able to change the visibility! As long as the key is pressed, the icon buttons cannot be edited.

Regression 		Ian Lane

--> when the geometries don't intersect, the lines look correct

Case 2: section viewport of NURBS geometry

1) open file Viewport-customer-file-KBNK-02.vwx

VB-175397

Renderworks SLVPs Export/Publish BLANK

Hi,

We have many users in our market that depend on 2020 for many months longer than most users as they must await the release of ExtraGroup's Interiorcad plugin to be adapted for the new version. So I'm hopeful we can get a fix for this included in 2020's SP6. 

Sheet Layer Viewports set to use Renderworks modes: 
* Are indicated as 'out-of-date' as soon as they are updated. 
* Render in the Sheet Layer as blank/empty. 
* Are _always_ absent in the resulting PDF (Using Export or Publish). 
* BUT they can be made visible if the render mode is change to an alternative Renderworks mode after the Viewport is updated. 

*This issue only occurs in some files*, but every time in those files. Therefore: _Even if a fix can't be achieved in 2020_, it would be *great* if you could tell me what condition causes this problem so I can help our customers avoid it. 

I've determined that: 
* Turning ON 'None fill uses Alpha Transparency' helped one user, but not his colleague. 
* Having doc pref 'Save Viewport Cache' doesn't prevent this problem. 
* Opening in 2021, then exporting to 2020 doesn't correct the problem or its cause. 
* Resetting Vectorworks Preferences doesn't correct the problem or its cause. 

The test workflow is: 
# (Adjust Viewport settings in OIP as-required). 
# File > Export > Export to PDF… OR File > Publish… > (to PDF)
# Page range 3 to 3

*Can you please advise what condition causes this problem?* 

Thanks! 

Jeremy  		Justin Hutchison

VB-167388

Tangents to circle incorrect

There is a topic on the Techboard by Benson Shaw about tangents to circles being incorrect.

I did my own testing and verified the problem.  Neither tangent connection is correct and they are both different so the error is not even mirrored.  

The angle between the tangent line and the radius line should be 90° in both cases and each is less than that, but not the same. 		Josh Loy

Viewports: 1/02 and 5/06

Compare the screenshots: US-Version.png and DE-Version.png

The Line Type is seen with the same size (width) in both Viewports when using the German Version (DE-Version.png), but when we open the same file with the US Version, then the Line Type is shown much smaller in the Viewport 1/02 (US-Version.png)

Now comparing the Viewport 1/02 between both US and German Versions. If we double click the Viewport and enter Edit Mode, we see that in both versions the Line Type has the same size (small) like the size shown in the US Version Viewport. With the German Version the Line Type is seen much bigger (width wise) in the Viewport view of the German Version, just like its seen in the Viewport 5/06.

Questions:

1. US-Version: why is the Line Type doesn't have the same size in both Viewports? Its the same Line Type, should appear with the same width, be it in Viewport view or Edit mode.

2. German Version: Line Type is seen with the same size in both Viewport views, but when going into Edit Mode of the Viewport 1/02, the Line Type is shown much small just like its shown in the US-Version. Is this expected?

There is no consistency in how the Line Type is represented. Is there ideas why this is happening? 		Josh Loy

VB-173192

Railing and Curtainwall issues

There are a series of issues that I'm having a hard time figuring out. This file was created in 2020 and brought up into 2021 a few weeks ago.  There have been at least 5 2021 autobuild versions used for this file.  Most of the railings and curtainwalls were previously created without complication in 2020.  Meaning, they were accurately created and represented in the model as per the expectation.  Since using 2021 there have been a few more railings created in various locations (particularly on the roof).  I started to notice strange things beginning on this past Monday afternoon (build 559335 was installed Monday morning).

The first thing noticed was that the custom symbol post used for the railings went corrupt resulting in a gap in the posts.  Later that day, many (not all) of the railings vanished from the file.  They were not turned off, they were gone.  Alternately, many of the curtainwalls had visibility issues.  They could not be seen but could be selected and bumped to regain their visibility.     

Yesterday, I adjusted the custom post symbol which regained the correct appearance for the railing assembly.  Additionally, I copied and pasted railings from an older version of the file to replace those that went missing.  However, after several hours of working on various parts of the file, many of the railings disappeared again without prompting, notification or warning.  

Vwx file, photos and a video are attached including pics of backup files that show various states of the issues occurring that were not noticed while working on the file.  Let me know if you'd like me to walk you through the issues in more detail or via a screen share.

 

  		Josh Loy

VB-168407

Big customer: corrupted construction layer

A big customer of ours is having huge problems with several files, most of which are very likely related to referencing issues. Some files take almost an hour to open up, which obviously impacts their productivity.

 

The problems with this file are two-fold:
1) one of the construction layers (--Erdgeschoss--) is corrupted with ghost objects
2) referencing certain construction layers into a viewport in a blank new file, takes forever

The two important questions are:
a) Is it possible to restore the corrupted layer(s) and can it be done in a timely manner?
b) What is the underlying cause for the long loading process when referencing these layers into a viewport? Can we tell our customer a sure fire way to avoid a constallation where this is more likely to happen? (Do's & Don'ts?)

Problem 1: (see video)
Files attached: 258-BF11-Haus-5-v2019.vwx and 258-BF11-Haus-5-v2020.vwx
1) Open file in 24.0.6 (522773), 25.0.2 (523565) or 25.0.3b (529360)
2) Classes visible (all), layers visibe (--Erdgeschoss–)
3) Select all: 20 objects
4) Deselect lower half: still 20 objects selected
5a) Select all section viewports using the "select similar" tool: OIP says 7, but only 4 are visibly selected.
5b) When deselecting the lowest viewport the count in the OIP doesn't change
5c) When deselecting all visible viewports, 4 are left.
5d) When doing any of the following actions while having those 4 left selected, VW will hang (or maybe just take an absurd amount of time):
   * move (using the duplicate tool)
   * Update (OIP)
   * set a number for X or Y
6) On 2019 SP6 (Mac) and 2020 SP2 (Windows) two ghost viewports are always visible, on 2019 SP6 (Windows) and 2020 SP2 (Mac) these are only visible when zooming.



Problem 2:
1) Open new blank file
2) draw a rectangle
3) create new viewport using the attached file as source using the settings shown in the screenshot.
4) VW will hang (or take an absurd amount of time) when activating only the following construction layer (all being set to invisible):
   * --Erdgeschoss--
   * Haus 2_03
   * Haus 2_02
   * Haus 2_01
   * Haus 2_00
   * Haus 2_U1

VB-170178

The live previews of the Mirror, Rotate, and Move by Points tools are incorrect for layer plane objects when screen plane objects are also selected

Please note that in the attached movie and Vectorworks file, the Plane of the Rectangle on the left is Screen and the Plane of the Rectangle on the right in Layer.

To duplicate this issue:
# Open the attached "Screen and Layer Plane Objects.vwx" file.
# Select the two Rectangles in the file.
# Navigate to a view such that the orientation of the Rectangle on the Layer Plane is not the same as that Rectangle's orientation would be if it was on the Screen Plane (e.g., navigate to an isometric view).
# Use the Mirror, Rotate, or Move by Points tool on the selected Rectangles.
# Note that the live previews for both of the selected Rectangles is drawn as if the Plane of both Rectangles was Screen.
# Select only the Screen Plane objects in the file.
# Use the same tool used in Step 4.
# Note that the live previews are correct.
# Select only the Layer Plane objects in the file.
# Use the same tool used in Steps 4 and 7.
# Note that the live previews are correct.

 

To see a demonstration of this issue, watch the attached movie.  		Josh Loy

VB-169026

Persistent Origin Shift on project

Please see the attached two files from a customer.

They have had problems with geometry shifting many times in these files. We have been in to see them, and explained the importance of having a common set of coordinates over the internal origin. However, when they open this project, they find that the Topo (and other references not included in the bundle) shift way out of alignment.

I cannot see a reason for it, other than the fact that they want to keep their files saved in a rotated plan view. The reference is a design layer viewport reference, so there is no option to ignore user origin in source file (although these should be the same anyway after my work).

When we first received these files, the coordinates on the internal origin were not the same. So, I fixed them using the large circle over a common reference point method, and then centred the geometry. All was well when I left their office, but now it's happening again and I can't see a reason for it. 

I also tested moving the files to 2020, but the same thing is happening. 

Any pointers very gratefully received. 

I hope you are all OK working in isolation. It's very strange... 		Rick Berge

VB-174819

After hitting OK in Create viewport dialog, I see many asserts, please, see attached, and empty viewport is created. 		Rick Berge
VB-174585

Duplicate layer send twice ObjectStateData_ObjectCreated

Create a single parametric object in a layer.

Add new breakpoint in _LLSendCreateNotification where ObjectStateData_ObjectCreated is constructed.

Duplicate the layer and note that the ObjectCreated state is send twice.

 

The problem comes from SendCreateNotification. It's called once for the layer itself, where it traverses all its children nodes, and once for each of the contained nodes, see call stacks.

 

Further testing shows even more problems: When the create state is send by traversing the layer, parametric object's parent is the source layer, not the duplicated one. When the state is send for the duplicated parametric object, it's sill not inserted in the document - it's parent is null.

Testing the different duplication methods, only the Paste command sends ObjectCreated state when the parametric object is added in the destination container. Other duplication menus (duplicate, duplicate array) and tools (Rotate, move by points) send creation states before adding the object to the destination container. 		Rick Berge
VB-174485

Selecting Edges Difficult in Perspective

Trying to use the Fillet Edge tool in perspective projection often proves difficult and unreliable. In the attached screen recording you can see that it fails to recognize various edges of the shape, but as soon as I switch to orthogonal projection it works like a charm.

While this example shows the Fillet Edge tool, this issue likely applies to all edge-based selections like Chamfer Edge, Extract, etc. (I don't think this is specific to any particular build - it's an issue I've been noticing for quite a while).

These processes needs to work just as easily in perspective as they do in orthogonal.

Josh Loy

VB-171777

To reproduce:

-Open any file
-Activate the Asset Library tool and click to place, then click a second time to set the rotation

Note that the tool remains active and the library window remains closed.

-Now place another instance, but this time double-click

Note that now the library window pops back up and the instance doesn't get placed. The active tool also changes to the

Users might want to place several instances quickly without worrying about rotation, so ideally the library window wouldn't pop back up. The user can always use the mode bar button to get back to the window if needed. 		Justin Hutchison

VB-174187

Some Dashed Hidden Lines display, render and publish as solid lines

Summary: 

Whether rendering in Design Layer or in Sheet Layer VP's (Section Viewports or Cropped plain viewports); Some vertical lines that should render as dashed lines (because they are obscured) _sometimes_ render as dashed, but *are more often rendering as solid*. This does not affect all obscured vertical lines. 

I suspect this might relate to one or more of [the many issues submitted regarding Dashed Hidden Line|https://forum.vectorworks.net/index.php?/search/&q=Dashed%20Hidden%20Line&quick=1&search_and_or=and&search_in=titles], in particular this one: VB-157617: Dashed Hidden Line shows solid lines as dashed, misses other lines entirely in sections [Stephan Mönninghoff]

See screen recording for obvious demo/explanation and client's published PDF. 

See my copy of their file, 'Wolfgram KG '20.09.15 Tech Support TEST.vwx' 		Josh Loy
VB-173524

Site Model Randomly Fails to Display Fills in Section Viewport : JBC

Open the attached Vectorworks 2020 file to see two section viewports with identical settings on a sheet layer. The top one has a fill which is correct. The bottom one doesn't which is incorrect. The site model is clean and well constructed with no modifier conflicts.

Now navigate to the 'SITE - Proposed Site Model' and not the two section lines there. The upper one is for the correct section viewport, the lower on for the incorrect section viewport.

Select the lower section line and move it -1000mm then return to the sheet layer and update the viewport. The fill will now display. If you randomly locate the section line, the fill will randomly appear sometimes and not others.

As you can appreciate this behaviour can be very frustrating for users who think the problem is with some setting they have missed.

Thanks. 		Josh Loy

VB-172817

Default Class for PIO Styles: "Use at Creation" class attributes not working

Context: https://forum.vectorworks.net/index.php?/topic/71992-t01946-–-editable-document-coordination-markers/&tab=comments#comment-358370

 

• Create a class (such as "2D-Section Lines") and set the class attributes to be blue and a particular Line Style. Check the "Use at Creation" checkbox.

• Independently from that, create a Section-Elevation Line Style.

• Go to the RM, right click and choose "Plug-In Object Style Options" and set the Default Class to "2D-Section Lines" and make the class "By Style" so that all instances insert on to that class automatically.

• Make the Active Class "None" and set the Attributes Palette to NOT be by-class (such as white fill, solid black line).

• Insert an instance of the Section-Elevation Line style. It inserts correctly on to the "2D-Section Lines" class, but the Attributes for that instance remain as black and white, rather than by style (blue dashed).

• This is inconsistent with how the "Use at Creation" checkbox usually works. I would expect that the Attributes for this newly-created object would end up By Class regardless of my Attributes Palettes setting. 		Christopher Graye
VB-172774

T01757 Material Report Complexity

Essentially what we're trying to do is say how much of material is there in the project, whether its in an extrude, a subdivision, a wall, a slab, a hardscape etc. then to also know who the manufacturer is, how much it costs and its lambda and acoustic etc.

 

Also Ideally the report would automatically know what materials are available in the project to generate itself as materials are likely to change from project to project and during a project.

Again this might be my limited worksheet knowledge

 

In the attached file the coloured worksheets show what Ive managed to get out but its very convoluted and you don't seem to be able to report materialproperty() data for component based objects.

I know others are looking at this so they may have further comments for customer requirtements.

VB-172259

Severe slowdown dealing with imported DWGs

We frequently get sent DWGs that only have paper space entities (often exported from Revit or AutoCAD Steel). Our workflow is to import these into VectorWorks, tidy up the geometry (removing notes etc), copy and paste the geoetry into a design layer, then apply a scale factor to scale it up to the correct size.

In the attached file - which is typical - selecting content causes VW2021 to run extremely slowly. This is on Windows 10, latest build, Dell Precision 7910 with dual Xeon processors, 32GB RAM, 4GB FirePro with latest certified drivers for SolidWorks.

 

In particular  -selecting the 3D views to delete these takes around 10 mins to process.

Then selecting the notes CHS88.9x5 in the upper view and hitting delete takes 3-4 seconds each.

 

For comparison I tested importing this into Rhino 6 and selection is near instantaneous. 		Hugues Tsafak

VIDEO 1: You can see how snappy and fast OSX is with zooming, and spinning this model in OSX Preview.
VIDEO 2: When imported into Vectorworks, it totally conks out. Zooming and orbit is slow, and double-click into it to give the meshes a ‘fill’ becomes a fatal operation
SOFA.STL: This is the file that was used in Videos 1 and 2

VB-170378

Palettes on Windows do not update their size when there's a change in DPI

In the attached video (DPI bug.MOV), moving a palette from a 1K monitor (scale factor = 125%) to a 4K monitor (scale factor = 225%) results in a really small palette on the 4K monitor, and the cursor is no longer on the palette even though it's still being dragged.

  		Ian Lane
VB-170041

Connection Lost while using Camera Remotes (Polish test build - Android)

While using Camera Remotes, the connection was lost each time. Lyuben Hadzhipopov
VB-170235

Vectorscript Function Reference on Developer.Vectorworks.net missing sections

The Vectorscript Function reference posted on developer.vectorworks.net is missing sections that are included in the HTML version shipping with VW2020.

The sections on Protection and SpaceObjectCoreTools are not in the online reference.

Also the online version has a different sort order than the shipping version. Categories that are abbreviation are sorted to the top of the beginning letter in the online version and sort correctly alphabetically in the shipping version. This included PDF, ODBC, GIS. 		Vladislav Stanev
VB-170264

Surface Sculpting tools fails to give a preview in 2021

This is partially regression from 2020 and also within 2021
Try to use all the tools from Surface sculpting and red highlighting preview is missing.
First tool issue is a regression with in 2021
Other tools regression from 2020 		Josh Loy
VB-170052

VW Freezes/Crashes When Creating Symbol After Undo

I've attached a movie and test file that show this. The file contains a few instances of two world-based Symbols (one 2D Symbol and one 3D Symbol). 

To reproduce:

-Select the two symbols at the top of the drawing
-Create a symbol using Page-based units
-Now Undo the symbol creation
-Group the objects
-Create a symbol from the Group

Note that now VW (usually) freezes. You may have to Undo and repeat the steps a few times to see the problem.

If I skip any of the steps the freeze won't occur.

Using the same steps, I've also seen this crash a few times on Mac. It doesn't happen consistently though and didn't generate a crash log.

If I try this on Windows 10 I get a consistent crash (dump file attached).

I don't see this in VW 2020 so it looks like a 2021 regression.
  		Rick Berge
VB-170199

'Convert To Polys' Command Shows objects Beyond Section Cut Plane within Test Fiel

I've attached a short movie that shows this issue

 

-Open test file 

-The section is already created. It was created from the viewport 

-Select the section and do a: Convert > Convert copy to Lines

-Move the result then do another : Move > Move copy to Polygons

- Notice the result from the 'Convert to Lines" is more accurate , I think. The result from 'Copy to Polygons" shows the symbol and planar object from behind the wall. These objects ought not to show in this case. 

The same behavior in VW2020 Sp4 		Josh Loy

I've attached a short movie that shows this issue

* View> Create Section Viewport...( Draw a vertical line that starts on the left side of the horizontal portion of the roof)
* Move section to the side 
* Right click the section and select "Edit Section In-Place" via the context menu
* Go to a 3D view
* Notice the cut appears wrong as it shows slicing the top portion of the roof. Note the section is cutting through the roof vertically. While what you see looks like a horizontal section cut? The cut graphics being out place was reported a few weeks ago.

VB-169977

Vectorworks Remote lists saved views in different order than Vectorworks

See attached screenshots. Nomad lists saved views alphanumerically but treating 2 digit numbers as a different series than 1 digit numbers. Vectorworks lists them correctly as a single series with "1" coming before "4b". Nomad should list them just like Vectorworks; the user must currently renumber Vectorworks saved views with a uniform number of digits in their prefix when using Nomad such that they list in the desired order on the device app. Lyuben Hadzhipopov

Geoimage is only shown as a white Area

Best regards, Marc  		Bozhidar Stanchev
VB-168751

Importing .ECW file (Georeferenced image format) aligns the image with the internal origin and not the geographic origin

After importing a shape file and accepting the coordinate and projection settings from the shape files projection settings, a user, importing a georeferenced image object onto a layer with georeferencing enabled would expect that the shape file and the image file would line up.  The only way to achieve this is to set the user origin to match the geographic origin which is not the preferred workflow as it results in sites being very long distances from the internal origin.  

To reproduce

Unzip the attached shape file archive

Open a new blank VW file.

import the attached shape file named 'am24-1v01_CadastralPolygons.shp'

In the import dialog ensure the radio button "Import the GIS features in the shapefile's coordinate system' is on.

In the import dialog ensure that 'Set the document's coordinate system to match' is checked.

OK

Zoom to fit objects

Edit the settings for Design Layer -1 to turn on ensure the checkbox for "Georeferencing' is turned on.

Make Design layer-1 active.

Import the attached .ecw file (this image should correspond with the geometry from the shape file.

Leave the import image options as default and ok

Note that the image imported does NOT line up with the geometry from the shape file but that the coordinates seem to match the user coordinate location. (This is the problem)  

If you place a GIS stake at the lower left corner of the image and set the display to 'Coordinate Point(XY)' you get the same value as the name of the file would suggest.  At this point the user origin is the same as the internal origin. (see file "TEST 1.vwx)

Using "Tools>Origin>User Origin set the user origin to match the georeferencing coordinate system

Note that the GIS Stake no longer shows the same xy coordinates as the file would suggest is correct (This is expected)

Import the image again.  Note that the image comes in at the same location as before. This confirms that it is not using the user origin.

Place a GIS stake at 0,0   with the display set to Coordinate Point (NE) units Meters.

Zoom to fit.

Change the display to 'Coordinates (XY)' to confirm that the NE and the XY are now the same.

Using the geolocate tool in the "Locate Mode" click on the insertion point of the O,O stake.

Note that the xy coordinates change as expected 

Using Tools>Origin>User Origin set the user origin to match the Georeferencing coordinate system.  Note that the XY coordinates are now aligned with the geographic coordinate system which is aligned with the internal origin.

Import the image file again.  Zoom to fit.  Note that the image file now aligns with the shape file imported earlier.  (TEST 2.vwx)

Why is this a bug.  When importing a georeferenced image into a georeferenced layer the user would expect that the image is placed correctly with regard to the Geographic Coordinate system.  The workaround is too involved and, because it relocated the internal origin remote from the 'site' is not good practice and doesn't work with the workflows shown in the training videos. 		Bozhidar Stanchev
VB-169105

Black Background of Geoimage

Hi Vectorworks

Sometime the background of the Geoimage File ist black. This is a bad behavior for use the fill style "None".

Best regards, Marc 		Vladislav Stanev
VB-171173

Geolocate "Select Service" Dialog Shows the Wrong Portal Selected Service is on Page 2+ of the Browser

This is a continuation of VB-169160.

The attached movie shows this from a blank file. To reproduce:

-Activate the Geolocate tool and open its preferences
-Choose "ArcGIS Living Atlas" as the ArcGIS Portal and log in (I'm using a free public account here)
-In the list browser, switch to page 2+ and select a web service, then click OK
-Now open the preferences dialog again

Note that the list browser and the "Browse for a service from:" checkboxes now show "basemap" as the active portal.

If you choose a service on page 1 of the list browser, this problem won't happen. 		Vladislav Stanev
VB-174228

When a Light is created by double-clicking the Light tool, the created Light is displayed as "No Selection" in the OIP.

When a Light is created by double-clicking the Light tool, the created Light is displayed as "No Selection" in the OIP even though it is selected.

-It does not occur when the "Position" setting in the Create Light dialog is "Next Click".
-It does not occur if the drawing already has the same type of Light.

Reproduction procedure:
1. Open a new document.
2. Double-click the Light tool.
3. Confirm that the "Position" setting in the Create Light dialog is "Active Layer Plane", and click OK.
4. The OIP displays "No Selection" even though the Light is placed in the drawing and is in the selected state.

Please refer to "12330.mov".

 

Best regards,
Takaaki Mizuno
A&A 		Justin Hutchison
VB-173175

Marionette: Get 3D Info starts returning 0 for width after a while

Attached is a half finished Marionette. Changing any of the object node's parameters in the OIP will break the Marionette and all objects are no longer placed where they should go but in a straight line or even all at the same coordinate. I was able to narrow it down to the Get 3D Info node. Replace the first Get 3D Info node with the Get Width node and everything returns to normal.

Another thing with this Marionette is that it will freeze VWX if debugged from within the object. (Switch the Marionette Tool to debug and click on a wire).
Thanks 		Konstantin Lalkovski
VB-171955

User has submitted 2 files.  The desired marionette script is found in 01_Marionette Object Library. User imports that script and associated objects into the 02_Raised Panel Fails file.

Running the script in 02 results in a single panel with no detail.  Importing the script into any new blank file will result in the script working. 		Konstantin Lalkovski

VB-175812

Window Insertion Into Wall F's Up Texture Alignment

See attached file. I have wondered for years why simple wall textures (like horizontal siding) constantly seem to need re-alignment. This might be the answer: when a window is inserted into a wall it messes with the texture alignment.

Step 1: Open file. Note that the siding texture aligns perfectly at the corner where the two walls intersect.

Step 2: Insert the window into the wall (the one to which it is aligned, in Top/Plan). Note that the wall texture has moved. 

This is unbelievably bad. Please fix it ASAP.

Thanks! 		Christopher Graye
VB-174288

sanitizer crash in DV criteria check

Attached vwx file triggers a sanitizer crash for me every time.

I suspect that we're walking off the end of the Handle's data when parsing its stack symbols.

Don't know if it's a bug in the parser code, needing to know a size limit, or if we're not putting a terminator on DVs data, or something else. We have mucked with material functions and their numbers of parameters, but it shouldn't be that. 		Karthick Chilaka

VB-169077

Worksheet has spaces in front of fields after export

When exporting the worksheet from the “Jeff Reeks Worksheet Blank Test” document, the resulting file in a text editor or Excel will have a space in front of the first character in the left column.  The “TEST WORKSHEET” file demonstrates this.

This worksheet originated from the attached “BeMatrix Symbols” Vectorworks file, and the worksheet is “ModEx Hiretrack 3/16/20  2:31:09 PM”. 

This issue will also happen when copying and pasting these into a blank file, but not when copying/pasting directly into Excel.
