VB-173367

sanitizer crash in BindNameReferences

Opening the file attached to VB-173359 is an example of what the sanitizer flagged for me.  BindNameReferences is called, and ultimately a ptr_skip_namereference runs right off the end of the handle.  It's actually coming from Datavis parsing a criteria, not a worksheet.
 
The direct cause is probably that we changed MaterialProperties to take a material name and a property name.  The file is likely from slightly earlier, when it took a single property parameter and inferred the material from the object/criteria. 
 
 
I wonder if all the Bind* stuff should be refactored to have an end limit that goes along with the starting pointer.  strncpy-ish.  It always starts from a handle or celldata, and we should know the cliff at the end.
  		Karthick Chilaka
VB-174005

Data Visualization doesn't accept dot in criteria

The attached video shows the problem being reproduced.

Open the attached .vwx file and open Edit Data Visualization. Go to Define Criteria and switch the comma from 2,1 to a dot, making it 2.1 ..afterwards click OK and then OK again to close the Dialog.

When going back to the "Define Criteria" dialog, we can see that the comma is again in place and not the dot.

Customers believe that the dot should be allowed to be used with the same function has the comma, because the format of some other software is with a dot and not a comma. 		Karthick Chilaka
VB-175848

Worksheet: mathematical formulas

Hi Vectorworks

I get two reports with the same criterions (area and layer) on the same worksheet. When I want to so a division between the both total areas from report lists, it works in a neutral cell. If the formula is in a cell in the report list with the larger total area, the result is the same as in the neutral cell. If I add the formula to the smaller value, the result is 0. Strange is when the result from the neutral cell is taken over in a cell form a report list. Here too, gets me two different results. When the result is taken over in the report list with the smaller total area, the result changes to a #DIV 0! value. In the bigger total area the result is 0.
I suspect it shouldn't be like that and it should work in every cell. Or are there special rules for formulas for report lists?
I attache my test file a a movie with my steps.

Thanks for testing.

Best regards, Denis

Karthick Chilaka

VB-169086

Worksheet still totally mess up the first column when importing from Excel

In the 1st cell of the column the paste is perfect, but every cell below that has a space and line return added before the data, causing all the numbers to fail to show, even though they are there.  If I paste the exact same data into the second column, it pastes as expected.  This is a very longstanding BUG and it drives me crazy.

VB-172545

Despite setting the units to "kilometers",if I export the 3D PDF and use the Acrobat's 3D Dimension Tool, the unit will always be in meters.

--------------------------
Target environment
--------------------------
Mac/Win
v2017~v2020
--------------------------
About Problem
--------------------------
Despite setting the units to "kilometers",if I export the 3D PDF and use the Acrobat's 3D Dimension Tool, the unit will always be in meters.

Steps:
1) Set the Units setting to "kilometers".
2) Draw an Extrude.
3) Export 3D PDF (3D).
4) Open the PDF file with Acrobat.

*To make 3D, click "?" on the upper left.
*To use the 3D Dimension Tool, click the "Rotate" icon in the upper left.

5) Despite setting the units to "kilometers",all are expressed in "meters" in Acrobat.

・VW: 10 milons → Acrobat: 0.01 meters
・VW: 1000 micron → Acrobat: 1 meter
・VW: 10 mm → Acrobat: 10 meters
・VW: 1000 mm → Acrobat: 1000 meters
・VW: 10 meters → Acrobat: 1000000 meters
・VW: 100 meters → Acrobat: 100000000 meters

Please refer to "movie12274.mov", "Untitled1_v2015.vwx".

*Remarks*
*According to the user, he said that it is operating normally with v2016.
(Millimeters are millimeters, meters are meters, kilometers are kilometers)

*He said that it's impossible to work and use above v2017.

*He said that it would be difficult to continue VSS because he has to use Vectorworks that was three generations older than the user policy.

Best regards,
Rie Ichimura
A&A

  		Justin Hutchison

VB-167677

Schematic view: An additional association appears when you delete the video screen from  the model or copy/paste MR+SL

Draw a Stright\Curved truss

Attach a Video screen to the truss

Select the two objects

Create a schematic view

Verify the associations ( To verify the associations you can use the test script menu command located in //depot/Engineering/Documents/Tests/VW26/Vertical Products/Spotlight/Assoc Load Rigging.vsm)

The associations are correct

Delete the video screen from the model

Verify the associations again

2 )

Copy MR+SL then Paste

Verify the associations

Note that a new association appears

 

 3)

Copy ML+SL then Paste

Verify the associations

Note that a new association appears

 

4)

Draw a Straight truss

Create a Schematic view

Undo the creating of the Schematic view

Verify the associations

Note that a new association appears

 

5)

Copy MR+ML+SL then Paste

Verify the associations

Note that a new association appears

VB-168321

DMX Patch: The Channel field should be empty when you patch two or more items

To reproduce:

Open DMX Patch dialog

Select the two lighting devices

Set Patch Settings to Patch all fields

Note that all fields in the Patch Settings group are 0 only the Increment field is 1

The Channel field in the Patch Settings group should be empty because if you set Universe and Address

and click the Patch button then one of the lighting devices will have channel <Unpatched> 		Kevin Linzey

VB-170812

Poly-Based Structural Members Have Extra Vertices in VW 2021

The attached movie and test file show this in VW 2020 compared to VW 2021. The file contains a poly-based SM object.

To reproduce, open the file in each version and activate the Reshape tool with the SM selected.

In VW 2020, note that the filleted corners of the SM only have one vertex, making it easy to drag the corners to a new location.

In VW 2021 note that there are extra vertices on the corners, making them difficult to reshape.

This also happens with SM objects that are created in VW 2021. You can duplicate this shape by setting the radius for the Fillet tool to roughly 6", then using the Arc Vertex Mode of the SM tool. 		Christopher Graye
VB-175421

Data Tag not taking Active Class

Data Tags will not use active class.  They are stuck on None class.

User said his custom data tags would not go on a class unless in put the tag in the drawing then selected it and in OIP assigned it to the new class

I created a new file using a generic wall and tagged it with a Vectorworks Door Tag.  I Selected a different class other than None so it was active and inserted the data tag on the wall, it stayed on the none class.

Same process in 2020, made any class other than none active and inserted the same data tag on a generic unstyled wall.   The Tag is on the active class. 		Christopher Graye
VB-170820

Surface Hatch rotation

Note the vertical part of the wall connection.

The wall's exterior component has a texture with a surface hatch.
- in OpenGL or Renderworks, the texture on the inside of the face renders correctly
- in a Hidden line render, the surface hatch is rotated 90° 		Christopher Graye
VB-172015

Resetting Plugins fails for slab

To reproduce

Steps

1. Open the simple.vwx or ProjectFile.vwx

2. Tools->Utilities->Reset All Plug-Ins

3. See the debug output

 

Debug Output
AndrewB: perimeterHandle, Assertion Failed!
ResetHotParametric: Reset failed for plug-in object: 0x26a558720 (Slab)
ResetHotParametric: attempting to reset plug-in object: 0x26a559f00, Slab
AndrewB: perimeterHandle, Assertion Failed!
ResetHotParametric: Reset failed for plug-in object: 0x26a559f00 (Slab)
ResetHotParametric: attempting to reset plug-in object: 0x26a55ba50, Slab
AndrewB: perimeterHandle, Assertion Failed!
ResetHotParametric: Reset failed for plug-in object: 0x26a55ba50 (Slab)
ResetHotParametric: attempting to reset plug-in object: 0x26a55d360, Slab
AndrewB: perimeterHandle, Assertion Failed!
ResetHotParametric: Reset failed for plug-in object: 0x26a55d360 (Slab)

  		Christopher Graye
VB-176033

Styles: Creating a new Plug-in Style from unstyled instance sets Class Widget disabled.

I'm not sure whether it is the desired behavior or a bug.
See also the https://forum.vectorworks.net/index.php?/topic/78422-landscape-area-style-question/

When creating a new style from unstyled instance using the 'New Plug-in Style from Unstyled Plug-in' choice from the Style popup widget, the class is set 'by style' and the Class widget in the OIP is disabled.

To reproduce:
- open the test file - it contains an unstyled landscape area and an unstyled data tag object.
- select any of them
- use 'New Plug-in Style from Unstyled Plug-in' to create a new style from the unstyled object
- note that the Class widget is disabled
(see also the attached video).

I did some debugging and it turned out that what causes this behavior is the following line in the function void InitializePluginStyle( SymDefHandle symDef ):

// Default is by style
(*(ParametricHandle)thePluginObj)->SetClassByStyle( true ); 		Christopher Graye
VB-170926

Structural Members Show Pen/Fill Opacity Incorrectly

The attached file contains a few objects that have 50% Opacity applied to their pen and fill attributes.

Note that the Structural Member appears much more transparent than the other objects (see attached screenshot). In order to get them to appear the same you have to change the SM opacity to 70-75% or so.

The same thing happened in previous versions. This also happens in VW 2021. 		Christopher Graye

VB-168603

Round Walls Get Corrupted When Translated to VW 2019/2020 Format

The attached files are in VW 2018 format, and they each contain two Round Walls that are joined end-to-end.

To reproduce, open the files in VW 2018 and VW 2019.

Note that the walls work fine in VW 2018, but in 2019/2020 one of the Walls becomes corrupted (see attached screenshots).

I also see the problem on Windows 10 but it's the opposite wall compared to Mac (if the right wall gets corrupted on Mac, the left wall will get corrupted on Windows). 		Christopher Graye
VB-173324

2021 PIO Style Insertion Class not working when "By Instance"

Create a Plug-In Style (such as with the new Section-Elevation Marker). In the RM, right click the style definition and choose "Plug-in Object Style Options." Choose a class for insertion and set that parameter By Instance. Click OK. (Attached screenshot shows this)

Set your active class to None. Double click the Plug-In Style in the RM and insert an instance into the document. It inserts onto the active class (None) rather than the class specified in the PIO Style Options.

(It works properly when the parameter is set to By Style).

Also described in this thread: https://forum.vectorworks.net/index.php?/topic/71992-t01946-–-editable-document-coordination-markers/&tab=comments#comment-359848 		Christopher Graye
VB-173159

Reverse-Translated Structural Members Disappear When Reshaped in Prior Versions

Movie and test file are attached. The file contains a poly- and linear-type Structural Member, created in VW 2021.

To reproduce:

-Export the file to any previous version
-Open the file in the previous version
-Reshape the SM objects

Note that they disappear.

If I try other operations on the SMs it works fine, so this looks like a Reshape problem.

The same thing happens when exporting to other prior versions (tested back to VW 2018).

If I create the same objects in VW 2020 and export to prior versions, I don't see the problem. 		Christopher Graye

In 2021, note that the highlighting flickers on and off randomly.

VB-168391

Roof Edge Shape, Gable Wall does not aligh with wall properly.

Steps to duplicate this.

-Start a new document, you can use a blank or architect template.
-Draw four walls.
-Create a roof on those 4 walls.
-In one of the roof side click on one of the handles.
-The Edit Roof Settings dialog should appear.
-Change it to Gable with the default value.
-Check in the option "Show Wall"
-Notice the gable wall will not aligh with the wall.
-Try changing the Thickness of the Gable Wall, notice thickness will adjust inward not
outward to align with wall outside.
This is happening from 2018 to 2020. The last where the gable wall would alight with the wall by default was 2017 version.

I have attached a video capture for this.

Christopher Graye
VB-176095

Fillet: Polyline vs Polygon

The attached video shows the Problem being reproduced.

If we draw two Polygons that touch in a 90 degree position and use Fillet, it will work. Although, the fillet is done and we can see the Arc in the drawing, the original edges of the Polygons remain in place. Is this WAD or a Bug?

If we draw two Polylines in the same way, we get a pop up that says: Parallel lines cannot be filleted or chamfered.

If its not possible with a Polylines, then why is it possible with Polygons? 		Christopher Graye
VB-175261

Various roof issues

I was hoping to be able to narrow down steps and determine a progression that seem to lead to some of these issues, but there seems to be multiple factors. Many of the issues have been on going for years which makes me wonder if it's operator error or my process. Regardless, editing roof faces has been a constant game of 'whack a mole' to get them to edit and show properly:

Related factors may be:
-roof styles & their components
-roof tail types
-rendering mode- GL
-the Reshape tool, clipping & adding with geometry
-mirroring or flipping roof faces

Some problems observed:
-GL Rendered views often show roof faces with hollow cavities. Entering edit mode and exiting often 'pops' it back. Then later on 'problematic' roof faces revert to a 'hollow mode'.
-Additional lines and/or polygons are discovered with not an apparent source other than a reshape, clip or add surface step requiring finding and removal of 'strays'
-when in edit mode, lines are not visible, making it (see Where's Waldo bug submittal) difficult to fix geometry within the roof face container.
-deleting extra vertices using the reshape tool does not seem to work well and entering the roof face container is required to clean up polygons. Some of these extra vertices appear after editing as mentioned above.
-the join roof tool seems to add some 'shakiness' to the roof faces. I will need to focus on this again, but I believe a few 'hangs' or crashes occurred after joining roof faces and then trying to edit them.

Attached is a recent schematic design file where a LOT of roof editing occurred in a short period of time and all of the above issues were ongoing. I need to go back into the roof geometry and clean up intersections between roof faces and the geometry of each due to inherent inaccuracies during the rapid conceptualization process.

As I can narrow down steps, I'll, add to this bug. 		Christopher Graye

Best regards, Denis 		Christopher Graye

Attached are two .vwx files. They have the same exact objects, but one is 2019 and the other 2020.

I have marked this as a Regression, because of the 2019 - 2020 differences.

Please take a look at this. 		Christopher Graye

Possible that it is because the file has the primary units set to mm and the secondary units set to feet and inches with fractions.

-Click on the left end of the bottom horizontal wall, then acquire a snap extension from the other wall as shown

In 2019, note that the tool allows you to draw a second segment so you can connect with the other horizontal wall (though sometimes it'll auto-draw that second segment which wasn't ideal).

In 2020, note that the tool only lets you draw one segment.

VB-174727

faces in roof don't report =roofstylename until roof touched

I made a worksheet that showed both roof and roof faces, with a column for roofstylename.

I created a style from the unstyled roof (context menu) and only the roof reported it.

Change any of this, the results change.  If the roof is created with a style, or assigned a style after, the faces immediately get the style. Actually, do anything that touches the roof (nudge) and the faces get the style.

Seems like there's a brief spot that's missing replicating the style to the faces.

VB-171223

Sheet Layer Section Viewport Slab Component Class Overrides not sticking

Observe the attached SLVP-SlabComp.vwx file.

An unstyled Slab has been created with 2 components. Each component is set to use the attributes of a unique Class.

In the Sheet Layer Section Viewport, override the attributes (eg; pen colour and thickness).

Observe the attributes do not change even upon updating the Viewport.

[Workaround: Return to the Design Layer and edit the Slab Components. Do not make any changes. Click OK. Notice this triggers the VP to require an update. Update the VP. Observe the VP Class Overrides will now stick.] 		Christopher Graye

VB-173024

Roof Dormers with walls return incorrect values when calling SDK function GetWallOverallHeights()

When calling *void CSDK::GetWallOverallHeights(MCObjectHandle theWall, WorldCoord& overallHeightTop, WorldCoord& overallHeightBottom)* function with wall handle from Dormer in Roof Face the returned values for *overallHeightTop* and *overallHeightBottom* ** are *0.0*. 

I attached screenshots where you can see the returned results with a wall calling:

 *void CB_GetWallHeights(MCObjectHandle theWall, WorldCoord& startHeightTop, WorldCoord& startHeightBottom, WorldCoord& endHeightTop, WorldCoord& endHeightBottom)*

is returning some values and the same wall calling *void CSDK::GetWallOverallHeights()* returns *0*

 

Steps to reproduce the IFC Export where this is happening:
1. Unshelve CL 558342

2. Put breakpoint into ExportWall.cpp on line: 1293

3. Open the bug file: Testfile 20201518_07.vwx

4. Go to File -> Export -> Export IFC Project... -> click on "Layer Mapping" tab -> add the "Konstruktionsebene - 1" to the "Mapped Layers" -> Click "Export" button and save the file somewhere.

5.  It mus hit your breakpoint and you can notice that the returned values from the function are two 0.0

 

This issue is causing wrong IFC Export of the document. 		Christopher Graye
VB-171907

End Caps Created on Non-Active Layers Show Bad Geometry in Wireframe in 2021

The attached movie and test file show this in VW 2020 compared to VW 2021. The file contains a few layers with a Wall and a Rectangle on "Layer B".

To reproduce:

-Open the file in VW 2020
-Make "Layer A" active
-Activate the Wall End Cap tool in Add Mode and add a cap as shown
-Now switch to 3D

Note that the End Cap shows some grayed ghost geometry when the cursor touches the wall, but the geometry isn't visible otherwise (see first attached screenshot).

-Now open the file in VW 2021 and try the same thing

Note that now the bad geometry show in Wireframe, at all times (see second screenshot). 		Christopher Graye
VB-167436

Roof faces: Mitter face join: wrong connection with offset components

When you connect 2 rooffaces with a different angle with the option "mitter roof face join" selected, roof faces are connected in a non- vertical way, which causes an perfect connection seen from the outside of the roof as well as on the inside. 

However, when a roof face is connected to walls and the components of the roof face interact with the components of the walls, this tool is useless. The components have an offset compared to the roof edge, but on a small trangle at the spot of the connection between the roof faces, all components extend to the roof edge.

 

Steps to reproduce

Draw two roof faces with different angles.

The roof style has multiple compnents which interact with wall components.

Connect them with 4 walls. connect the roof faces with the connect/combine tool with the mitter join method activated

 

Attention!

The connection between these two roof faces should be in the middle of the rectangle formed by the walls, or else one of the roof faces will bug.

  		Christopher Graye
VB-170655

Snapping Fails with Roof Face Creation Widget After Deleting Previous Click

The attached movie and test file show this in VW 2018 compared to VW 2019, since the problem appeared between those two versions.

To reproduce:

-Open the file in VW 2018
-Select the Rectangle and run the Roof Face command
-Click twice to set the roof axis, then press Delete to undo the second click

Note that you can still snap to the Roof Face's geometry.

-Now open the file in VW 2019, VW 2020, or VW 2021 and try the same thing

Note that now the snapping fails, and the user's forced to restart the entire operation if they need to snap to anything. 		Christopher Graye
VB-174906

Extracted Curves don't exactly match the original polyline from which an extrude was created

Hi

This has been reported by one of the UK resellers on behalf of one their customers.

Their workflow is:
# Create an Oval.
# Clip the Oval with a Rectangle.
# Extrude the clipped oval.
# Extract the surface of the extrude.
# Send to CNC machine for cutting. 

There is a discrepancy between the original polyline that forms the extrude, and the extracted shape as demonstrated in the attached file. The customer has cut panelling which is the wrong size and is complaining about how much this has cost them.

We need to find more information about this workflow. For example, why are they not using the original polyline to cut? Why the extraction.

However, in the meantime, it would be great to get an explanation of why there is this discrepancy.

The file shows the process, and then shows a zoomed scale version showing the discrepancy in more detail.

Thanks for any help you can give us in explaining this. 		Christopher Graye
VB-168718

Connect/Combine Tool Fails on Intersecting Curves

I've attached a movie and test file that show this. The file contains two NURBS Curve objects.

To reproduce:

-Activate the Connect/Combine tool in Dual Object Connect Mode
-Click on the ends of the two curves as shown

Note that the operation fails.

-Now select each curve and run the "Extend NURBS" command, using a Linear Extension and a 24" Distance
-Run the Modify/Compose command on the two curves

Note that the curves get composed into a single curve, indicating that the Connect/Combine operation should've worked.

The same thing happens in previous versions. 		Christopher Graye
VB-169876

Class assignment after Decompose

See attached screencast.
We would expect the hole contour lines to reside in the Rectangle Class, rather than in the Eraser Class. 		Christopher Graye
VB-175044

Polyline Tool Tangent Arc Mode - Removing points with Backspace seems to break the tool

Select the Polyline Tool and choose "Tangent Arc Mode"
Make a few points and start removing them one by one by pressing Backspace
You'll notice that they seem to get removed differently from the way you created them

If you complete the polyline it will not look like what the preview shows

I've attached a video demonstrating the issue 		Christopher Graye

VB-167733

When the texture is set to the class style in Components of Roof Style, changing the texture from the organizer may not be reflected.

When the texture is set to the class style in Components of Roof Style, changing the texture from the organizer may not be reflected.
--------------------------
Target environment
--------------------------
Win Mac
It occurs in v2020, v2019.
--------------------------
Target Tool
--------------------------
Roof
Roof Face
--------------------------
How to Reproduce
--------------------------
1) Open this file in which the component's texture is set to the Class Style in the Roof Style.

2) Organization> Classes tab> Select and edit the class in which the component is set

3) Select "Texture"
Change a current texture on the "Object and Component Textures" to another one.

4) The dialog is closed with the "OK" button, but it is not reflected.

*Remarks*
-When the mode of the render tab of OIP is changed, it is reflected.
-This problem is not occur with the wall components.
-The Component's texture of Roof Style can reflect when it edit from Resource Manager.(movie10592-02.mov)

Please refer to "sample10592.vwx","movie10592-01.mov","movie10592-02.mov".

Best regards,
Rie Ichimura
A&A 		Christopher Graye
VB-167508

Object Data swapped if Convert multiple 3D Polygon to Polygon

The attached video shows the problem being reproduced.

1. Select the 4 3D Polygons like done in the video and copy them to the side to use them for the test.

If the 3D Polygons are converted one by one to Polygon, nothing wrong happens.

If the 3D Polygons are converted to Polygons all at once, the Object Data will be switched. ObjectID, GE_CODE, etc. will be switched between the top left corner object and the bottom right corner object. 		Christopher Graye

--------------------------
Target environment
--------------------------
Mac/Win
v2020(Same as previous versions)
--------------------------
About Problem
--------------------------
When creating a complex line type, an unintended misalignment occurs despite adjusting the distance.

Even if the same figure is drawn with the polygon tool, it will not misalign.
(Drawing a vertical straight line with the polygon tool will not misalign.)

VB-171772

VB-172606

Eave Styles will not display on edges parallel to the edge of the roof

When creating Roof Faces, some users would expect all edges of the roof face parallel to the edge to receive the same Eave Style as the edge of the Roof Face; however, it only applies to the outermost edge.

This can be an issue for some more complex roofs, but it can be fixed by splitting it into individual roof faces and working around this.

I've attached a document and some screenshots displaying this; hopefully that's of some help!

This was reported by a user, Albert Lannin (albert@bayconstruction.net).  I'm adding this so I can reach out to them with any further questions or updates.

Thanks for your time, and have an awesome day!  :) 		Christopher Graye
VB-173919

Missing grips

User submitted a file where any object currently on screen or newly created does not have any blue grips.  When creating a new file, all objects have grips.

I exported his file down to 2019 and the grips appeared.  Opened the 2020 file in 2021 and there were no grips.

Saved the newly exported file in 2019 and opened that in 2020 and the grips reappeared. 		Christopher Graye
VB-171841

T02124 - Pocket and Sliding tabs in Door Style dialog have grayed-out options

Draw a Door and convert to a Door Style
In the style dialog, go to the Barn Door tab

Note that, even though the Barn Door config is not active, the user can still toggle the by style/by instance buttons and can still click the Import Settings button
Now go to the Pocket or Sliding config tabs

Note that here everything is grayed-out. In order to get access to any of the controls you need to make the Configuration active in the General tab.
It seems like the user should at least be able to set the entire tab to by-instance without having to activate those configs. 		Christopher Graye
VB-168080

I'm not sure if this is a bug however i don't understand why my window ID tags are different sizes.

Screenshot attached. As far as setting up the file they have the same settings other than the style of the window. 		Christopher Graye
VB-174944

Inserting clerestory window causes wall to redraw outer wall lines below depending on location

As seen in the attached movie, when I insert a clerestory window into a wall on the *_right side_* above a lower window, the "host" wall shows its outer wall lines. However, when the same window is inserted into the wall on the _*left side*_ of the same window, no outer wall lines appear.

Not surprisingly, this is making the graphic representation of walls unpredictable.

Vectorworks file attached as well. 		Christopher Graye
VB-169860

Selected Sash can be larger than the overall width/height when using Custom Sash

When creating a Custom Sash, it's possible to set the Selected Sash to be at a larger width/height of the overall window.

 Typically when we create a Custom Sash, it's possible to change one of the Sashes to be a larger size than the overall window, but it will revert to the correct size if we go back to the field.  If we hit OK before doing that, the size will remain incorrect.

This was submitted by a user, Jon Rizzo.

I've included a video (and a document) displaying this behavior, if that helps explain it.  Please keep me posted if I can be of any further assistance, and have an awesome day!  :) 		Christopher Graye
VB-171692

Muntins obstructs glass settings

The two windows are identically except that one has muntins turned on (top and bottom sash).

 

The one with the muntins does not display the glass correctly. 

 

Verifying if this is a bug or if it has to do with it not being in the glazing-clear class.  		Christopher Graye
VB-174103

Doors Lose Settings When "Opening" Configuration is Chosen

Movie and test file are attached. The file contains a Door with custom settings.

To reproduce:

-Open the settings dialog and change the Configuration to "Cased Opening"
-Now change it back to "Simple"

Note that the settings are all retained.

-Now change the Configuration to "Opening" and then change it back to "Simple"

Note that now all the leaf-related settings (including Hardware) get reset to default.

It makes sense that the irrelevant settings would get grayed-out when the "Opening" config is chosen but I don't think they should get reset. This becomes a problem if, for example, a user accidentally chooses the "Opening" config.

The same thing happened in past versions. 		Christopher Graye

See attached movie and file.
I am seeing this randomly.
Open file and go to settings dialog
Edit few properties like detail level and hardware.
Then click on some other property or edit filed you will notice 2D preview is empty and 3F preview shows missing geometry.
I was able to record a movie when the issue happened and I saw many times but not every time
Christopher Graye
VB-174952

Window Glass Becomes Solid in Backup File After Crash

Pretty self explanatory, watch the screen recording attached Christopher Graye
VB-173825

Classes don’t display properly, when loading a door style object in some cases.

Steps to reproduce.
1) Open a new document.
2) Select the Door tool.
3) Go to the Door Tool Preferences.
4) Click the “Use Style” pulldown.
5) Choose any door object. (Ex. Barn Door)
6) Choose the “Classes” pane. Most of classes are “<Door Class>”.
This means the classes aren’t loaded properly.
7) Click OK to close, and place the door object to a design layer.
8) Open the “Settings” on OIP.
9) The classes display proper on the “Classes” pane.
10) Dismiss the dialog and go to the Door Tool Preferences, again.
11) Click the “Use Style” pulldown, double-click the same one with currently selecting and the classes display properly.

Best regards,
Hitoshi Takeuchi
A&A 		Christopher Graye

in Spanish different door configuration tab names read the same doesn't show completely so its difficult to switch different tabs in oder to go to right configuration settings 		Christopher Graye

The label class is off in the DLVP settings but the Horizontal section shows it, but Top/Plan does not. Only way to get them not to show is by deselecting Show Tag in 2D in the Door settings of source file - see GF above in Horizontal section on the right

It's the same Door style with Show Tag in 2D set by instance 		Christopher Graye

VB-173033

Windows inside Symbols with missing ID tags

This is a large UK customer that is having a number of similar issues to this one.

In ELEVATIONS file some of the Symbols are not referenced correctly - see _1416_Novice Bay_level 01_Type 1 - Handed_ and _1416_Senior Bay Level 01_ and smaller Window inside those Symbols - Window Style _1416_W-19.A_S/O 1060 x 685_ is not displaying a Tag. I can fix it by simply replacing that Window Style with any other and replacing it back, Save and update reference.

VB-169266

Door and Window OpenGL preview in settings dialog in symbol edit mode shows incorrect

Open attached file and movie

Now select Door/Window symbol in wall double click to go to edit mode

VB-175226

Structural Member - Duplicated Members Fail After Move

Movie and test file are attached. The file contains a few Column members and a Poly member that's joined to the columns.

To reproduce:

-Select all three members
-Activate the Move By Points tool with Object Retention Mode enabled
-Make a duplicate copy of the SMs
-Now go to plan view and Move the SMs

Note that this causes the join to fail.

If the members are duplicated with the Duplicate command then moved with the Move command, the problem won't happen.

This is a regression from VW 2020. 		Christopher Graye
VB-172961

T01757 - When a Material is assigned to the 3D Attributes of a Structural Member, the texture remains even after having the 3D attributes set back to By Object

Open the attached file, the SM has a Material assigned with the 2D attributes set to By Material (which makes the SM pink)

Open the settings and change the 3D attributes to By Material, exit the dialog. The SM now takes on the brick texture.

Open the settings again and change the 3D attributes back to By Object and exit the dialog. The brick texture remains.

This behavior is similar to the behavior of removing a material from a standard object, the texture of the material will remain on the object, however, for the Structural Member, the Material is not removed from the object so users may expect the SM to go back to the pink color defined by the 2D attributes pane. 		Christopher Graye
VB-174177

StructuralMember: end cap miter 0,001 degrees

In the attached file we have two groups of Structural Members.

The top Group (Layer E1-Obergeschoss 1) has a End Cap Miter of 0,000 degrees.

The bottom Group (Layer E0-Erdgeschoss) has a End Cap Miter of 0,001 degrees.

They both look exactly the same, despite the degree difference. Thats because the Customer complains about an innacuracy in the Structural Members and has compensated this situation with 0,001 degrees in the End Cap Miter.

By Exporting and Importing back as IFC, it is possible to see that both Structural Member groups aren't the same if 0,000 degrees in the End Cap Miter. 		Christopher Graye
VB-173784

Structural Members Get Joined at the Wrong Angle in 2021

The attached movie and test file show this in VW 2020 compared to 2021. The file contains a few linear SM objects.

To reproduce, in each version, resize the horizontal SM and connect it to the diagonal member as shown.

Note that it takes-on the right angle in 2020 but not in 2021. 		Christopher Graye
VB-175688

1. In the attached .vwx file select both Solid Addition and the Slab
2. Right click the selected objects and use Add 3D Object to Slab

VB-175333

Structural Member Columns Get Rotated Incorrectly

Movie and test file are attached. The file contains a few column-type SM objects; one that's un-rotated and one that's rotated 45º. I've also added a few rectangles to show the current bounding box of the SM.

To reproduce:

-Select the SM on the left and run the "Rotate Left 90º" command a few times

Note that the SM gets rotated around the same center point with each rotation.

-Now rotate the plan as shown
-Select the SM on the right and again rotate it 90º

Note that now it gets rotated around a different center point, making it difficult to control.

If you rotate to the same angle using the Rotation field in the OIP, it'll get rotated as expected.

This also happens when not in rotated plan, though it seems more obvious when rotated plan is active.

The same thing happened in past versions. 		Christopher Graye
VB-173906

Poly-Type Structural Members Fail to Maintain Profile Angle When Reshaped Along the Z-Axis

Movie and test file are attached. The file contains a curved poly-type Structural Member.

To reproduce, activate the Reshape tool and reshape the SM along the Z-axis.

Note that the profile angle isn't maintained along the Length of the member, so you end up with a twisting effect (see attached screenshot).

In VW 2020 poly members could only be reshaped along the X/Y axes, so this is new to 2021. 		Christopher Graye
VB-175241

Structural Members in Rotated Networks Show the Wrong Length After Connected Members are Moved

Movie and test file are attached. The file contains a network of linear SMs.

To reproduce:

-Go to a Left view and rotate the network 90º as shown
-Now go to a Front view
-Drag the SMs a few times as shown

Note that, at a certain point, the larger SMs will show the wrong length, even though though the joins seem to still be intact.

In VW 2020 there were a bunch of additional problems with rotated networks, so this isn't a regression. 		Christopher Graye
VB-175239

Structural Member - Changing Elevation of Member Causes Joins to Fail, Angles to Change

Movie and test file are attached. The file contains a simple network of linear SMs that all have the same elevation.

To reproduce:

-Select one of the rectangular SMs and change its elevation to 4'0" in the OIP

Note that everything looks fine at this point.

-Now change the elevation of that same member to 3'0"

Note that now only one end of the member changes elevation, and the start/end angles of the other members get changed.

In VW 2020 the joins would just fail once the elevation of the member was changed. 		Christopher Graye
VB-175219

Structural Member - Column Start/End Offsets Get Applied Incorrectly on Multiple-Selected Objects

Movie and test file are attached. The file contains a few Column members and a Poly member that's joined to the columns.

To reproduce:

-Select each column member individually and change its Start Offset to 12" or so

Note that this works fine.

-Now Undo the changes
-Select both objects
-Again change the Start Offset to 12"

Note that now the change gets applied to the top of one of the columns (its Start Offset remains at 0" and its End Offset changes to 7'0").

This only seems to happen when the columns are joined to other members.

In VW 2020 the members would just lose their connection if the offset was changed. 		Christopher Graye
VB-173536

Closed Poly Structural Members Show Fill Incorrectly in 2021

This is a continuation of VB-170927, which is fixed.

Movie and test file are attached. The file contains a poly-type Structural Member with a closed shape.

To reproduce:

-Open the file in 2021 and reset the SM
-Now zoom or pan

Note that the fill shows incorrectly while the navigation is active.

If you change the Nav Graphics setting to "Good Performance...", the fill problem will show during navigation and in static views.

This is a regression from VW 2020. 		Christopher Graye

I've attached a movie and test file that show this. The file contains a simple 2D/3D Symbol.

To reproduce:

-Edit the 2D Component of the symbol
-Zoom a bit, then Undo the zoom operation

Note that the symbol's active component changes to 3D.

I don't see this in SP2 so it looks like an SP3 regression. 		Christopher Graye

VB-168312

When switching the edit surface on the 2D Component edit screen for a specific symbol, there is a timing at which figure is not displayed.

--------------------------
Target environment
--------------------------
Win Mac
It occurs in v2020.

--------------------------
How to Reproduce
--------------------------
When switching the edit surface on the 2D Component edit screen for a specific symbol, there is a timing at which figure is not displayed.

Please refer to "2Dcomponent_Sample_v2020.vwx" and follow the steps below.

1) Turn [Unified View] on.

2) Enter the symbol editing screen from Resource Manager.
* It does not occur when it enters the symbol editing screen from a placed symbol on the drawing.

3) Switch the editing screen between [Right] and [left(and Right) Cut] alternately with Component Edit.

4) There is a timing at which a figure is not displayed.
* Even if the figure disappears, it can be selected by moving the mouse cursor.

*Remarks*
-It does not occur in v2019.

-Even if only the target symbol is copied to a new file, it occurs.

-It does not occur if it is verified with a newly created test symbol.

-Changing the settings of [Navigation Graphics] and [GDI+imaging] has no effect.

-It does not occur if [Unified View] turns off.

Please refer to "2Dcomponent_Sample_v2020.vwx","movie10619.mov".

It cannot be determined whether it is a problem of specific symbol data or a software problem.

Best regards,
Rie Ichimura
A&A 		Christopher Graye
VB-168781

GKV Curtain Wall disappears in Top/Plan view

This file has an unstyled curtain wall that appears in 3D but when the view is switched to Top/Plan, the curtain wall is invisible. I can't seem to find any settings that are causing this. The wall is still selectable via marquee, but there is no 2D representation.

This was found in a file created by GKV in Vectorworks 2020 on a Mac using Mojave. I was able to reproduce the problem on my computer using Vectorworks 2020 and Catalina.

Randy says that this bugs has occurred for him in prior versions of Vectorworks.

  		Christopher Graye
VB-168004

Window Looks Clipped in the Preview Window when Editing Section Viewport's Design layer

I've attached a short movie that shows this issue

 
* Open test file 
* Double click the section viewport and choose to edit 'Design Layer'. make sure you check 'Navigate back to Viewport' and 'Display with Clip Cube' options
* With the window selected, click the 'Settings' button from the OIP
* Notice the Window looks clipped in the preview window

Repeat the same above steps and this time uncheck 'Display with Clip Cube' option

Notice the window appears properly in the preview window 		Christopher Graye

VB-175237

To reproduce, select all the SMs and change their layer in the OIP.

Note that this causes the joins to fail and the start/end angles to change.

In VW 2020 the joins would also fail, but the start/end angles would stay the same. 		Christopher Graye

-Now move any member

VB-170433

Structural Member doesn't inherit the class attribute when switching classes.

Structural Member doesn't change its color in 3D views even if switching to classes which are set Graphic Attribute. It keeps the original color.

The steps.

1) Open a new document and create a Structural Member.
2) Create a new class and set any fill color.
3) Switch the Structural Member class to the newly created class.
4) Select any 3D View and run OpenGL.
5) The Structural Member color doesn't change and it keeps its original one.

Best regards,
Hitoshi Takeuchi
A&A 		Christopher Graye
VB-169084

The command "Model to Floorplan" creates wrong walls.

Hi Vectorworks

In the attached file you see the 3D-volume and the wrong result.

Best regards, Marc 		Christopher Graye
VB-175005

Structural Member's 2D Graphics Show Incorrectly When Joined Near the End

The attached movie and test file show this in VW 2020 compared to 2021. The file contains an SM and a few locus points to be used as guides.

To reproduce:

-Open the file in VW 2020
-Activate the SM tool using "Create Similar Object"
-Draw an SM between the locus points as shown

Note that the SM's 2D graphics are trimmed so that they join cleanly with the existing SM (see first attached screenshot).

-Now open the file in VW 2021 and try the same thing

Note that now the 2D graphics show incorrectly (see second screenshot).

The 3D geometry shows fine so this only affects 2D.

If you try the same thing using the locus points on "Layer B" (which are placed slightly more towards the center of the existing SM) the problem won't occur.

The same thing happens going back to SP0. 		Christopher Graye
VB-173950

Poly-Type Structural Members Support 3D Reshape But Not 3D Draw

Movie and test file are attached. The file contains a few locus points placed at different locations/elevations.

To reproduce, in any 3D view, activate the SM tool in poly mode and draw a member that snaps to the locus points.

Note that the SM always gets drawn on the layer plane.

Since poly-type SMs now support 3D reshaping in 2021, where each vertex can be moved to any point on the Z-axis, users will probably expect this to work like similar objects (NURBS Curve, 3D Poly) that can be drawn directly on those 3D points. 		Christopher Graye
VB-174038

Structural Member Resize Preview Shows Incorrectly When Objects are Highlighted

Movie and test file are attached.

To reproduce, resize the SM object as shown so that it highlights the Wall to the left.

Note that, when the wall gets highlighted, the SM insertion preview shows the end of the member as if it were bevelled.

The same thing happens with other objects that get highlighted (for example with Rectangles).

This also happened in VW 2020. 		Christopher Graye
VB-173786

Structural Member - Undoing 3D Move Operations Causes Joins to be Lost in 2021

Movie and test file are attached. The file contains a few joined SM objects.

To reproduce:

-Select the horizontal SM and change its elevation using the Move 3D command
-Now Undo the move

Note that the control point of one of the joined members now shows in the wrong location. If you try to move that member you can see that its join has been lost.

This is a regression from 2020. 		Christopher Graye
VB-172325

Structural Element Rotation

The OIP rotation angle of a Structural Element differs from other objects when in 2D Rotated Plan view Christopher Graye
VB-175218

Structural Member - Joined Poly Members Fail After Being Moved

Movie and test file are attached. The file contains a few Column members and a Poly member that's joined to the columns.

To reproduce:

-Go to a Front view and drag-duplicate the poly member (using the Option key) and make a copy as shown

Note that this works fine.

-Now try to move the new copy that was just made

Note that now the vertices of the original poly member get moved upward.

Sometimes this can be easily fixed with the Reshape tool but other times it causes everything to get out-of-whack.

This didn't happen in VW 2020, where poly members didn't allow Z-axis movement of individual vertices. 		Christopher Graye
VB-173568

Structural Member Start/End Conditions Get Offset in the Wrong Direction in 2021

The attached movie and test file show this in VW 2020 compared to 2021.

To reproduce, open the file in each version and enter a negative Offset value for the Start and End Conditions.

In VW 2020, note that this offsets the ends inward toward the center of the member.

In VW 2021, note that this offsets the ends outward.

The 2020 behavior is more consistent with other VW features that involve +/- offsets. 		Christopher Graye
VB-171038

Plan gets un-rotated in edit modifiers when space object has added/clipped areas

In the attached video, I edit the modifiers of a space object.  In the edit mode, the plan stays rotated.  But if I add or clip that space, the next time I go into the edit mode, the plan will not be rotated. Christopher Graye
VB-173779

Structural Member - Columns Fail to Show Geometry in 2021 When Height is Set to 0"

The attached movie shows this from a blank file in VW 2020 compared to 2021.

To reproduce, in each version:

-Place a default column-type SM
-Change its End Offset to 0"

In VW 2020, note that the SM shows flat geometry.

In 2021, note that the geometry fails to show in 2D and 3D.

This is most noticeable with Story-bound SMs where you can end up with 0" height if you accidentally choose the wrong story level. 		Christopher Graye

VB-168517

Pasting 2D Object in Top/Plan 2D Component of a 3D Plug-in Object Info palette and Object Plane Issues

These are the steps [~jfabbiani] was taking while working on this file.  The process was extremely confusing and frustrating.

Here are some issues we noticed:
# Open the attached VWX file
You will see a Campanile plug-in object and a Rectangle
# Copy the Rectangle
# Edit the 2D Components of the Campanile object
# Paste the Rectangle
*Issue 1:* The Object Info palette says "No Selection" although it shows controls for a rectangle.
*Issue 2*: The Plane popup shows the object on plane "Layer"
# Deselect and select the Rectangle and select it again
Now the Object Info palette shows the object correctly as a Rectangle
*Issue 3*: The Plane popup displays blank
# Set the Plane popup to "Top Component"
*Issue 4*:  The Object Info palette shows correctly displays the selected object as a "Rectangle" but the palette is otherwise blank.
# Select the Rectangle again
*Repeat of Issue 3*: The Plane popup displays blank
# Set the Plane popup to "Screen"
All now works as expected. 		Christopher Graye

VB-175430

Hey guys,

I have a customer who is creating own cable parts and saving them in the user library / workgroup library. These Parts doesn't show up in the "Manage Cable part dialog".
Is it a bug or is it a workflow question?

Jesse Cogdell also tested it with this result:
"I just ran some tests and it looks like the cable tools are set to only use the parts in the default libraries and the active file, this means that to access any cable needed from a workgroup or user library they need to first be imported into the active file and then the update command in the manage cable dialogue has to be triggered."

Can you take a look? And if this is WAD, can you create a wish out of this?

VB-175661

Spotlight bridle object doesn't display correctly in 3D

Using the bridle object show parts length toggle does not display correctly, it seems to not take into account the effective basket length for each leg length. This means that if the user has edited the bridle configuration to use the correct configuration of bridle parts to create the bridle the parts length will always display incorrectly

The same issue happens if the user chooses to not use the simple 3D parts display option. the parts of each leg will all be offset from the bridle apex point by the effective basket length.

This seems to be a purely visual problem, as when a bridle is calculated the Braceworks results display correctly

image 1 shows the bridle with the simple 3D parts turned off and the show parts length on, as can be seen the 3D parts do not reach the apex

image 2 show the same bridle with the use simple 3D display turned on and the show parts length also turned on

image Leg 1 configuration shows the required leg length is 2481mm and the actual leg length is 2482mm

image Leg 2 configuration shows the required leg length is 2803mm and the parts length is 2843mm

I expected the show parts length to be slightly different from the  default use simple 3D parts view mode but the the difference seems much larger than it should be when the are only very small differences between the required leg length and leg parts length for each leg of the bridle (1mm and 40mm respectively)

Although I am using 3D symbols for my bridle parts the behaviour is exactly the same using the standard 2D symbols

to duplicate insert a truss or pipe, 2 house points with any basket defined except eyelet

insert a bridle and then turn off the simple 3D parts option and turn on show parts length

No matter how you edit the leg parts it will never display correctly 		Kevin Linzey
VB-175429

Braceworks - Calculations of Cables doesn't seem to be correct

Hey guys,

as the table in this document shows, the calculation of braceworks doesn't really seem to be correct.

It seems that Braceworks doesn't take care of the full length that affects the trussload.

Can take a look at it?

The German description is inside the attached document.

Thanks
Alex 		Kevin Linzey
VB-173461

Spotlight cable tools distributor mode insertion problem,

When the user wants to connect multiple consumers to the breakout, the distributor mode always assumes that the insertion route for the second and each subsequent cable is the same as the first, and will try to run directly from the first consumer to the second in a direct line (image 1).

It gets  worse if the breakout is placed in the middle of a group of consumers and not at one end or the other (image 1b)

The user can click on intermediate points, after the first consumer but then ends up with vertical doglegs in the cable path that will affect its length (see image 2)

This will massively slow down the cable tools work flow as in most cases the user cannot take advantage of the sequential patching function to correctly insert the cables

The way this should work is that each cable should behave the same as the first cable inserted, start point at the breakout and go to the consumer, without automatically inserting the cable running through any previous consumers (see image 3). 		Kevin Linzey

4. Close the dialogs with OK.
5. Open again Manage Cable Parts dialog.
6. Click on Column button.
7. Note that all of the checkboxes are turned on. 		Kevin Linzey

VB-175599

Spotlight truss: Data Tag weight (#TrussItem#.#Weight#) ignores the File's Units>Structural settings

Vectorworks BugsVB-173056
Spotlight Structural Data Tag not using the document unit>Structural format

However this is just the weight of the truss.

#TrussItem#.#Weight#

Peter 		Kevin Linzey
VB-168046

GDTF is populating Candela and Color Temperature with 0.0

It was decided that GDTF should populate the Candela and Color Temperatue fields the same way it is populated for litfiles.

If all lamps share a candela value, this is what should be displayed in the Properties Window for GDTF (this field should be read-only). Otherwise, the string "Multiple" should be displayed in the field instead.

Color temperature should be handled the same way.

If there are any questions as to how this should be implemented, please contact [~jglassman] as he designed the original code for handling this for litfiles. 		Kevin Linzey
VB-175412

2021 / Spotlight / Line-Array Tool / Braceworks

If you work with the generic symbols (catalog) you will encounter the following errors:
1.Array with selection "A chain hoist" The suspension point is not attached, no matter what I have done here, no change.

2.Array with selection "Two chain hoists" Initially it works, later Point load cannot have two structural elements ....

3.Array with selection "Several chain hoists" Here the Braceworks calculation is simply not correct.
The array weighs approx. 374kg, the sum of the individual weights of the motors approx. 1124kg

4.Array with selection "Several chain hoists" with flying frame inclined by 10 °. Was only like version 3. then after a new calculation it was a little closer but still about 50kg off
Now I've tried the whole thing with symbols.

5.L-Acoustic Kara a chain hoist - & gt; The suspension point is not attached

6.L-Acoustic Kara two chain hoists - & gt; First the load (only the speakers) are not hit, second calculation "everything is fine". If we take a closer look, we only see the flying frame and not the speakers.

7.L-Acoustics K2 two chain hoists (maybe the Kara symbol is bad) no same error as in case 6.

8. L-Acoustice K2 with 3 chain hoists I do not get 3 motors positioned on the K2 frame so that no motor fails in the calculation. 		Kevin Linzey
VB-176044

Truss JThomas 20.5 Corner Block Failing System Calculation

When adding corner blocks to this simple system, it is failing in the calculation that it is not supported. Video and test file attached Kevin Linzey
VB-168567

Braceworks Soft goods tool problem

The soft goods tool does not work with Braceworks correctly.

In the softgoods objects OIP the 'add pipe' and 'add track' options are not Braceworks enabled, so you cannot attach hoists, bridles or deadhangs correctly

If the inserted softgoods object has a curved corner, braceworks will give 'this load is not supported' errors for every distributed load loci, even if the add pipe option is used

If the inserted softgoods object is inserted on a truss or pipe system, Braceworks will display 'distributed load is longer than structural element' when the system is calculated

 

In the attached sample file calculate each system individually to reproduce the problems

The softgoods tool is one of the most commonly used tools from the event planning tool set 		Kevin Linzey

5. Turn on Prepend target distributor name to prefix checkbox.
6. Insert a cable.
7. The name of the distributor is not prepended to the prefix. 		Kevin Linzey

VB-167513

Triangle Truss Behaving Differently Between VW 2019 and 2020

The triangle truss is behaving differently in VW 2020 than it is in VW2019.  The rotation field seems to be causing the truss to rotate different directions despite the settings being identical in the Truss Properties window.  The symbols in the attached files were created in VW2019 and forward converted to VW 2020 for release.  

The trusses work fine in 2019 when the corner is placed first and then the straight truss connected second.  The left, right, and Bottom 3D connections are rotated properly and connecting to the corner.  If the straight is inserted first, the subsequent corner piece is rotated 180° from the straight piece.

In VW2020 when the corner is inserted first and then the straight truss the left and right connections are correct but the bottom 3D is rotated 180° from the connection.  If the straight is inserted first the corner will connect and be rotated properly.  

If the Truss Properties connection data is examined it is identical between both files.

Two videos and two files attached. 		Kevin Linzey
VB-173122

Cables can currently not be calculated.

Since I do not know whether it is already planned for 2021 or not, I write it anyway. Drawing cables over trusses really works great and the way is clearly visible. It would be nice, if all cables on their way are considered as weight on the truss. That means of course, if a cable falls from the truss to the ground, a point load of the weight of the length of the cable must be applied at this point. If I have jumps on other trusses, the weight must automatically be assigned to the truss, which is higher. I imagine it would be very difficult to program, but I would be really far ahead.
If this is generally not planned for 2021, the hacking should be deactivated at Load Information, Include in Calculation. Otherwise error messages will appear immediately. 		Kevin Linzey

VB-172671

Truss Insert is not consistent on orientation of truss

When using the Truss Item tool (or dragging truss to make connections) when making corners the truss is not always inserted with the same orientation. This is only really noticeable when you have adjust flipped texted turned off  Sometimes the truss is 180°, and sometimes the truss is flipped (causing the text to be flipped), and sometimes both. The attached video shows how using Christie B-Type truss (spigot truss), working clock-wise is fine, but working counter-clockwise is incorrect. When working with Thomas 12x18 (bolted truss), every corner block I put in has a different orientation.

I always work with adjust flipped text turned off, because I want to decide the orientation. 		Kevin Linzey

VB-173235

RM: Can't extract images from multiple textures at once in 2021

Normally you should be able to select any number of RW Textures in the Resource Manager, right click, and choose "Extract Images" which saves any and all image files to your hard drive.

In Vectorworks 2021 this only works when you select a single texture. As soon as you select more than one texture the menu item doesn't appear.

This is quite detrimental, because extracting all images at once was a quick way to see what textures are too large and and bloating your file size. You could then downsample applicable images in Photoshop and re-import.

I assume this wasn't intentionally removed, but regardless it should be restored.

Video attached. 		Justin Hutchison

On the top of walls the default mapping in some situtations is not as desired. Please have a look to the attached file.

Best regards, Marc 		Justin Hutchison

53 second mark. It also blinks partially out at the 21 second mark. Sometimes the, text inside the pallet redraws quite a lot during a render. Not sure if its related. VB-171416

T02117Publish: Vectorworks hangs if you click Save button

To reproduce: 

Open an attached test file

Open the Publish dialog

Select all worksheets on the left side of the dialog and move it to the right side of the dialog

Open File Export Options dialog

Turn off Export worksheets as separate files check box

Click OK

Turn off all check boxes from the Export Worksheet dialog

Click OK

Click Publish

Choose a folder where to save the files

Click Save

Note that beach ball appears and then Successfully published .. items dialog displays

I think that the beach ball shouldn’t appear and the user should see the progress of  the Publish process

  		Vasil Kitanov
VB-171081

IFC Export: walls whose story bound is lost don't export

This is very tricky: walls whose story bound is undefined in top or bottom or both, don't export in IFC. 

Please make them export nevertheless. They would, if their height was defined by Layer Elevation/Layer Height.

A lost story bound happens easily when walls are copied from one file to the other or there is a change in the file's story structure.

The file comes from VW 2019 but the issue is still valid in VW 2021. 		Mihail Rizov
VB-171895

IfcElementAssembly: not supported by symbols

We can create ifcElementAssembly entities as groups, but we cannot use symbols anywhere, or the elements there included -items determining the assembly- won't be resolved.

Please open the attached file and export it as IFC: the symbols used as assembly don't list any included item in Solibri.

See screenshot.

It is vital to be able to use symbols for this functionality, or projects cannot be managed in the geometry. Groups are not batch-editable.

  		Mihail Rizov
VB-175229

IfcWallStandardCase: Style's Function not returned in Worksheets (or anywhere)

I don't know if this is a bug or not, and if, to what it applies.

Nevertheless the situation is too complex, seen from the side of the user and something should be done to simplify it. We need these things to be in sync to work out of the box.

Wall Styles offer a Function field: Wall Style dialog, Data tab (screenshot 1)
* The shipped worksheet template Wall Style Report from Defaults/Reports_Schedules offers a column for Function (screenshot 2), but this will return the wall style name in all cases, because implies that the IFC mapping is set to IfcWallStandardCase.ObjectType, which is not.
* The out-of-the-box IFC mapping doesn't map the Function field at all (screenshot 3)

Fixing this by setting 
* map Style.Function to IfcWallType.PredefinedType
* fix the shipped worksheet templates

is on my opinion necessary for allowing both
* IFC mapping out of the box
* Reporting out of the box

All in all I pledge for a clearer concept for the Wall/Slab Data fields. 		Mihail Rizov

VB-168935

Plant shadows has irregular behaviour

I have plants created with two sets of 2D geometry - photo-realistic and sketch. If the photo-realistic image is at the bottom (i.e. will create the shadow) the shadows disappear if grouping the plants.

If I then change so the simpler geometry is at the bottom, the shadows reappear.

For Landscape design, it is important not to have to create several different symbols for each tree, especially if working in BIM. You must be able to illustrate the same tree in several different ways, otherwise the whole 'draw it once' and 'one model' falls.

 

There also seems to be an intermittent bug with the annotations - sometimes the polygon display works, sometimes not. Sometimes, if I close down the file, close VW and then reopen it, the settings have changed, both annotations and shadows.

Video and file are attached

  		Bozhidar Stanchev

# You should have one result, select download and once downloaded place the object on the document
# Open the recourse manager and navigate to the newly created textures

_Notice the following:_
* _The clear texture if edited, has a transparency of over 1000%_
* _The silver (metal) texture has a transparency of 3%_

VB-171680

HSVPs with Infinite Cut Plane Height and Finite Extents Below Cut Plane are Broken

Horizontal Section Viewports (HSVPs) with Cut Plane Height: Infinite and Extents Below Cut Plane: Finite Depth are broken in the following ways, which are shown in the attached video:
# HSVP renders empty
# Edit Section In-Place displays empty
# Edit Design Layer with "Display with Clip Cube" enabled displays with an incorrect Clip Cube

 

For the HSVP shown in the attached video the results should be the following when the HSVP has Cut Plane Height: Infinite and Extents Below Cut Plane: Finite Depth of 2':
# HSVP render should look the same as the HSVP's render when it has Cut Plane Height: Infinite and Extents Below Cut Plane: Infinite since the Extents Below Cut Plane: Finite Depth of 2' is below the top of all the objects shown in the HSVP
# Edit Section In-Place should show everything on the Design Layer from 2' upwards
# Edit Design Layer with "Display with Clip Cube" enabled should show everything on the Design Layer from 2' upwards

 

The file shown in the video is also attached for testing.

Please note that while the HSVP Background Render shown in the video is OpenGL, this issue is present for other render modes as well (e.g., Hidden Line).

 

Putting a breakpoint in CutPlaneAndExtents::GetBelowCutPlaneElevation() would probably be a good starting point. 		Josh Loy
VB-171769

HSVPs Created from the Bottom Face of the Clip Cube are Broken.

Horizontal Section Viewports (HSVPs) created from the bottom face of the Clip Cube have issues when it comes to rendering the HSVP, editing the HSVP in-place, and editing the Design Layer with "Display with Clip Cube" enabled from the HSVP. The attached video shows some of these issues and how they depend on the Cut Plane and Extents options selected for the HSVP. It is important to note that near the end of the video a Finite Depth of 6' is attempted to be entered after a Finite Height of -4' has been entered and we are told that "The below cut plane depth cannot be higher than the cut plane", but this does not make sense in the case of a HSVP that should be looking upwards, not downwards.

The attached file will open to the Sheet Layer shown in the attached video, but also contains Sheet Layers with HSVPs created using the menu command and from the top face of the Clip Cube for comparison. 		Josh Loy
VB-171683

Updating HSVP from Clip Cube Bottom Results in Incorrect Cut Plane and Extents Values and Crop

Selecting a HSVP, choosing to Edit Design Layer with "Display with Clip Cube" enabled, and then updating the HSVP from the bottom of the Clip Cube results in: the HSVP's Cut Plane and Extents values getting messed up and an incorrect crop being added to the HSVP. Please watch the attached video to see a demonstration of this workflow and issue. The file shown in the video is also attached. Justin Hutchison
VB-172451

Updating a Section viewport via Clip Cube face results in incorrect cut plane direction

This problem appears to have to do with updating section viewports that were created from a rotated viewport.

To reproduce:
# Open the attached VWX file
# Go to Sheet Layer *2*
You will see 8 vertical section viewports (within the sheet border) created from an *unrotated* horizontal section viewport (outside the sheet border).
# Edit the design layers of one of the vertical section viewports using the "Display with Clip Cube" option.
Notice the clip cube display in the design layer as expected.
# Right-click on the clip cube face that's coincident with the cut plane and choose the "Update Section Viewport" context command.
# Click the "Return to Viewport" button to return to the sheet layer.
# Update the viewport
Notice the viewport updates with no visible change.
# Edit the design layers of the same viewports using the "Display with Clip Cube" option.
Notice the clip cube display in the design layer as expected.
# Go to Sheet Layer *3*
You will see 8 vertical section viewports (within the sheet border) created from a *rotated* horizontal section viewport (outside the sheet border).
# Repeat steps 3 - 6
*Notice*, after step 6, the viewport visibly changes.
# Edit the design layers of the same viewports using the "Display with Clip Cube" option.
*Notice* the clip cube display in the design layer is not as expected. 		Josh Loy

VB-175777

Symbol's 2D Component Hatch Fill Shifts in SVP when Navigating in Best Performance

When navigating (i.e., panning or zooming) in Best Performance, the hatch fill of a Symbol's 2D Component displayed in a Section Viewport (SVP) shifts from its final frame position. Watch the attached video and use the attached file, shown in the video, to replicate this issue. It is important to note that the hatch fill that shifts is the 2D Fill version of the hatch and not the 'surface hatch' version, which is in the correct position in final frame and during navigation. It may also be worth noting that the SVP's rotation does not appear to affect the direction of the shift relative to the symbol. Josh Loy

VB-174918

Interior Elevation Section Lines Not Updating

VB-176117

Fill Attributes work inconsistently for Auto Hybrids

When you set the 2D Appearance settings of an Auto Hybrid to "Use 2D Attributes of Contained Objects," you'd expect the resulting Auto Hybrid to do just that. However, this appears to work inconsistently.

See the attached file. Starting at the top, the example Auto Hybrid contains 7 Extrudes inside, each set to one of the Fill options in the Attributes Palette. No Fill, Solid, Pattern, and Hatch all work as expected. But Tile, Gradient, and Image do not.

 

From there I experimented more. The next Auto Hybrid is set to "Use Class 2D Attributes" instead of "Use 2D Attributes of Contained Objects." First I tried a class set to a Gradient fill. This one was weird. It applied the gradient, but only to one of the extrudes, with the rest only getting the solid color at the respective end of the gradient spectrum. Even more odd is that the gradient seems to always map to the top-most extrude in the stacking order.

This Auto Hybrid was set so that the extrudes are cut through.

For the next Auto Hybrid, I switched the settings so that the extrudes were below the cut plane, which made it map the gradient to just a small sliver of the top-most extrude. Very odd.

Then I tried using classes set to Tile and Image fills. Funny enough, these Auto Hybrids worked exactly as expected.

Then I tried cutting through the extrudes with a Section Viewport to see if that provided any useful insights. The Section Viewport is set to "Use Attributes of Original Objects." Here, all the fill types worked, except for the Gradient one only shows one color instead of the entire gradient.

 

Clearly there's lots of inconsistency and unexpected results in all of this. From my perspective, if some of the fill types simply didn't work, and did so in a consistent way, I'd understand it as some sort of built-in limitation. But the ways in which they don't work are so inconsistent that I have to assume it's a web of bugs. 		Christopher Graye
VB-168951

redline tool bugs

The redline tool does not allow multiple items to be included as part of the markup. For example, draw two lines and keep selected. Draw a redline by rectangle and select 'Attach the current selection as sketch'. One of the lines is not included.

Also, the 'Attach the current selection as sketch' selection button is not 'sticky'; I have to select it every time. 		Kostadin Ivanov

VB-168551

Editing 3D-Plane Callout Causes Ruler Bar to Shift

I've attached a movie and test file that show this. The file has a modified user origin and contains a Callout object placed on a 3D plane.

To reproduce:

-Go to a Top view
-Note the position of (0,0) in the ruler bar
-Now double-click the Callout to edit it

VB-168784

Referenced DWG Changes Size Following Update

I've attached a movie that shows this from a blank file and a DWG that can be used to duplicate it.

To reproduce:

-Open a blank file
-Right-click in the References tab of the Nav palette and choose "New"
-Select the attached DWG
-In the Import dialog, choose "Use detected DXF/DWG file units" and set the Unitless option to anything other than Millimeters

Note that the Referenced DWG object is just a few inches/cm wide initially.

-Now update the reference

Note that now the Referenced DWG gets many times larger.

If the Unitless option is set to Millimeters the problem won't happen.

If you import/reference the DWG using the File/Import command instead of the Nav Palette, the unitless menu remains grayed and you're forced to enter specified units. In that case the size change won't happen.

The same thing happened in VW 2019 when the Unitless option was introduced. 		Nina Ivanova
VB-172326

Space in symbol: Label scale is wrong in PDF export

When you place a space object in a symbol, the label's scale is changing to world based units during the export when the check box "recalculate plug in objects" is checked in the export settings.

Note: export to PDF should be executed from within the Sheet layer (from within the Design Layer, the problem does not occur)

this is strange, because the recalculation of the plug in object in any other way is working fine 		Christopher Graye
VB-175582

Video crop changes position

This only seems to happen when following these specific steps, but this does seem like it could be a fairly common occurrence when working with NDI and crops.

1) Assign video input to a mesh.

2) In the select video input dialog, select an NDI stream and make sure it is set to low bandwidth.

3) Create a crop, the issue is most noticeable if you create a fairly small crop in the bottom right corner, like 10-20% of the source stream. At this point, the crop appears to be correct.

4) Click on the NDI stream the crop was made from and change it to high bandwidth.

5) Click on the crop. At this point the crop has changed position. 		Kevin Linzey
VB-176031

Crash on resetting invalid video crop

I was testing things related to the issue found recently with a webcam in use by another program, making it's content inaccessible. Currently when this happens the input still shows up in the video input dialog even though when you click on it there isn't any content to display. This itself isn't a problem unless we want to hide it for UX reasons. Assigning a video input from the list that is in use in another program just gets you a black surface, and you can reset the input without issue.

The problem comes when you make a crop of one of these invalid inputs. The crop can be created and applied to a mesh just fine, which results in a black surface like you'd expect, but it crashes if you then try to reset the input.

There's probably a few things that should be fixed here.

First, we shouldn't crash if we somehow have bad content assigned when resetting whether a crop or otherwise, however we manage to get into such a situation (not sure if this is the only way).

Second, we probably shouldn't allow an empty crop to be created.

Third and lowest priority/importance, we might want to hide inputs from the list if they don't carry any content. This is something I see some programs (like zoom) doing to make the interface a bit cleaner which is always nice. 		Kevin Linzey
VB-170299

Grade objects are not updated when the object they pull elevation from is moved

In the attached video, I position several grade objects over a site model.  Their slope and elevation updates based on their location on the site model.  I then move the site model, but the grade objects do not recognize the change, and do not update until they are modified in some way. Bozhidar Stanchev

VB-173785

Energy Analysis: default content from WG fails, no alias support

The source data for the lambdas used by Wall/Slab/Roof components, Materials etc. is stored in the default content Energy Analysis/Building Envelope. This default content
* doesn't support a workgroup folder
* doens't support aliases: the xml files must be copied 5 times across identical folders

This makes the maintenance and efficient management of such data impossible in a worgroup and very inefficient even when alone.

Lambda values are the same unregarded if used in a roof or a wall, etc.

Please, by closed VW, install these folders in the default content:
* unzip "Energy Analysis Folder in WG folder.zip" in a workgroup folder
* unzip "Energy Analysis install in user folder.zip" in your user folder

Launch VW, refresh libraries when prompted.

Try to set the lambda of a wall component accessing the default content. Nothing shows (screenshot) 		Kostadin Ivanov

VB-175445

Referenced DWG Fails to Show Some Objects in 2021

The attached movie and test file show this in VW 2020 compared to 2021.

To reproduce, in each version, import the attached DWG with the "Referenced" option enabled and everything else at default.

If the DWG is imported instead of referenced, the problem won't occur.

The same thing happens going back to SP0. 		Vasil Kitanov
VB-173127

ConnectCAD: Device database still has some inaccurate data.

There are still device specifications in the database that have the old default dimensions:

W 300, H 300, D 300

In these cases the Make / Model should be researched online and the true dimensions from the manufacturers spec sheet should be entered.

Also device specifications for rack-mounting items need review. Full rack-mount width is 482.6mm but in some records it is clear that these have been rounded to 482 or 483. Another clue as to whether a device is rack-mounted is the height which should be an integer multiple of 44.45mm. Again we see quite a few instances of rounding up or down.

What's needed in these cases is a review of the actual manufacturers spec to find out if the device is rack-mounted or not. If it is, then the dimensions in our database should be modified to correct rack-width spec, and the height be set to 44.45 x the number of rack U. This way the device builder will correctly created a rack-mounted device.

It is appreciated that the curation done last year was under considerable time pressure. Much was achieved but we now need to schedule a further clean-up. 		Chris Baccala
VB-168497

Groups with hybrid symbols inside Symbols get removed.

When creating a symbol out of grouped hybrid symbol instances the groups around those hybrid symbols get removed.

Also when editing the symbol, I can create groups around the hybrid symbol instances, but as soon as the symbol is exited the group gets removed.
Rick Berge
