VB-169669

Walls in top/plan viewports are not exported to DWG

Mail to and tech support answer:

​One of our clients faces issues with the export of his sheet layer to the model space in a DWG:
- VW crashes when "export tile fills" is enabled.
- When "export tile fills" is disabled, the walls in the top/plan viewports or not or just partly exported.

After a few tests by myself, I discovered the following issues in exporting his document:
- VW crashes indeed on the export of tile fills. I experienced trouble with tiles and DWG before. Are there any known bugs on this?
- One of his top/plan viewport contains a roof object in a grayed layer. If I disable this grayed layer, some more objects appear as if the roof (which does have a solid fill) was covering them. is it known that DWG cannot handle grayed objects very well? do you think it works as designed?
- The strangest thing: If I want the walls to appear in the exported file, I need to first enter the design layer of each top/plan viewport by dubble clicking on the and exit again. The export following this operation is correct (exept from the missing tile fills). This is the second time I see this problem since the release of SP3. Did you encounter this issue before?

I added the document, the exported DWG's and a video of the problem in the wetransfer-link:
[https://we.tl/t-kds39961LS]

Thanks in advance for taking a look.

Kind regards,
---
Jeroen Bervoets


----

Tech support:

Hi Jeroen,

The first and last issues do sound like they are bugs. There might be something specific in their file that is causing this, because they aren't issues that I have seen before. The second issue seems like it is a limitation of DWG files in AutoCAD and is probably Works As Designed. Can you submit the file on JIRA so that engineering can take a look?

Thanks,

If he imports that into VW everything looks fine, the individual images are arranged orthogonally in 3D. If he makes the dxf export out of VW with the same output data as in Rhino, all images are superimposed. When re-importing into VW, I then have 6344 superimposed pictures with which you can start very little. It looks strongly as if something goes wrong with the export from VW."

VB-169227

Export to DXF/DWG: Slash in file name popups a ODA Platform Error

This is how we reproduce this situation:

1. Export a file to DXF/DWG
2. When naming the file include a slash ( / ) in the name and click OK to start the Export.
3. A popup will appear (see screenshot attached):

ODA Platform Error.
The file could not be opened. Make sure it is not already open in another application.

This does not happen with a Backslash ( \ ) or even a vertical bar ( | ). 		Vasil Kitanov
VB-168891

3D DWG Export result is wrong when last saved in a 3D view

When you export a DWG from a 3D view, the result depends on the view in which the document is saved the last time.

-If the document is saved the last time in a 2D view: All hybrid objects in non- active layers are exported in a plan view

-If the document is saved the last time in a 3D view: the export is correct, all objects on all layers are exported in 3D
----
- Open the added document and put it in a 2D plan view
- Save the document
- Close the document and open it again
- Go to a 3D view
- Export to a DWG

if you open the DWG in a DWG viewer, you'll see that the 2D/3D symbol on the non- active design layer its 2D part is exported in stead of its 3D part. 		Vasil Kitanov
VB-171361

Angled HC Parking Space Incorrect Dimension

See attached file. I have filed this same bug for prior versions, but it is important so I thought perhaps re-filing here might help to get it to the top of someone's to-do list. Thanks.

When HC space is is part of an angled set of spaces the dimensions are wrong. I have a feeling that this is due to the programming depending on the horizontal dimension of the "aisle width" parameter without consideration for the width perpendicular to the lane markers.

In any case, this is very poorly implemented and causes much frustration...  		Kostadin Ivanov

VB-168224

Exporting tree list in Plant database doesn't work

You can export existing tree list in Plant database by file>export existing tree list and the file should be replaced by chosen set of plants. It doesn't work because it creates "existing tree.txt" file in user folder, whereas VW uses "istniejące drzewo.txt" file. See screen recording attached.

This recording was done in the Polish version, but the problem also exists in Dutch and French - because of the hard coded file name string "Existing Tree.txt". 		Bozhidar Stanchev
VB-167791

Plant Tags appear differently on Mojave OS

Spacing in the Plant Tags seems to be slightly larger after lines than in all other Operating Systems.  I've attached screenshots displaying this behavior here.

Since this seems to be an issue specifically on Mojave, I can't say for sure if this is even our issue, or if this even can be fixed.  But I wanted to document it to see what we can do.

Thanks for your time, and have an awesome day!  :) 		Bozhidar Stanchev

VB-175191

Revit Export - Site model is wierd

Export a site model and open in revit, it appears really odd - see images and files.

VB-175676

vwx mix user origin with internal origin

On several occasions, our user origin has been replaced by internal origin when other programs import our exports (IFC, DWG). Also, when using some vwx-files as X-ref in other vwx-files, they have sometimes moved, using internal origin instead of user origin.

It is not possible to change user-origin to fit internal origin as this is project-zero for everyone in those projects (BIM). It must also be possible to change coordinates in user-origin to global coordinates used in project for exact geo-positioning.

In vwx it is not possible to set internal origin, so we can not move it to user origin. Suppose it is a bug. When update a x-ref it jumps to correct position, but then, maybe a week or some days later, it has moved and must be updated again...

Just to explain our problem, attached is a screendump of a coordination point for one of our BIM-projects, "project zero", unit here is mm. This project has in all 12 buildings, 6-17 floors.... Referenced files can come in both project0 and NTM-coordinates, exports are requested both in project0 from consultants and NTM-coordinates from construction companies. 		Vasil Kitanov
VB-170822

Import Revit (Batch) Command Done Not Allow Access to RVT/RVA Dialog : JBC

Import Revit allows the user to set the desired options for importing Revit files via the RVT/RFA Import Options dialog. When using the Import Revit (Batch) command, you do not get access to this dialog so can choose how the objects should be imported.

Thanks. 		Vasil Kitanov
VB-173777

Foliage not filling out the profile correctly when using create objects from shapes

In the attached video, I use the create objects from shapes command to turn a square into a foliage object.  It does not fill out the shape vertically, it stays shorter than the profile.  Increasing the height of the profiles does seem to have an effect on the height of the foliage.  Happens for any shape that is used, rectangle, polygon, polyline, circle, etc.  This worked properly in 2018 SP6, but is broken in 2019 SP5. Bozhidar Stanchev
VB-173692

ODBC - Export as Database Table Dialog may cause a crash when a big number of rows are selected and deleted.

This is not always reproduceable however may cause Vectorworks to lock. To reproduce:
# Draw a door object in the document.
# Connect to an existing database or create a new SQLite database.
# From Tools / Database/ Record Format Database Connection select the record and "Export as Database Table".
# Try to  select a big number of rows in the List browser and press "Remove" button in the dialog or Delete key.

Sometimes the operation is very slow and sometimes Vectorworks locks. Door record format was chosen because it has many record fields. 		Vladislav Stanev

VB-169641

Foliage reshape path problem

After you created a Foliage object you can click on "Reshape Path" button in the Info Palette - similar to activate the Reshape tool. You can edit the path that define the area for the foliage.

Problem is the fact that when you completed the reshape operation, the Foliage some a portion of the area only.

The object can be correctly reshaped using the contextual command if you right-click on the object. The right-click procedure allows you to reshape it correctly without problem.

Please also note that the contextual menu has a problem too - it shows the "Plug-in Object Options" command twice. 		Bozhidar Stanchev
VB-168266

Hardscape: Attribute mapping tool not working on the Hardscape's border in this case.

Here is a test file with a Hardscape object of Slab 3D type with border. The main area and the border use the same texture.
I can't find a way to make the Attribute mapping tool work on the hardscape's border in this case.

(In general, the attribute mapping tool's behavior on the hardscape seems unstable - during my testing there was a case when the attribute mapping tool didn't show the rectangle control points but after restarting VW I was not able to reproduce it anymore).

Do the following steps:
- delete the user folder cache (not sure whether it is necessary...).
- launch VW and open the test file
- change to Top plan and render in openGL
- select the Hardscape object
- activate the Attribute Mapping tool
- the Part popup in the tool bar doesn't list the border (the only listed choices are "Main Slab texture" and "Overall").

(see also the attached screen video) 		Bozhidar Stanchev

VB-168012

Marionette "Point on Surface" does not work with some surfaces.

I am not sure this is actually a technical bug/limitation but the description of the node suggests that this operation should work on all surfaces.
I have attached an example of a simple Marionette that places symbols perpendicular to a NURBS surface. The two key nodes are "Point on Surface" and "Orient".

There are two NURBS surfaces (Named "test" and "test2") in the document. Currently, the simple surface (test2) is set as the criteria in the Obj by Crit node and the network works well.

Setting the Node to reference the second surface (test) returns nothing.

As a user I don't know why this may be happening so I am not sure if this is a limitation with the type of surface or a bug with the "Point on Surface" node.

Maybe the description should be changed (if the node works ok). 		Konstantin Lalkovski
VB-168350

Marionette object has no fill in section plane

When a marionette object contains a subtraction of volumes which creates a void in the section plane, the resulting section plane is not filled. see the attached video and file for a comparison between a marionette object (not displaying correctly in section plane) an the generic solid created by ungrouping the marionette object (displayed correctly)

 

Create a marionette network which generates a solid subtraction. The solid subtraction should create a void within the general form (like a tube). Convert the network to a marionette object. Create a section viewport on a place where the section plane's polygon displays the section of the tube. 		Konstantin Lalkovski

Open the Resource Manager

Save and Commit - You will notice none of the layers are committed into the PF.

The created Marionette did not register the layer and story creation with the undo system. 		Konstantin Lalkovski

VB-168667

Survey Request- Regarding the Engineering Properties of the object that executed Clip Surface.

This is a survey request from the customer.
The Engineering Properties of the object that executed Clip Surface has unintended values.
 
Example of reproduction:
1. Draw two concentric circles. The Section Properties of each circle have the same value on the X and Y axes.
2. Select two concentric circles and execute "Clip Surface".
3. Select the generated donut-shaped Polyline and execute "Engineering Properties".
4. Checking the section properties in the engineering properties dialog box, the values are different for the x and y axes. (Engineering Properties_1.png)
 
Why are different values on the X and Y axes?

In the following steps, Section Properties will approach the intended value.
 
5. Select the donut-shaped Polyline and execute "Convert to Polygons".
6. If you select two separated Polygons and execute "Add Surface", it becomes a donut-shaped Polyline again.
7. Select the donut-shaped Polyline and execute "Engineering Properties".
8. Section Properties of Engineering Properties X axis and Y axis are changed to almost the same value. (Engineering Properties_2.png)
 
{color:#172b4d}P{color}{color:#172b4d}lease refer to "10636.mov".{color}
 
{color:#172b4d}Best regards, {color}
{color:#172b4d} Takaaki Mizuno {color}
{color:#172b4d} A&A{color} 		Konstantin Lalkovski

VB-174400

VB-171378

Data Visualization auto colors items that are not selected as "apply"

Users may desire to re-auto-color their data vis when new items exist in their drawing. Items that were previously set to not be included in the list should be ignored during the recoloring as they could mess up the appearance the user is looking for.

 

For example, a file set to Function: Layer will include sheet layers in the auto-color. A user may decide to not include all of the sheet layers and have a gradient. If a user then adds new layers to the drawing and recolors, all of the sheet layers will be included again on the next edit and will need to be manually removed (the user is also required to delete the layers from the list in order to not include them in the gradient. related: VB-171377) 		Karthick Chilaka
VB-173572

FS: Data Visualization of Data Set Settings

Please look at the Testfile: "Datenbank über Datenset Datenvisualisierung.vwx"

There you can find 3 columns - Attached to them is a normal record with one boolean field.

This field is put into a Data Set in the Data Manager.

Now:
# Create a Data Visualization which shows the status of the record field
# Activate that  Data Visualization
# Open the Data Manager and create a Data Set which contains this record field  "Load Bearing"
# Activate one of the columns.
# Go to the OIP and activate the Data Set
# Switch on/off the boolean field "Load Bearing"

-> The Data Visualization does not show the change

Cross check the behavior with the pure record field

1. Go to the OIP and DEACTIVATE the Data Set 

2. Go to the OIP and activate the record field

3. Switch on/off the boolean field "Load Bearing"

-> The Data Visualization now show the change as desired 		Karthick Chilaka
VB-171583

Data Visualization - Unintended toggling of checkmark when performing multiple selections

When the Command or Shift keys are pressed to enable a multiple selection, if the user clicks in the Apply column to select the row, the checkmark is toggled on that line item. This is likely an unintended behavior.

Video attached. In the video I am using the Shift key to create my multiple selection. 		Karthick Chilaka
VB-171390

T02122 - Auto Color should be remembered per visualization instead of globally

If a user sets up an auto color gradient/scheme for a visualization, then chooses another set of colors for their next visualization, if they update the first one, it uses the last chosen settings and replaces the scheme the user had previously wanted.

I realize this is stated in the TO, so technically is WAD, but I believe the functionality is hindering to the users and should be reconsidered. Feel free to move this to an enhancement request, though. 		Karthick Chilaka

VB-167399

U-Shaped Stair Section

VB-169704

SBE: Problems with clip cube / convert to mesh

For some reason, the clip cube paints the 3D polygon of the last step of the stair in the test file in red (see attached screenshot).

There doesn't seem to be anything wrong with the 3D polygon. There are no polygons at the same location as you can check in testfile "stair converted into polygons".

It is also strange that the clip cube doesn't paint the polygon in red while it is still a 3D polygon in a group, but paints it red once the group has been converted into a mesh.

I attached three testfiles:

- stair with 3d polygons.vwx: stair using a hidden test setting that skips the conversion of 3D polygon groups into meshes. Here the clip cube looks OK

- stair with mesh.vwx: same stair, but using normal settings, i.e. groups of 3D polygons are converted into meshes. Here, the clip cube paints the polygon red despite the mesh is based on the same 3D polygons as in the prevous testfile.

- stair converted into polygons.vwx: Same as stair with 3d polygons.vwx, but ungrouped so you can see that there are no coplanar or identical polygons at the position of the "red" polygon.

This is very weird. Imho either GroupToMesh creates an incorrect mesh from correct 3D polygons, or the clip cube algorithm is not working correctly and draws the polygon in red although it is OK.

This bug is (at least partly) the cause for VB-168740. 		Justin Hutchison
VB-170748

Stair - Strange Artefacts/Artifacts when viewing Stair using Clip Cube

Place Stair.

Enable Clip cube. 		Justin Hutchison

VB-172490

Hardscape Border Fills Fail to Show in Section Viewports in 2021

The attached movie and test file show this in 2020 compared to 2021. The file contains an Aligned Slab Hardscape that uses by-class attributes for its border's Section Fill, and directly-applied attributes for its Section Pen. It also includes a Section Viewport that displays the components.

To reproduce, open the file in each version and update the SVP.

Note that the border's blue section fill fails to show in 2021.

If you edit the Hardscape's border attributes and change the Section Pen to by-class, the border fill will then show in the SVP again.

I don't see this problem with regular "Slab" Hardscapes. 		Bozhidar Stanchev

VB-171859

IFC 2x3 Export Bug Submit

Attached is the VWX file where, during a IFC 2x3 export process, I was prompted with a request to submit a bug.

Looks like a text file was generated too. Also attached. 		Mihail Rizov
VB-169594

Extrude with IFC Data, Export IFC: too far from origin graphical problem

Test.vwx:
1. Draw a 2D object far from origin
2. Extrude the 2D object
3. Insert an IFC data in the object
4. Move it back to the origin
5. Export as IFC
6. Open the IFC file
Result is the Test.ifc file. If an object is created too far from origin, even after moving it back to the origin before exporting, the export retains the "too far from origin" graphical problem. We already had a couple of Customers complaining about this problem.

We believe that if the object is moved to the origin and then we can again see it being correctly displayed, then it should be also correctly displayed after the export, which isn't the case.

With Test 2.vwx this does not happen, because the object was created in the origin. 		Mihail Rizov
VB-171530

AHA: Symbol position is wrong in IFC4 export (Works in 2x3)

More and more customers switching to IFC4 although we do not recommend this. Unfortunately these customers often are under pressure from building owner or BIM consulting companies.

We realized that the symbol position in IFC4 export is incorrect if the symbol contain wall, slabs and other building elements. This works correctly in IFC 2x3.

Steps to reproduce the problem:
# Watch the attached movie first
# Open "Testfile 20200626_01" to reproduce the problem

 

Would be nice if this can be supported soon. 		Mihail Rizov

[https://forum.vectorworks.net/index.php?/topic/77330-landscape-area-vs-site-model/&tab=comments#comment-371498]

The user exports a landscape area that is far from the origin, and this causes it to shift in relation to the site model.  For a test file, use the file in the forum link. 		Mihail Rizov

VB-169758

Structural member is always exported as not "LoadBearing"

If you define a structural member is "LoadBearing" in Vectorworks, this information is not exported correctly to IFC. If you view the ifc file in "Solibri" or "bim collab zoom" afterwards, you will see the parameter "LoadBearing" has the value "false", while it should be "true"
----
- Draw a structural member
- Go to the tab "data" in the OIP
- Select the ifc-record "Pset_Beamommon"
- Check the box "LoadBearing"
- Export the file to IFC
- Open the file in f.e. Solibri
- Go to the tab "Pset_BeamCommon
- You will see the parameter "LoadBearing" has the value "false", while it should be "true" 		Mihail Rizov

VB-175505

IFC Re-Import: clip cube not working on subtracted solids

The attached video shows the Problem being reproduced.

1. Create two extrude objects that overlap each other.

2. Duplicate the objects and put them side by side.

3. Use Subtract Solids on the replicated objects.

4. Insert IFC Data in all objects and Export as IFC

5. Re-Import the exported IFC file

6. Use Clip Cube

Result: Clip Cube does not work with objects that had the Subtract Solids used. 		Mihail Rizov

VB-168768

Snapshot rendering is not updated in the BCF Manager dialog.

Snapshot rendering is not updated in the BCF Manager dialog.
 
Reproduction steps:
1. After creating the 3D object (Extrude, etc.), Open BCF Manager and confirm that Set Current Rendering Mode is set to Wireframe in the BCF Manager dialog.
2. After creating a new Topic, click "New Comment" and click "Attach Snapshot" in New Comment dialog, a preview of the snapshot will be displayed in wireframe.
3. Click OK to close New Comment dialog.
4. A preview of the snapshot in the BCF Manager dialog is displayed in wireframe.
5. Set the current rendering mode to OpenGL. The rendering of the back drawing area is updated to OpenGL.
6. Click “Edit Comment”, and then click “Attach Snapshot” in the Edit Comment dialog, and a preview of the snapshot will be displayed in OpenGL.
7. Click OK to close the Edit Comment dialog.
8. Snapshot preview in BCF Manager dialog is not updated from wireframe to OpenGL.
 
{color:#172b4d}Please refer to "10651.mov".{color}
{color:#172b4d}  {color}
{color:#172b4d} Best regards,{color}
{color:#172b4d} Takaaki Mizuno{color}
{color:#172b4d} A&A{color} 		Mihail Rizov

I inserted walls into a symbol and distributed them on different design levels. Then export as an ifc project (version 4) and check it in BIMCollab. The different symbols placed were moved to the same level and to the VW origin. In ifc (Version 2.3) the positions are correct.

VB-172257

Ifc Data Manager 2018 | Data Manager 2021

Hello!

In VW2018 attach your own record format to a wall, map it in the Ifc Data Manager, change in object info Data Pane a value = it is directly mapped to the Pset (very easy!).

Open this file in 2019,2020, 2021. The attached record format is preserved but the value in the custom Pset is gone. Add the record format again in the "new" Data Manager, define the mapping. The values of the VW Data Sets are nor corresponding with the Ifc Data Sets. I found no way to use the record format as a source and map it to another custom Pset. In the record format it is very comfortable to work with popup field. No I have to fill the Ifc custom Pset manually. In 2018 it so much easier to work with own Psets and mapping them into the Ifs custom Pset. see Movie and files.

Maybe I missed something, but if I'm right, this means a great regression. 

Kind regards

Frank 		Mihail Rizov

VB-172649

Spotlight Cable tools breakout and plug box problem

Currently Break outs and plug box distributor objects do not display the channel number (or unit number) of lighting devices on their outputs in the OIP, only the connected cable ID.

This makes it impossible to create a data tag for the breakout or plug-box that correctly displays the the connected lighting devices ID (channel or otherwise),

Correctly displaying the devices (lighting or other) which are attached to a circuit is a fundamental part and requirement of documenting cable systems 		Kevin Linzey
VB-168631

center mark tool and radial dimension tool | beta alert 9

The center mark tool and radial dimension tool do not work properly.

- center mark tool sees both circles but only one circle is possible to get the center mark, see attached movie

- when using the radial dimension tool 9 out of 10 times it is not possible to dimension the circle because it is not 'seen' by the tool. See movie where it was not possible to dimension the circles, yesterday i was able to do that, unclear why

- Hovering above the circle does not make it recognize the circle. Sometimes you have to click somewhere else on the object (like cm's away of it) to get it to 'see' the circle.

- when using the radial dimension tool several times in a row/clicks it gets the beta 9 alert.

attached 3 videos:

* shows that is not possible to dimension two circles in the file, only one gets the center mark and radial dimension.
* one shows that you can dimension a circle by clicking cm`s away from the circle that is not even visible in on your screen
* beta alert 9 after some actions/clicks 		Karthick Chilaka

# In a new file select the Constrained Line Dimension Tool and set the mode to chain mode
# Click on the document and press tab
# In the length, type 10'
# Place the second click straight up and the third to the marker
# Move the mouse and press tab again
# Again in the length type in 10'

_Notice there does not seem to be a good method to use a datum to set the length of a second portion of a chain dimension.  My result will give me anything from a measurement from a position that is neither the 2nd or 3 click, but some location my cursor_  		Karthick Chilaka

VB-175894

Question: Text size in dimensions when changing scaling on Page Setup.

Text size of a text style by class will be adjusted if you change scaling on the page setup. But a dimension drew by the Constrained Chain Mode won’t be adjusted.
Is this a bug or by design?

Steps to reproduce.
1) Go to Organization > Classes Tab. Then select “None” and click “Edit”.
2) Check “Use at Creation” on Text Style and choose “Dimensions 10 pt” on the pulldown.
3) Click OK to close. Then select “Dimension” and click “Edit”.
4) Check “Use at Creation” on Text Style and choose “Dimensions 10 pt” on the pulldown.
5) Click OK.
6) Go to Page Setup > Printer Setup. Then choose Vectorworks on the pulldown.
7) Change scaling from 100% to any value. (Ex. 50%)
8) Select the Text tool and enter any texts. The size will be 20 pt.
9) Select the Constrained Linear Dimension tool and draw with the Constrained Chain Mode.
10) The size of the dimension value will be 10 pt. But it will be 20 pt if you draw with the Constrained Linear Mode.

Please see an attached movie.

Best regards,
Hitoshi Takeuchi
A&A 		Karthick Chilaka

VB-175435

Doubled Custom Dimension Standard - one works other not

Attached is a .vwx that compares the correct and incorrect dimensions display, side by side.

The Client did the following:

1. Created a custom Dimension Standard based from SIA / IND1356 (fixed HL), this is marked in the test file in Green.

2. Copied the first customer Dimension Standard to create a second one, which is marked in the test file as Blue.

Then used both as seen in the file. They do not give the same results. The Blue one seems to be displayed in a wrong unexpected way.

After deleting the Green (first customer Dimension Standard), then the Blue stars being correctly displayed.

What is causing this, please? It can't possibly be WAD.
Karthick Chilaka
VB-169176

Viewport Annotations: Dimensions change with Projection used

The attached video shows the problem being reproduced.

We have a Viewport of a 3D Object, with which we use a Projection Orthogonal and Perspective.

Like it is shown in the video, we insert Dimensions in the Annotations of the Viewport, when in Projection Orthogonal or Perspective. The Dimensions shown are of the Projection and not of the object real size.

We believe that the Dimensions should not be influenced by the type of Projection used, but that Dimensions should always show the real size of the object, independent of how it is displayed. 		Karthick Chilaka
VB-172351

Putting a landscape area inside a symbol will cause dimensions to shift

In the attached video, I put a landscape area with dimensions on it into a symbol.  This causes the dimensions to shift.  Does not happen when put into a group.  I originally noticed this with dimensions and made the video using dimensions, but it happens with other objects as well, like lines, rectangles, etc. Karthick Chilaka
VB-175392

Cannot stretch dimension using 2D reshape tool

See the attached test file and movie.

In previous versions this bug has surfaced. It is back in 2021.

Dimension witness handles do not stretch when we want to change a dimension.

We should be able to stretch a dimension using the 2D reshape tool. Currently, the dimension moves in its entirety. 		Karthick Chilaka
VB-167825

Chain Dimensions and Single Dimensions display differently when using Class Opacity Overrides

Chain Dimensions appear to be a "Group" of individual Dimensions contained inside a classed container that is also Dimension Class.

When both Chain and Single Dimensions are in a VP that has Class Over rides for the Class "Dimension" by using Opacity, the Chain Dimensions are lighter since they appear to be "stepped on twice" by the Class Opacity.

 

In the attached file, you can see the disparity between the 2 different types of dimension objects. This condition appears to be present in 2019 as well.

 

Added a Class called "Opacity" that does not exhibit the same behavior as the Dimension class. 

While not typical work flow, we do occasionally include dimensions on a tenant plan during the schematic phase. We will change the dimension class to a lighter color so that the dimensions do not stand out and become a prominent feature of the drawings. 		Karthick Chilaka
VB-169203

Question : When text is extracted as an EPSF file, it is converted to an outline and cannot be edited as a text object.

When text is extracted as an EPSF file, it is converted to an outline and cannot be edited as text.
This phenomenon occurs on both Windows and Mac.
Is this a specification or a bug?
 
--------------------------
*Target function*
--------------------------
Text Tool
 
--------------------------
*Fonts that will be converted to outlines*
--------------------------
Arial
Futura
Geneva
Helvetica
Skia
Times Roman
Times New Roman
MS Gothic
MS Mincho
Meiryo
Hiragino Kaku Gothic Pro W6
Hiragino Maru Gothic Pro W4
Hiragino Mincho Pro W3
Hiragino Mincho Pro W6
*We have actually confirmed the above fonts, but there may be other fonts that are experiencing this phenomenon.
 
*Remarks*
We have confirmed that only "Hiragino Kaku Gothic Pro W3" fonts are not converted to outlines, but can be edited as text on Adobe Illustrator.
However, depending on the specific character string entered, it was recorded as a different font in the EPSF file, and the path of the text was split.

Although this font is a Japanese font, it is installed by default on macOS displaying Japanese, so I think it is possible to confirm the phenomenon on macOS displaying English.
 
Please refer to attached "10686.mp4" and more files.
 
Best regards
Kentaro Takesue
A&A 		Josh Loy
VB-170138

RW Viewports Fail to Render When Active File is Changed During Processing

I've attached a movie and test file that show this. The file contains an OpenGL viewport and several RW viewports.

To reproduce:

-Open the test file as well as a blank file
-Run the Update All Viewports command in the test file
-Immediately switch to the blank file
-After the renders complete, switch back to the test file

Note that the RW viewports appear empty.

You may also see a problem where the graphics for all the viewports become corrupted. I'm looking at that bug separately.

This is a regression from VW 2020. 		Justin Hutchison

VB-175868

When installing by selecting multiple files from the "Direct Install" menu of Vectorworks Package Manager, the installation progress is not displayed properly.

When installing by selecting multiple files from the "Direct Install" menu of Vectorworks Package Manager, the count of the number of installation files displayed during the installation in the installation dialog is not displayed properly.
Occurs in Mojave, Catalina, and Big Sur. It does not occur on Sierra and High Sierra.
[Reproduction example]
1) Start Vectorworks Package Manager.
2) Select "Direct Install"> "Install a Local Package ..." from the Vectorworks Package Manager menu.
3) Select three files in the file selection dialog and click "Open".
4) "Instaling Package 1/3" is displayed in the "Install a Local Package" dialog.
5) After that, the progress bar display and the file count are not updated, and after waiting for a while, it suddenly switches to "Installation Complete". * This problem does not occur on Sierra and High Sierra.
6) Next, select and install the two files, and the "Install a Local Package" dialog will display "Instaling Package 3/3". The correct display should be 1/2. * This problem also does not occur on Sierra and High Sierra.

Also, please refer to "12479.mov".

Best regards,
Takaaki Mizuno

VB-173624

-Open the file in VW and send to Enscape
-Switch back to VW, edit the "Siding-Black" texture, and click OK
-Switch to Enscape again, then back to VW
-Edit the same texture again and click OK
-Switch back to Enscape again

This happens with both VW 2020 and VW 2021.

I'm using the latest graphics driver (27.21.14.5206) with an NVIDIA Quadpro P1000 card.

This has also been reported with Enscape's Feedback tool: https://enscape.freshdesk.com/public/tickets/f3531b52b151e04c5e52a779f0187c4e5fc9aeea0dc835fd0237f75b6764ae23 		Justin Hutchison

VB-168528

If there is a space figure, [Section Viewport] switches to the unupdated state when printed.

--------------------------
Target environment
--------------------------
Win Mac
It occurs in v2020.
The past versions are the same as well.
--------------------------
How to Reproduce
--------------------------
If there is a space figure, [Section Viewport] switches to the unupdated state when printed.

1)Create any Extrude.
2)Create any Space.
3)Create a Section Viewport.
4)Click File menu > Print
5)Check [Reset all plug-in objects that require a reset prior to printing] and print it.
6)The [Section Viewport] switches to the unupdated state when printed.

*Remarks*
-When [Reset all plug-in objects that require a reset prior to printing] is unchecked, it does not occur.
-It seems to occur every time, so I think it needs improvement.
-It does not happen with [Export Image File] and [Export PDF] with similar settings.

Please refer to "sample10631.vwx","movie10631_1.mov","10631_2.png".

Best regards,
Rie Ichimura

VB-170407

Using the Organization Dialog to Change the Active Layer While Performing a Local-Space Edit Does Not Exit the Edit Context

Using the Organization dialog to change the active layer while performing a local-space edit does +*not*+ exit the edit context. In contrast, when the Navigation palette is used to change the active layer while performing a local-space edit, the edit context is exited. Please watch the attached video for a demonstration of these behaviors.

 

I would expect the Organization dialog's behavior to be like that of the Navigation palette. 		Rick Berge
VB-167685

Saved view does not save OpenGL settings

Steps:
# Open the attached file and select saved view *0**2*
# Ensure the render  options are set to OpenGL with the following settings
** Detail: low
** Use Textures: checked
** Use Colors: checked
** Use Anti-Aliasing: checked
** Draw Edges: checked (default settings)
** Use Shadows: unchecked
# Select the saved view *0**2.1*
# Change the OpenGL settings to:
** Use Colors: unchecked
** Use Shadows: checked
# Select Saved Views and create a new saved view
# Give it a name and make sure *Save Render mode and Options* is checked
# Change back to the saved view *02*

_Notice the saved view did not bring over the settings from the saved view, despite the description and help text of the saved view render option._ 		Rick Berge
VB-175195

Class creation inconsistency

When creating a new class in the organization palette - it stops you typing at 3 characters. when creating a new class in navigation pallette it stops you typing at 63 characters. But when you edit a class in the navigation using the pencil edit it lets you carrying on typing (does not update class however). when you do the same in the organization aplatte with the pencil again it lets you type more than 63 characters but doesn't take effect.

When you edit using the edit button in the organization it doesnt let you type more than 63 characters.

So there is a lot of inconsistency.

Another worry with this is *if a user adds more characters to the beginning of the class name it takes characters off the end of the name which could cause issues further down the line
*

Video attached. 		Rick Berge
VB-174308

Viewport from prior version requires two updates before it updates properly

-Open attached test file
-Select the viewport and click the Update button in the Object Info Palette
-The viewport doesn't update properly
-Even though the, 'Update' button is black in the Object Info Palette, click the button again
-This time, the viewport will update properly
-See attached image 		Rick Berge
VB-169793

Issues with our movie rendering codec

MPEG-1 is a very old video codec and is holding back the quality of movie Vision is able to export. A very limited number of frame rates are supported, namely 24, 25, 30, 50, and 60 (24, 30, and 60 can be NTSC). It was not designed to handle high resolutions, the maximum supported is 4095x4095. The compression is poor and a very high data rate is needed to maintain decent visual quality leading to large file sizes. The maximum data rate is capped at a value that is not high enough to maintain decent visual quality for the resolutions and frame rates we support. Kevin Linzey
VB-168795

Site Model created in wrong location when 2D polys are included in Source Data from DWG

# Import Sweref991800_RH2000.dwg in an empty VW file, units: Meter, default import settings, then change Scale to 1:200
# Use Select Similar Tool, and select 82 3D Loci. (See image)
# Add the 3D Polys, to get totaly 122 obj. (See image)
# Create Site Model from Source Data. Good & correct location. (See file Correct SM Location).

Now, repeat the above steps in another file, BUT in step 3 add also the 2D Polys to get totally 134 obj. (See image). Then Create the SM. Wired & wrong location. (See file Wrong SM Location and the 2 images).
• Notice the far away distance between the 2D & 3D of same Site Model
• Notice also the wrong OpenGL, maybe related to VB-158114 		Bozhidar Stanchev
VB-175310

Viewports fail to render all layers unless changed to wireframe first then back to Custom Renderworks

Hello,
The enclosed file will open on a rendered viewport. If you change a setting in the Background Render Settings in the OIP and then re-render, you'll notice that only one layer is rendered. In order to get it to render all layers you have to set it back to wireframe then back to Custom Renderworks and it will render correctly.
This is true for sheets 13-17.


Movie enc.

Cheers,
Peter 		Justin Hutchison
VB-172252

Renderworks Camera: If GPU driver of a certain date, users get a message that "Renderworks is not a licenced product".

Hello,
I've had two users in two days both call up saying that when they used the Renderworks Camera a message comes up saying Renderworks is not a licenced product.

Each time I got them to update their GPU driver fixed it so at least they could use the camera. The bug (or is this a VE?) is the message as it would be better to have something related about the driver - if possible.

Cheers,
Peter 		Justin Hutchison
VB-169031

Vectorworks University: Spotlight Seating Section movie out of date and misleading

Hello,
Just had a user call up asking about how to create a Seating Section. They had gone to the Vectorworks University and looked at the movie where the instructions are to use the Event Design menu>Seating Section command. This command no longer exists as it is now a tool in the Event Design tool set, with lots of different options.

it must be very difficult to maintain all these movies as the software evolves but this is a fundamental part of how to use the Seating Section yet the user still couldn't understand how to create one by in the first place by watching the movie, hence this report. I had to tell him.

Thanks,
Peter 		Jeremy Powell
VB-175182

Library content symbol crashes the program

Hello,
Do a search in the Resource Manager for 'Furn Acc kitchen Frying Pot 9qt' drag or place it onto a design layer. Vectorworks will crash (spinning ball) and you'll have to force quit.

The location is:
Objects-Building Equip_Appliances>Food Service Equipment Acc>Cooking folder.

Also the other pans do not look good in a render please see screenshot. It looks like they're overflowing or something!

Cheers,
Peter 		Justin Hutchison
VB-174701

VGM: Visible referenced objects fail to print or PDF and other graphic anomalies

Hello,
In the enclosed file 'Damien Cooper - MSND LX Plan AFCT' references the file 'Damien Cooper - MSND Vector Ref'. These are v2020 files although the enclosed movie shows it in v2021 having been converted.

The sheet layer viewport has a design layer viewport that is referenced from another file. Depending on the Navigation Graphics it will or will not be seen in the sheet layer viewport.

However no matter what the settings are the referenced objects do not print or PDF even when rastorised nor even exporting to Image file does it comes through. As well the Lighting devices also show the usually not seen Renderworks lights. Movie encloded.

Peter 		Josh Loy
VB-167501

Heliodon: Solstice and Equinox presets always go to Dec 22 Solstice for multiple selected heliodons unlike the singular months above.

Hello,
In the enclosed file select 3 heliodons and change their month to any from Jan through to December in the month pull down and they will collectively change.

If you try any of the preset Solstices and Equinoxes they default to the first in the list - Dec 22. This is not what would be expected obviously.

It is a very common/universal workflow to select more than one heliodon but with different times of day and change the month for sun studies (which are very detailed and compulsory here in Australia).

I have also enclosed a movie.

Cheers,
Peter 		Justin Hutchison
VB-175078

VGM: Editing Tags very difficult as screen doesn't refresh.

Hello,
In the enclosed file there's a data tag it should open on. When editing, the screen has to be refreshed each time to see something moved. There are no selection handles on the rounded rectangles but of course if I go back onto the drawing or in another file the selection handles are there. It makes editing the Data Tags very difficult.
I have changed the Navigation Graphics but it doesn't seem to do anything. Movie enclosed (sorry about background noise).

However after I quit and relaunched it works as expected so this is really only flagging an intermittent issue.

Cheers,
Peter 		Josh Loy
VB-171463

Worksheets: All cells selected can not use formatting to get rid of the lines unless done for each individual database row at a time

Hello,
A worksheet might contain many database rows. Unfortunately if users want to lose all the lines, they are unable to even if all the cells are selected.

The workaround is to select each database row at a time and do it that way. No matter what the lines return in the formatting dialogue as grey which have to be set to 'none' again.

File and movie enclosed.

Cheers,
Peter 		Hugues Tsafak
VB-174541

Hello,
Please see the enclosed movie. You will see that when the user hovers over the basic toolset using Smart Options, the tool tips describe another tool, and in fact when he clicks the tool it is not the tool he thinks he is clicking on rather the one described in the tool tips.
We have run the Vectorworks Updater>Advanced>Repair to no avail and have also reset his user folder.
He has a good machine and up to date GPU driver. His DxDiag file is enclosed.
It usually starts after an hour when using the program so it's not an instant problem.

VB-172362

Renderworks: inconsistent results rendering viewport: often model not rendered or exported as PDF.

Hello,
The enclose file has a sheet called '01 -0001 Node Detail'. There are several viewports all showing one design layer called 'Node Design 3'.
The objects are simple extrudes and there doesn't seem anything awry with the file in terms of internal origin for example. The file started in v2018.

The problem is when exporting to PDF often but not always the model in the viewports do not esport. Only the annotations come through.

However in my testing there have been inconsistent results. Mostly the viewports look fine in Vectorworks but do not export. Yet looking at the enclosed movie you can see that one update having opened with v2021 does not draw at all and remains invisible.

Sometimes I was able to export to PDF with no problem. If I changed the settings such as from custom Renderworks settings low to FQRW then the export to PDF wouldn't render the model.

Sometimes it worked in v2021 sometimes not. The enclosed movies happen directly after a reboot of the machine. Currently in v2021 the export to PDF doesn't work for Renderworks renders. OpenGL is fine which is what we have told the user to use.

File and movies enclosed.


Justin Hutchison
VB-171831

Renderworks fails to render model in viewports

Hello,
These objects were made in an older version of Vectorworks and modified in 2020. Prior to the steps taken below I could render and export to PDF and the model would show. The customer rendered in Vectorworks sheet layers fine it was only when he viewed the PDF that he noticed the model wasn't there, only the annotations.

So using layer object import I have rebuilt the file totally in a blank 2020 file.
The problem now is that for me, only the annotations are visible once the model is rendered in any Renderworks types in the viewport!

OpenGL is fine as you can see on the duplicated viewports next to the original on the sheet layers.

VB-169091

Revit import: File size greatly increases and Revit Entities not converted when using Solid Vectorworks objects

Hello,
Enclosed is a Revit file.
When imported using Method A (screenshot of import dialogue enclosed - 3D model and meshes) the resulting Vectorworks file is 5.8MB and the objects appear to have converted although walls seem to go through the roof which is common.

When imported again in Method B (this time as Vectorworks Solid Objects and 2D and 3D views) it takes a long time to convert. When eventually it does you'll see a lot of failed Revit Entities. The file size is also 81.2MB much larger than the other method.

Screenshots, Revit file and Vectorworks imports enclosed.

VB-167499

Hidden Line Render + 2D Symbol Components + Symbol vertical cut plane options and wrong orientation.

Hello,
The enclosed file and movie will explain better but in a nutshell:

* A symbol has a 2D component for it's right and left side for sections.
* The symbol is on the page and mirrored and duplicated.
* When a section viewport is created using the default 'View as Cut when Cut in viewport' the mirrored symbol shows the 2D component as flipped (ie original orientation) when in Hidden Line (HLR).
* If the Vertical cut Plane is set to 'Uncut Below/beyond cut in viewport' the orientation is correct.

This most likely is due to something about the 2D component as that wouldn't be showing with the second option. So this is most likely nothing to do with HLR rather the 2D symbol component (which seems ok to me).

Thanks,
Peter 		Josh Loy
VB-173326

Organisation Dialogue: Scrolling class list becomes 'sticky' and difficult to navigate

Hello,

The enclosed file is a working demonstration file I am building as a Spotlight template for Australian users in v2021. Trying to sort out some classes (Cable ones) you can see in the movie that when trying to use the scroll bar in the Organisation Dialogue that it becomes very difficult to navigate the list by scrolling. 

The list isn't that long (I think about 85 classes) but it makes using the organisation dialogue very tricky. Often there are long delays of 2-3 seconds or longer and you can see even trying to close the dialogue you get a misleading impression.

This happens repeatedly even after a restart of the machine. It might work ok briefly at the start then soon after another go slows down and becomes sticky again.

 

Cheers,

Peter 		Walid Remaili
VB-174258

This file is large because a prospective client wanted to use 3D geometry as opposed to Image props for the plants. This is so he doesn't have to add them in Enscape.

However as you can see in the movie the Animation path frequently either doesn't show anything or ends up as if it is playing and the only option in the OIP is 'pause'. The only way to progress is to quit and relaunch.
Sometimes as can be seen in the movie reshaping the path will trick it into thinking it is playing and again Pause it the only option, so another relaunch.
This file also when activating the camera often, not always, the view would remain either in Top Plan or it would be blank. A select all would show the outline of the objects but they would not be visible.

VB-174059

Workspace customization by relocating palettes relocated to 2nd monitor not kept during migration

In the attached workspace folder capture from 2020, when I put it thru the migration manager in 2021, the customization of having the palettes on the second monitor is lost, they all appear on the primary monitor now.

Steps to reproduce:

1)  Clear out the 2020 and 2021 user folders.

2)  Unzip the contents of the 2020 attached zip file into the user folder.

3)  Open 2020, and see that the default workspace is designer, and the palettes(nav, OIP, snapping, etc) are on the secondary monitor.

4)  Close 2020, open 2021, and run the migration manager.

5)  Make sure the designer workspace is being used.  Note the palettes are not on the secondary monitor.

6)  Close and restart 2021.  Palettes are still not on the secondary monitor. 		Ian Lane
VB-168171

Solid Addition Dimension Error in OIP (PR 10051746)

When creating a solid addition with millimeters as units I am seeing dimension errors once the object gets bigger than 208mm in the depth and height fields of the OIP.

In the attached video and file I have a solid addition consisting of four extrudes with holes punched through them.  The dimensions in the OIP are correct until the depth reaches 208mm.  At that point the depth is 208.5... and the height is 148.2... when the correct dimensions should be 208 and 148 respectively.  If I reenter the solid and move the pieces to make the solid smaller by 1mm the dimensions again become correct in the OIP.

To further add to the strangeness, when I use the constrained dimension tool with a precision of 10 places the value shows correctly at 208mm in the OIP.

File and video are attached. 		Josh Loy
VB-168570

cilinder changes size after substraction operation (PR 10051746 )

See attache printscreen and file.

The subtraced cilinder is not same size as the shelled cilinder.
This should not be the case and the depth of the cilinder should be the same after the substraction. 		Josh Loy
VB-169433

Section viewport: Section line doesn’t delete if you delete the section viewport which is created from the annotation of the sheet layer viewport

To reproduce:

Draw a rectangle

Create a viewport on a sheet layer

Edit annotation of the viewport

Draw a section line

Click on a Create Section Viewport button

Delete the created section viewport

Note that the section line doesn’t delete

If you zoom in\out  the section line disappears 		Josh Loy
VB-175687

Solid Subtraction with round Extrusions result in inaccurate 2D line rendering

When doing solid subtractions with only straight extrusions, the 2D rendering is very much on point. But when doing solid subtractions that include at least one rounded extrusion, the resulting 2D line rendering is pretty wonky.

To reproduce (see the video and screenshots):
1) open the attached file in 25.0.5 or 26.0.2
2) select two intersecting extrusions (one of which should be rounded)
3) right-click > select "Subtract Solids..." and confirm "OK"
--> You will see, that the edges show up where they shouldn't be.

Even before the solid subtraction, the rounded extrusions already don't render the 2D edges correctly, but it's only after the solid subtraction that it becomes very obvious. 		Josh Loy
VB-175811

Point Cloud Displays Incorrectly in Static Views

bug video [^2022-06-30 15-24-33.mp4]
* open [^Point Cloud Display.vwx]
* fly around
notice everything works fine


* delete all DL except Point Cloud
* make Point Cloud layer active
notice the point cloud looks wrong when not flying

the problem is that Unified View gets stuck ON when deleting the layers.  Maybe a mismatch Save/Restore UnifiedView somewhere in the delete code. 

when unified view is off, the point cloud is drawn by Core on static frame which looks wrong.  That is fine because Unified View is not a workflow we are fixing bugs for.

 

======original description=======

Movie and test file are attached. The file contains a 3D model and a complex Point Cloud.

To reproduce:

-Go to any 3D view

Note that the Point Cloud shows correctly at this point.

-Now delete all the design layers except for the "Point Cloud" layer
-Make the "Point Cloud" layer active and zoom

Note that the Point Cloud now appears flat in static views.

The same thing happened in past versions. 		Justin Hutchison

VB-174509

STEP File Import - Differing Results and Hard to Work With

I’m starting this one as a VB since there are certain aspects I can’t confirm, but I think this may end up needing to be resubmitted as a VE.

 

Videocom has a customer that received two STEP files from a third party. The files were created in CATIA, and they were apparently generated and sent out of CATIA the same exact way. They are slightly different shapes/models though.

 

One file is providing a generic solid while the other file is providing ~6,000 NURBS surfaces once it gets into Vectorworks.

 

My understanding is that this is because the NURBS surfaces model has at least one hole/break somewhere in the geometry; however, I can’t come up with any way of confirming this in Vectorworks other than the attached error message we get when trying to ‘stitch and trim surfaces’ on all of them. I have tried the file in smaller batches with some success, but this would take hours or days to manually narrow down the individual connections.

 

Is there any way for someone to confirm this model is correct/solid in CATIA or another application so we can rule out if this is an import bug into Vectorworks?

 

(If this is Working as Designed, I will be submitting a VE for a better way for detecting holes/issues like this in Vectorworks.) 		Josh Loy

VB-174655

Speakers vanished

User submitted a 2021 file where he said his speakers have disappeared after closing and reopening Vectorworks.

The file opens to a sheet layer.  Moving to design layer AVL there are no speakers anywhere on the AVL SPEAKERS class.  

I made sure all classes and layers were visible and View class and layer options were set to show snap modify others.  I could not see speakers in any orientation of the drawing.  Both 2D and any 3D view.

I decided to try design layer import into a new file.  The speakers imported and show up on the AVL design layer in the AVL-Speakers class.

When I edit the JBL speak found in the Installed sound products folder, the 3D component shows up as an IFC entity in the OIP. 		Rick Berge
VB-173344

Story-Bound Objects Show 0" Height After Deleting/Replacing Story

Movie and test file are attached. The file contains a few objects that are bounded to the "Top of Slab" levels on 2-Story and R-Story.

To reproduce:

-In the Org dialog Stories tab, delete the R-story
-Now create a new top story that also contains a "Top of Slab" level

Note that the objects lose their heights, even though the OIP still shows their Top Bound level as valid (there's no "doesn't exist" string in the level name).

The only way I found to fix this was to change the layer of the objects, then change it back.

The same thing happened in previous versions. 		Rick Berge
VB-172932

Question:When executing the “Create Section Viewport” command menu, part of the object is not displayed.

When placed a cylindrical object on top of an object and executing the “Create Section Viewport” command menu, part of the object below is not displayed.

Is this by design?

 

◎How to Reproduce

1. Open the attached file.

2. In the attached file, an object and cylindrical object are placed on top of them.

3. When executing the “Create Section Viewport” command menu to object, part of the object below the cylindrical object is not displayed.

4. However, the object is displayed only in the “Dashed Hidden Line” of the rendering settings.

5. By setting "Hidden Object Display" in the rendering settings other than the “Dashed Hidden Line” rendering, the object below that was not displayed is displayed.

 

A&A

Hayato Wada 		Josh Loy

If you have overlapping 2D shapes with a solid fill in the 2D section part of a symbol, these objects are displayed wrong in the section viewport. VB-171187

Section Viewport: Hidden Line doesn't support color

Attached is a Test .vwx file with a few Viewports and Section Viewports and they are showing a few colored Cubes.

This Viewports and Section Viewports are rendered in OpenGL and Hidden Line.

With OpenGL we can see that color is shown in both Viewports and Section Viewports.

On the other hand, when looking at the same Viewports and Section Viewports but with Render Hidden Line Mode, it is everything black and white, no color whatsoever.

I have also noticed that with 2019, the Section Viewports of OpenGL were without color, but now with 2020 already shows color.

This leaves me the question... if the situation with Hidden Line is a limitation of Section Viewports and color is simply not supported or is this actually a Bug?

If this is WAD and a limitation, can we please switch this from VB to VE?

Thank you in advance. 		Josh Loy

VB-169596

FS: Missing Line in Section Viewport showing Hybrid Symbol Elevations

We rework most of our Symbol library and add elevations in the different detail levels.

In the attached file you can see that there is missing a line, which should be visible. Because of the conversion from 3D to 2D the line was generated as a Polyline.

If you copy the symbol to a empty file and create a elevation the line is there...

Because we rework so many (older) Symbol libraries it would be very helpful if we could rely on the elevations we generate in the library documents to review our works.

 

Please also look at: VB-170494 		Josh Loy

VB-171338

Hidden Line and Polygon Render: Windows are misplaced in Section Viewport

The attached screenshot shows an example of this problem.

When opening the attached .vwx file we can see a Section Viewport that has Windows on both sides of the building. This Windows are misplaced from the expected position, being displayed in a lower position than it should.

This happens with Background Render: Hidden Line and the Polygon variants. Does not happen with OpenGL or Renderworks.

Changing Navigation Graphics does not affect anything.

If we switch to the Design Layer and in 3D view we can see that all windows are positioned correctly as they should, including with Hidden Line. This misplacement only happens in the Section Viewport.

VB-168869

Horizontal section viewport: holes get the line attributes of the active class

With a Horizontal Section Viewport, the lines of hole(s) generated by a Subtract solid are influenced by the active class or by the default Attributes. In case the active class has been set to "Use at creation", the attributes of this class are applied, if this option is not selected the default attributes are used...

Additional remark: Horizontal section viewport has "Seperate Cross Sections" and "Use Attributes of Original Objects" selected 		Josh Loy

-Notice there is no clean cut at the bottom of walls. This could look cleaner by having a planar object at the end of the depth.  		Josh Loy

VB-172336

Wall Overall Pen Thickness Doesn't Show in Hidden Line

Movie and test file are attached. The file contains several walls that have their overall pen thickness set to 0.50.

To reproduce:

-Render in Wireframe

Note that all of the walls show the 0.50 thickness, as expected.

-Now render in Hidden Line, then do a few flyovers so the Interactive Hidden Line shows

Note that the Interactive Hidden Line also shows the 0.50 pen thickness, but the regular Hidden Line doesn't (see attached screenshots).

It looks like the only way to get the thicker lines to show is by editing the wall components and changing the pen thickness there. This can be really tedious though.

Ideally the pen thickness would remain consistent across these three render modes (Wireframe, Interactive Hidden Line, and Hidden Line).

The same thing happened in previous versions. 		Josh Loy

VB-169631

Section Viewport: Constrained Chain Mode Dimensions faulty display

The attached video shows the problem being reproduced.

1. Open the attached .vwx file
2. in the OI of the Section Viewport switch the Background Render to see how its displayed with the different possibilities

Constrained Linear Dimension:
The Dimensions drawn with Constrained Linear Mode are displayed correctly in the Section Viewport at all times.

The Dimensions drawn with Constrained Chain Mode are incorrectly displayed in the Section Viewport if one the following Background Render is active:
- Hidden Line
- Dashed Hiden Line
- All Polygon variations
Josh Loy

I'm having other problems with Section Viewports created in this way, and it might have something to do with VB-167562

VB-168392

Vertical Section: Edge Case Where Objects Behind Cut Plane Show 2D Attributes

I've attached a short movie that shows this issue

 
* open test file and update the section viewport
* Open the Advanced Section properties dialog and enter 1' in the 'Finite Depth' of the Extents Before Cut Plane 
* Click Ok and update the section viewport
* Notice one dashed line shows , and I think this line shouldn't show since the extrude is 1 ft behind the section line ( on the design layer)
* Repeat the same steps and enter 2' in the 'Finite Depth' ...etc
* Update the section . Notice the dashed lines for the smaller extrude are not visible. This sesms like the correct behavior
* If you set the finite depth >2' then the dashed lines show properly as you'd expect.  		Josh Loy

VB-168504

Horizontal Section Above-Plane Display Fails to Show Some Hidden Objects in 2020

I've attached a movie and test file that show this in VW 2019 compared to VW 2020. The file contains a few Truss objects that are placed at roughly a 10' elevation and assigned to a custom class. The file also contains a Horizontal SVP with a 4'0" cut plane elevation that's set to show the custom class in the above-plane display. There's also an Extrude placed between the cut plane and the Truss objects, making them "hidden objects".

To reproduce, open the file in VW 2019 and 2020 and update the SVP in each version.

Note that the Truss objects show in 2019 but not in 2020.

This doesn't happen with all object types, so there seems to be something about Trusses that's causing the failure.

The same thing happens going back to SP0.
Josh Loy

VB-167561

Window Tool: Preview does not rotate with plan rotation

The attached video shows the problem being reproduced.

1. Draw a simple wall, on the horizontal in 2D.

2. Rotate the plan. For example 20 degrees.

3. Select the Window Tool and activate the 2nd Method.
3.1. Draw a Window on the Wall.

The Window Preview does not rotate with the plan. In rotated plan while the Wall is shown at 20 degrees, the Window Previews remains at zero degrees. The Window Preview should also be displayed with the same rotation that the drawing has. 		Rick Berge

To reproduce:

-Try to click-select the symbol

VB-168970

FS: Wrong Wall Height in Worksheet

Attached you can find a Customers Testfile, where some Walls are - according to the worksheet "WIBU_ME-Wandliste" are only 3m high. But the Info displays the correct value of 3,05m.

I have not found a reason in the settings why this is so... 		Christopher Graye
VB-174660

Spotlight Lighting pipe objects do not accurately show their trim height

In the entertainment industry the definition of an objects trim height is the distance from the ground to the underside of the object. In Spotlight Lighting Pipe objects are not consistent with this, a lighting pipes trim height is shown from the center of the lighting pipe geometry not from the underside, meaning all pipe trim heights are incorrect Kevin Linzey
VB-170669

Seating: any action leads to warning

The attached video shows the problem being reproduced

1. Select the Seating Section.

2. Perform ANY action to it. In the video is given the example of moving the Seating Boundary

Warning appears: Boundary and(or) seating groups are not set! Go to context menu option's "Edit Boundary" and add boundary.

After this warning, is not possible to correct the situation and have the Seating Section again in the drawing. We are forced to go to File and Revert to Saved.

Example two: Right click the Seating Section and choose Edit, when leaving the same message popups. 		Kevin Linzey
VB-173951

Attribute Mapping Widget Fails to Snap to Edges of Rectangles/Rounded Rectangles

Movie and test file are attached. The file contains a few 2D shapes (Polygon, Polyline, Rectangle, Rounded Rectangle) that have a Hatch fill applied.

To reproduce, for each object:

-Activate the Attribute Mapping tool
-Drag the mapping widget and try to snap to the top/bottom edge of the object

Note that this works fine for the Polygon/Polyline but fails for the Rectangle/Rounded Rectangle.

The same thing happened in previous versions. 		Rick Berge
VB-169100

Group Highlighting Shows the Wrong Rotation Angle in VW 2020 (Best Performance)

I've attached a movie and test file that show this in VW 2019 compared to VW 2020. The file contains a Group made from several 2D objects on a 3D plane.

To reproduce, open the file in each version and select the Group in a Front view.

In VW 2019, note that the highlighting matches the rotation of the resize handles (see first attached screenshot).

In VW 2020, note that the highlighting is rotated at an odd angle (see second screenshot).

This only happens when the Group contains objects on a 3D plane. If they're on the Screen or Layer planes the highlighting shows fine.

This only happens with "Best Performance" Nav Graphics.

The same thing happens going back to 2020 SP0. This also happens in VW 2021. 		Josh Loy

User submitted a file, where he edits his Label Legend for "Standard L"

In the screen shot provided I have pointed out that the blue grip for Gobo is not in the same location when editing the Label Legend.  When the user moves the word Gobo out of the way in the manager, the distance on the instrument increases. 		Kevin Linzey

VB-168948

This file shows the different reactions the overrides have on different attributes.

It would be fab to be able to know what will work on and what will not - at the moment it is a bit of a hit or miss situation.

In some situations, the settings from the original attributes (e.g. enlarged size or rotation) seem to bleed through to the override, and sometimes it doesn't.

VB-168254

WinDoor Objects Shift to Internal Origin in 3D Views : JBC

In any 3D view, changing wall height or doing an action that does not result in a reset of the WinDoor object, causes it to shift to the internal origin. In a Top/Plan view, the issue does not occur. 

Attached to this report is a video demonstrating how to reproduce, a simple Vectorworks 2020 file that was used in the video, and the WinDoor PIO. Note that the issue does not occur if the WinDoor PIO is *not* installed.

Obviously this is a fairly critical issue for our users, who are suddenly finding their models have some or all doors and windows at the internal origin.

Thanks. 		Christopher Graye

VB-168650

Top/Plan Window Display Issues with Curved Walls when window intersects two walls

In the attached document and screenshot, a circle can be see around a Window and Round Wall when we insert a window into a round wall that intersects with another straight wall.

Users seem to expect that when placing a window in such an arrangement, the window wouldn't be able to go past the curved wall.

It's possible to get the window to the corner by snapping and zooming well enough, but it's easy to make the attached behavior occur.

This seems to happen for default windows in the Vectorworks Library, as well as any custom made window symbols.

VB-175337

Wall Join Disaster

VB-169541

Wall Inserts are Handled Inconsistently by Mirror, Rotate, and Move by Points Tools

The handling of Wall Inserts is inconsistent across the Mirror, Rotate, and Move by Points tools.
* When Wall Inserts in at least two different walls (i.e., Walls, Round Walls, or a combination of the two) are selected, the results from using the Mirror, Rotate, and Move by Points tools is not consistent.
** Mirror Tool - Standard Mode: The containing walls of the selected Wall Inserts and all of those walls' inserts, whether selected or not, are moved to the mirrored position.
** Mirror Tool - Duplicate Mode: Duplicates of the selected Wall Inserts are created in the mirrored position.
** Rotate Tool - Standard Mode: The containing walls of the selected Wall Inserts and all of those walls' inserts, whether selected or not, are moved to the rotated position.
** Rotate Tool - Duplicate Mode: Duplicates of the selected Wall Inserts are created in the rotated position.
** Move by Points Tool:
*** Object Retention Mode - On: All duplicates created will only be of the selected Wall Inserts.
*** Object Retention Mode - Off: The first duplicates created will be the containing walls of the selected Wall Inserts and all of those walls' inserts, whether selected or not. All subsequent duplicates created will only be of the selected Wall Inserts.

 

The live previews of the Mirror and Rotate tools are also not consistent for Wall Inserts.
* The live previews of Wall Inserts differ when using the Mirror tool depending on whether the current projection is 2D Plan or not. When the current projection is 2D Plan, the live previews display correctly except when Wall Inserts in multiple walls (i.e., Walls, Round Walls, or a combination of the two) are selected and the Standard mode of the Mirror tool is used (see following sub bullet point). Please see the following major bullet point for how the live previews of Wall Inserts are displayed incorrectly when the current projection is not 2D Plan and the Mirror tool is used.

** When the current projection is 2D Plan, Wall Inserts in multiple walls (i.e., Walls, Round Walls, or a combination of the two) are selected, and the Standard mode of the Mirror tool is used: the live preview only shows the Wall Inserts, but the actual functionality is the containing walls of the selected Wall Inserts and all of those walls' inserts, whether selected or not, will also be moved to the mirrored position.
* When the current projection is not 2D Plan, the live previews of the Mirror and Rotate tools are different depending on whether the selected Wall Insert(s) are in a Wall or Round Wall. This appears to be because of the differences between the Drw3DWallNode and Drw3DRoundWallNode functions in Drw.cpp. In particular, the "dc.fpRedrawContext->IsInDrawingMode(eSelectionIndication)" checks that are only in Drw3DWallNode are likely contributing to some of the differences in behavior since the code for the 3D live previews of the Mirror tool and Rotate tool both include "gDC.fpRedrawContext->SetDrawingMode( eSelectionIndication, true);".
** The live previews for Wall Inserts in a Wall are:
*** non-existent when only Wall Inserts are selected and the Mirror tool's Duplicate mode or the Rotate tool's Duplicate mode is used.
*** visible gaps in the containing Wall when only Wall Inserts are selected and the Mirror tool's Standard mode or the Rotate tool's Standard mode is used. Note: In this case, the containing Wall and all its inserts are displayed in the live preview and all of the inserts are shown as visible gaps.
*** visible gaps in the containing Wall when only containing Walls are selected and the Mirror tool or Rotate tool is used.
** When the Mirror tool and the Rotate tool are used: The live previews for Wall Inserts in a Round Wall are always present and include all of the Wall Insert details. However, the containing Round Walls and all of their Wall Inserts, whether selected or not, also are displayed regardless of whether only Wall Inserts or only their containing Round Walls are selected.

 

Please see the attached video for examples of the inconsistencies described above. To reproduce these inconsistencies, please use the attached 'Wall Inserts.vwx' file. 		Christopher Graye

VB-173058

File conversion: walls height arent the same as OI height

The attached video demonstrates the bug.

The attached .vwx file is a conversion from a previous VW version. When we drag the file to a txt editor, we can see that the original is from 20.0.1 converted to 25.0.2

1. Open the attached .vwx file with 25.0.4

2. Go to the Layer 1 - O (like its shown in the video)

3. Select a wall and see that in the OI Height is 2,8200m which is the wished height but not the height displayed in the 3D object (by measuring the wall we can see that).

4. cmd+x the selected wall and paste back in place. Now the wall is displayed with the correct height. This situation happens to every wall in this Layer. 		Christopher Graye

VB-169194

Unexpected holes in walls

This is a strange problem that I've never seen happen before and it _seems_ to be somehow linked to the Custom Cabinet object.  This problem seems to happen to users that use the Custom Cabinet object often and the size of the holes seem to relate to one of the object's size (or its tool default size).

Open the attached VWX file and notice to two odd holes in the walls (highlighted in red).  The size of the holes are precisely 1'-4" wide by 8'-0" tall.  There is a red symbol named "Chapuis Kitchen Cab 1" that contains a Custom Cabinet of the exact same dimensions.  The document default for the Custom Cabinet tool is also set to the same dimensions.

There is another user also reporting these issues and said the size of his holes are 2'-0" x 5'-11".  This is the same size as the Custom Cabinet application default.

Users have reported this happening in both Vectorworks 2019 and 2020

 

I currently cannot reproduce the problem but I'm hoping this might provide enough information to determine a possible cause.

Related forum thread: [https://forum.vectorworks.net/index.php?/topic/69602-unwanted-holes-in-walls/]

  		Christopher Graye
VB-169096

Slab Preferences, Advanced... button needs new title

*{color:#FF0000}Path:{color}* in Vectorworks (Architect mode or similar), enable *Building Shell*, draw a rectangle or similar geometry, and pick the *Slab* tool.

In *Slab Preferences*, select the *Insertion Options* tab. In the *Energos* panel, select the *Advanced...* button. The *Advanced Settings* dialog box opens.

The names for the button and the dialog box it opens are inconsistent, especially for localization purposes. It is recommended that both items be named *Advanced settings*.

See screenshots for more details.

 

Additional references: GHST-709 		Christopher Graye

VB-168932

FS: Wall in drawing corrupt after entering "Fire Rating" value in Wall Style

Attached you can find a Testfile, where on wall extends to the VW origin, after entering a "Fire Rating" value in Wall Style...

VB-173736

round walls refuse to obey Fit Walls to Objects command when object is sloped

Draw an object with a slope. Place it at a height above ground plane.
Beneath the object draw a round wall. Make sure it has a substantial sweep, such as 200 degrees.
Select the wall and apply the Fit Walls to Objects command to the top of the wall.
Note that the round wall may alter its height, but not in conformance with the object to be fitted. In many cases the wall will either partially or entirely protrude above the object, especially if the object is sloped.

Note also that the propensity of the wall to fit to a sloped object seems to depend, in part, on the combination of radius and sweep. In certain cases, reducing the sweep will eventually lead to the wall fitting to the object.

This problem doesn't seem to exist with non-sloped objects (i.e. perfectly horizontal). But even a slight slope (i.e. 1 degree) is enough to trigger this problem, in this case with multiple little protrusions at the top.

Attached is a file containing multiple round walls with different sweeps and radii, demonstrating the problem. 		Christopher Graye
VB-169480

Half break incomplete on Round Walls

Half Break insertion is not complete on Round Walls: a boundary pen at insertion is showing, whereby it shouldn't. Christopher Graye

Wall: wall caps

The schematic representation of the wall caps is not correct, if two walls of different widths are connected. The caps in the test file uses the line attributes of the components but the wall cap be the connecting uses the line attributes from the wall. The Problem is that the connection cap is using the wall attributes and not attributes from the components. When I use different thick lines or different colors it isn't practically to handle.

I attach my test file.

Thank you for testing.

best regards, Denis 		Christopher Graye
