VB-173634

The settings of the Double Line Tool are not carried over to the new file. Only "Overall Thickness" succeeds normally.

--------------------------
Target environment
--------------------------
Mac/Win
v2020(Same as previous versions)
--------------------------
About Problem
--------------------------
The settings of the Double Line Tool are not carried over to the new file. Only "Overall Thickness" succeeds normally.

※The settings of other tools(ex.Line Tool) are inherited normally, so all settings should be inherited by the Double Line Tooll as well.

When I open a new file, the "Overall Thickness" of "Double Line Components" and the "Thickness" of "Double Line Components Settings" are different. (Opening the dialog again improved the difference in "Thickness".)

Steps:
1. After setting Double Line Tool tool with A file, open B file

2. Thickness values of "Double Line Components" and "Double Line Components Settings" of Double Line Tool are different.

It does not reflect the color. It is black.
(It might be fixed after a while, but it will be black when zooming in/out ; Please refer to movie12322_zoominout.mov)

3. Open the dialog again and the Thickness will match.

4, but the Line color and Thickness are still different.

5, I thought it would have returned when I made a new component,

6. When I open another new file, the color returns to black.

 

Please refer to "movie12322.mov","movie12322_after.mov","movie12322_after2.mov".

*Remarks*
*The saved file has been repaired normally, or it remains black.
The movement is unstable.

Best regards,
Rie Ichimura
A&A 		Christopher Graye

VB-167564

FS: Wrong Area Calculation in Worksheets with Functions WALLAREA_NET and COMPONENTAREA(x)

Plaese look at the testfile.

There you can find:

-1x Wall 10m long and 3m high = Area 30qm (square meter)

-1x Window CW width 3m, height 1m = Area 3qm

If you want to make a quantity takeoff of walls you are interested in the net areas.

In our example the expected net area value of the wall is 27,00qm

 

But depending on the Worksheet function the values differ from 27,00qm

-> You can see these values in the Worksheet of the attached testfile. The text of the wrong values is in red.

  		Christopher Graye

VB-175364

Not possible to extend a existing railing

Hi Vectorworks
There is no possibility to extend a railing in the existing angle. The Key "Shift" or "T" are not supported by the railing tool in combination with the reshape tool which is basically used to move the modification points.

VB-172801

Classing of column tool is incorrect

This is a problem from past versions, but now with Materials, this problem has become much more noticeable. The classing for the column is inconsistent with other plug-in objects and especially with the Wall. The component classes should be in charge of the 2D appearance of the components, and the object (container) class should control the exterior line weight in the way that the wall does. Right now the "shaft" class does this, but only if there is an architectural component. This class is described as a "finish" class, so I would assume that it would only be for textures, like the classes of the Door and Window tool. Now with Materials, this class should be grayed out if Materials are selected. (Note, I think the component finishes classes have always functioned incorrectly.)

 

I have attached a file with the column in its current state and how they should look based on the given settings. These changes are important to draw columns in the same manner that we draw Walls, with a thick lineweight outlining the whole object and thinner lines to delineate components. For those who draw the structural component with a thicker line weight, I believe this fix will also work for them. 		Christopher Graye

Notice that the highlight incorrectly remains. The highlight won't refresh correctly after zooming in/out. Deselecting the Symbol fixes the problem.

Please watch the attached movie. 		Christopher Graye

Now click on Pilaster tool. When properties dialog opens you will see Get Finishes/Classes option

VB-175936

Marionette; Planar Boolean node still broken

I am not sure if I have filed bugs on this node before, but even if I have, I think another one needs to be filed, because this node hasn't worked properly for quite a while. The Planar Boolean node was redesigned a few years ago to cross reference inputs so when new geometry is created by a boolean, that new geometry can be applied to the remaining list of objects. It doesn't appear to work. In this file, the goal is to find the intersection between circles and a poly. It only seems to act on the first and last circle in the list.

I find I get asked for this functionality a lot, not only in simple geometry creation, but also in graphic calculation. 		Vladislav Stanev
VB-170380

ALA: Marionette Content Bug

Whether I get Nodes from the Marionette Library using the Resource Manager or the Marionette Tool shouldn’t make a difference. For some reason it does. Some (not all) Nodes taken from the Resource Manager have either the wrong or no class at all. (see video)

Steps to reproduce:
1. Open new file
2. activate Marionette Tool
3. insert Nodes from „BIM/Walls“
4. open the Resource Manager and navigate to Vectorworks Libraries > Defaults > Marionette > Marionette Default Library.vwx > BIM > Walls
5. insert Nodes
6. see the difference in class and look

Bug found in:
2018 SP6 (467741)
2019 SP6 (522773)
2020 SP3.1 (537701) and SP4b (545234)

--------------------------

--------------------------

--------------------------
How to Reproduce
--------------------------

1) Create Worksheet.

3) When Worksheet is rotated, some borders are not displayed. The frame line at the corner of Worksheet is hidden.

*Remarks*
Same as v2019.
A line is displayed when Zooming In and Out.
It is not displayed even if the Worksheet Border is set.
It is not displayed even if Changing the on / off status of the Unified View.
It is not displayed even if Changing the Navigation Graphics.

On Win, if the Line Thickness is set to 0.13 or more, all corner lines will be displayed.
On Mac, if the Line Thickness is set to 0.35 or more, all corner lines will be displayed.

Lines are displayed correctly in Printing.
Lines are not displayed correctly in Exporting PDF / Image Files.

VB-172014

Editing cells and accessories for Lighting Devices needs to highlight the selected component

Choosing a cell or accessory via the pull-down menu in Object Info currently provides no visual feedback as to which element is being edited. This is particularly difficult for multi-circuits, where we really have no idea how #1, #2, #3, etc. relate to the physical cells. We usually want some control over channel (and subsequently purpose and color) of the the order of cells from SL to SR. Kevin Linzey
VB-169233

Unwanted Red Symbol Geometry

In the attached file are 2 Red Symbols, "pBMFL WashBeam-Flr" and "pMAC Encore Perf CLD-Flr."  Both have an intended preset rotation of Y=180° (VW changed that to 0° and changed X and Z to 180°).  In the Symbol Editing environment and in the Resource Manager thumbnails, unwanted geometry shows up.  When in the Symbol Editing environment this geometry cannot be selected.  This geometry does not show up in placed instances of these Symbols. Kevin Linzey
VB-169231

Lighting Device Rotation Issues

2 issues with rotating Lighting Devices:

1)  Assuming X and Z start at 0, when entering Y rotation of 180°, both X and Z change to 180° and Y changes to 0.  Values should remain as-entered.

2)  Assuming X and Z start at 0, when a Y rotation of 180° is entered, the 2D portion of the Lighting Device rotates 180°.  It should not rotate. 		Kevin Linzey
VB-168209

2D & 3D geometry of Lighting Devices don't align when rotated from under-hungto floor mounted

2D & 3D geometry of Lighting Devices don't align when rotated from under-hung to floor mounted.

Open the sample file and note the direction of the front of the fixture and the location of the red box in 2D Plan View.

Switch to 3D Top view and note that the location of the red box changes and the fixture points the other direction.

The user can compensate by manually by using the Custom Pan Rotation but they should not have to do this for standard rotations.

https://forum.vectorworks.net/index.php?/topic/68952-new-fixture-rotation-system-is-incorrect-in-2020-2d-vs-3d/ 		Kevin Linzey
VB-173154

Meshes Hard to Select in OpenGL (Occluded Selection Not Working)

bug video [^trivial.mp4]
* open [^trivial.vwx]
* try to drag the mesh
Notice that selecting/dragging a mesh fails sometimes.

 

===== ORIGINAL BUG =================

When working on a 3D model in OpenGL, quite frequently meshes are much harder to select than they should be. They're only selectable by very specific points, and clicking elsewhere on the mesh will see "through" the mesh and select the object behind it. I encounter this constantly when modeling, and today decided to screen record a couple examples in a current file, attached. (I also see students get frustrated with this frequently).

OpenGL selection should always see the solid faces of objects for selection purposes (assuming "Use Occluded Selection and Snapping" is on in VW Prefs).

Ironically, if I turn off "Use Occluded Selection and Snapping," then selection seems to work slightly better, even though that's the opposite of that checkbox's intended function.

This all needs to be made super reliable, otherwise it makes the software feel buggy and frustrating. 		Josh Loy
VB-173259

AlertInformWithHyperlink does not save CheckBox State

When selecting don't show again, teh dialog does not respect the option.
The setting is not stored:

gSDK->AlertInformWithHyperlink(
"AlertInformWithHyperlink",
"Test",
"Test",
"Test",
"Test",
false,
"ABC",
"DEF");


bool useSameCatAsLink = false;

// WHen uusing same cat with AlertInform, AlertInformWithHyperlink will not appear again!
if (useSameCatAsLink)
{
gSDK->AlertInform("AlertInform", "Test", false, "ABC", "DEF" );
}
else
{
gSDK->AlertInform("AlertInform", "Test", false, "XXX", "YYY" );
}

Ian Lane
VB-172997

This is kind of a hard coded menu.  We should gather all the quick pref item strings, sort them, and then add them to the menu.

VB-172417

New Tab Style for the Search Filter of T02096 Quick Search

A new tab style has been introduced in VW2021 after the Quick Search is implemented. The new tab style would be a great fit for the Search Filter. We should implement the new tab style for the Search Filter in future release. Refer to attached image. Ian Lane
VB-171063

Navigation palette tabs very difficult to read

While I understand the desire to make palettes consistent with the use of tabs, in the case of the Navigation palette, the tab selections at the top have become dramatically more difficult to read, compared to the previous version.

In the previous version, the icons were shown against a light background. This made the icons fairly legible, in spite of their tiny size.

In the new version, only the selected tab is shown against a light background. The rest are shown against a dark background. This makes the icon details extremely challenging to discern, especially on a high-resolution monitor–not only because the images are very small, but also because the content of those icons is of a similar tone to the background.

The UI revision in this case has mde the Navigation palette significantly harder and more effortful to use.
Ian Lane
VB-173606

Polyline Lineart doesn't follow line curve

The attached video is showing the imperfection being pointed out.

In the attached .vwx file there is a Polyline with a Lineart. We have clients complaning about the fact that the Lineart doesn't follow the polyline in the curve when Best Performance is active, showing an inaccurate curving that doesn't represent what is supposed to be.

Is it possible to improve this situation in a way that the Lineart follows the curve given by the Polyline? Thank you in advance.

For now the Clients are being advised to use Good Performance and Compatibility to workaround this problem. 		Ian Lane
VB-175442

Resource Manager - 'Name' column should not collapse.

In the Resource Manager the 'Name' column collapse after you right click on a symbol and chose either the "Edit 2D Component" or "Edit 3D Component". Once you are in the symbol edit mode and than click to exit symbol mode. The RM will collapse the 'Name' column and you can not see the thumbnail or name of the symbol. This should not happen. Please see the video attached, Ian Lane

VB-173775

UI: Palette disappearing when dragging palette from 4K to 2K display (Windows only)

This is to add more data to the already reported case here: VB-165944

In this case the user has two setups: one with a MacBook Pro and one with a Windows Desktop.

The issue (see video) is not reproducible with the MacBook setup.

Here are the specs of the Windows setup:
* Windows 10 Pro
* NVIDIA Quadro K4000 (3*DP, 1*DVI)
* (1) EIZO FlexScan EV2785 (4K)
connected via HDMI cable with an adapter to display port
* (2) LG 27MP67VQ-P (1080p)
connected via DVI cable and connectors

The Vectorworks application window is on the 4K display. When you drag a palette from there to the 2K display, the palette is not visible. If you drag the palette to the 2K display, but don't release the mouse button and drag it back to the 4K display, the palette is visible again, but has a huge offset to the mouse cursor.

The only solution to get the palette back, is to disconnect the 2K display and disable/reenable the palette.

I believe we will likely see an increase in cases like these. 		Ian Lane
VB-172058

Unable to import PDF files.

Unable to import PDF files.

This problem has reported from our Tech Support.
It seems 15 users complained the same problem.
They said, unable to import any PDF files.
When you attempt to import a PDF file, a message that says“Unable to import some or all of the document’s pages”shows.
But, we couldn't reproduce.

Some users have common environments, like below.

--------------------------
-PC Manufacturers: Microsoft or Fujitsu
-Applications: iTunes, Google Chrome and ESET
-Operating System Version: 1909
-Operating System build: 18363.900
--------------------------

Tech Support asked them to re-install VW, re-install the Operating System and stop ESET, but it wasn't fixed.
Also, Tech Support asked them to export and import PDF on a new document, but the problem reproduced.

Please let us know if you have any information about this problem.

Best regards,
Hitoshi Takeuchi

VB-170177

VB-173674

IShapePaneWidgetAccess::SetSliderAngle() does not set slider when the value is set via code

The code below is an example. SetSliderNumber() works as expected. SetSliderAngle() will position the slider correctly if the user enters a value directly in the associated edit box. However, if the value is calculated, transferring to the view will update the edit box and not the slider.

 
{code:cpp}
void SyncSliderValue(SShapePaneWidgetTransferValue& data, MCObjectHandle &inHObject, const TXString &paramName, const Sint32 &minVal, const Sint32 &maxVal, const Sint32 &tickFreqVal, const bool &applyToAll, const bool &isAngle )
{
data.fWidgetAccess->SetBoundsAndTickFrequency(data.fViewWidget, minVal, maxVal, tickFreqVal);
data.fWidgetAccess->EnableAutoLink(data.fViewWidget, true);
CGenericParamProvider obj(inHObject);
if ( data.fTransferToView )
{
double val = obj.GetParamReal(paramName);
if ( DoublesAreNearlyEqual(val, 0))
val = 0;
if (isAngle)
data.fWidgetAccess->SetSliderAngle(data.fViewWidget, val);
else
data.fWidgetAccess->SetSliderNumber(data.fViewWidget, val);
}
else
{
double val = data.fWidgetAccess->GetNumber(data.fViewWidget);
if ( applyToAll ) {
gSDK->ForEachObjectN(allSelectedAndEditable, [paramName, val](MCObjectHandle h){
CGenericParamProvider(h).SetParamReal(paramName, val);
});
}
else {
obj.SetParamReal(paramName, val);
}
}

}
{code} 		Ian Lane
VB-174342

ODM (Smart Options Display) Preferences Issues

In Vectorscript GetPrefInt(6906) is supposed to return information about "Section ODM Parameters"

The actual returned value changes every time the script is run.

Also, it makes no sense how an integer would return information about the content of four quadrants of the ODM/SOD.
# The documentation in the Vectroscript Appendix is not sufficient for how this is supposed to function.
# Since the value changes every time the script is run I believe there is a bug. 		Ian Lane

VB-170601

Disabled mode bar items are not consistent

Steps:
# Open Vectorworks and select the Move by Point Tool found in the Basic Tool Palette
# In the mode bar, select the first mode
# Select the text field for the number of copies

_Notice that this mode does not accept input, but it also has no visible feedback to illustrate that it's disabled leaving the user to guess_ 		Ian Lane
VB-175562

Smart Options Display- Pulldown mismatch (Windows only)

In the Smart Options Display when we have a pulldown from a tool mode bar, if there are separators in the pulldown there is an offset between the actual selection and the one shown in the SOD.

For example in ConnectCAD Socket tool, there is a Signal pulldown that has separators in it. If you select a signal after the first separator, in the SOD- tool modes you’ll see that the selection there is one under the correct one. If you select a signal that has more separators before it in the pulldown you will see that the offset between the shown and correct signal in SOD grows. 		Ian Lane
VB-173717

GetLBEventInfo used to return on both mac and win the last event, row and col for a chosen List Browser. (screenshot 1)

Now on Win GetLBEventInfo returns the last info ONLY if the List Browser is in focus. Otherwise it returns everywhere -1. (screenshot 2)

This impaires the usage of buttons for retriving list browser infos.

Regression.

VB-168705

Resource manager lost when running dual monitors at different scaling

I've been seeing this lately, and I think it has only recently popped up in 2020 SP3.  Sometimes when I launch Vectorworks, the resource manager will popup on a different monitor than Vectorworks is on.  I will move the mouse over it in an attempt to use it, or drag it over to where Vectorworks is, and the collapsed palette just disappears.  Unchecking and rechecking it in the windows->palettes does nothing.  Neither does cntrl-R.  Restarting Vectorworks does not bring it back.  The only way I know of to be able to use the resource manager again is to delete my user folder and restart Vectorworks. VB-169569

List Browser does not return the correct EListBrowserEventType, if a click is close to the adjacent column

GetListBrowserEvent is returning the value for the adjacent column if the click is too close to it.

Steps to recreate the bug:

1) Open a new file

2) Drag the .ifc file to Vectorworks, in order to import the IFC file

3) Waith for the Select IFC Stories and Elements dialog to pop up

4) Press the Elements radio button

5) Hover over a row in the Name column, but close to the adjacent column (image attached)

6) Click on the row

7) The Row turns white.

 

Now what happens is the event that the dialog receives is _kListBrowserEventType_DataChangeClick_, instead of _kListBrowserEventType_SelectionChangeClick_. So the dialog marks the row in white as it thinks the tick column is pressed.

 

There is also something strange that happens. When I try to debug the GetListBrowserEvent function, it returns the correct value. But if I don't, it doesn't. This is really something that makes zero sense to me. I have attached a screenshot of two Breakpoints in the class that handles clicking on this List Browser. Depending on which one is Enabled the result for the EListBrowserEventType seems to be different. I want to reiterate this makes zero sense to me, but it is happening. 		Ian Lane

VB-170209

VB-172446

Project Sharing - Changes Fail to Get Committed for Symbols on Non-Existent Story Levels

Movie and test file are attached. The file contains a 2D/3D Symbol (named "Appliance Range Hood 06") whose Z Ref is currently set to a non-existent Story Level.

To reproduce:

-Manually move the symbol to the correct elevation
-Save and Commit
-Now close the WF and reopen the PF

Note that the symbol has reverted to its original elevation.

If the symbol's Z Ref is changed to "Layer Elevation" the problem won't occur.

In regular VWX files, if you move the symbol then save/close/reopen, it'll remain at the correct elevation. So even though this is a sort of a user error it still seems like the change should get committed.

The same thing happens in previous versions. 		Hugues Tsafak

VB-170677

Renderworks render is not included in PDF export

One of clients has an issue with rendering in Renderworks. When they export isometric viewports to PDF, the renderworks rendering is not exported.

To reproduce the problem completely, you need to update all the viewports you wish to export after opening the file.

Maybe also useful to know: When you put the navigation mode to "good performance and compatibility and you update the viewport again, you have the same problem as in the PDF export: the Renderworks rendering is not visible.

Even more worrying is the following: when any of the objects (even newly created ones) are copied to a new empty document, the new document is infected with the same issue. So importing the design layer to in a new document doesn't help.

I added two files: a slim one (slim.vwx), where I kept just one element in one design layer and one viewport on one sheet layer. The other document (full.vwx) is the client's original document. I tested the viewports from the first page of the active sheet layer.

 

To reproduce:
# Open one of the added documents
2. update all viewports on the active sheet layer
3. execute a PDF export

You'll see that the renderworks renders are not included in the exported PDF

----
Tech support answer:

I apologize, I see the issue now. I exported this back to 2019 to see if it works there and it does. I would recommend trying that out on your end and sending it as a bug.

Regards,

Rob Nykolaishen 		Justin Hutchison

for (size_t faceIndex : faceIndices)

//VectorWorks::TVWArray_SizeT vertexIndices;

VB-174838

Custom Leaf Glazing Blue instead of Clear when rendering

HI Guys, 

We have had a couple of users emailing in with the same issue, we can also replicate this in-house. The custom leaf symbols seem to be taking the texture from the attributes and not from a texture of class.

I have attached one of the user's test files and a recording I have sent the user on how to fix the custom leaf by assigning a class through the 3D component of the custom leaf and making sure the attributes are set to class style. 

This wasn't the case within Vectorworks 2019 but happens with custom leaf within 2020 and also 2021.

Email from user: 

_I have a problem with door glazing appearing as opaque blue instead of clear glass since moving to v2020_

_Any custom door set has this - as well as previous doors from legacy versions - which appear with clear glass in 2019 - change to opaque blue when opening in v2020._

_Test file and screengrabs attached showing that the glazing is set to Glass-Clear and that the texture is set to Glass Clear RT - all defaults anyway._

_It only happens on Custom door leafs - but if I open the Custom Leaves.vwx file from Libraries/Defaults they appear with correctly clear glass._

 

Please let me know if you need any further information. 

Best Wishes 

Helen

VB-171403

Point Cloud Point Isolation with Clip Cube will isolate hidden points

When isolating points in a Clip Cube, we're unable to apply changes to just the items visible in the file.

I've included screenshots going over this process, as well as a Vectorworks document with this present.

The App Help page states that "Points isolation operations do not work on any points located outside an active clip cube", but what is isolated will apply to whatever is being hidden by the Clip Cube as well. Both the user and I were under the impression that the contents hidden with the Clip Cube wouldn't be cut out when Isolating Points.

This was submitted by our user Nick Solyom here: https://jira.vectorworks.net/browse/VSS-107029

Please let me know if there's anything I can do to be of further assistance, and have an awesome day! :) 		Justin Hutchison

VB-176005

Navigation Graphics of Best Performance: Grossly Distorted Polygon

VB-174680

SBE: Vectorworks uses wrong rendering texture for subobjects of PIOs

- Open attached testfile "no_material_railing-fence-texture-none-sb-2c.vwx"
- Watch attached movie "ungroup_top_rail_changes_texture.mov"

Note that the top rail is rendered in green (texture "Covergreen Vinca minor RT").
This is wrong. The top rail has no texture assigned to it (you may check via DebugWindow or other debugging tools). It should simply display its solid fill.

It seems that Vectorworks uses "Covergreen Vinca minor RT" because it is the class texture of the PIO container's class "Handrail-Steel".

But the top rail is not set to "Texture by class". It is not even in the same class as the PIO container. It has a building material assigned to it (Wood Walnut MT), but no texture.

So obviously it should never be rendered using "Covergreen Vinca minor RT".

Even weirder: if I ungroup the PIO, the green rendering disappears and the correct (solid) fill appears.


So it looks as if the rendering algorithm overrides the texture ("None") that was actually set to the top rail by the class texture of the PIO's container class. This is wrong, the value ("None") set by the PIO must not be overridden.

This is NOT a bug of the railing/fence PIO so please assign it to the engineer in charge of rendering.

PS Before analyzing, don't do anything that might trigger a regeneration of the railing/fence PIO. 		Justin Hutchison
VB-174416

malloc crash in TCamera::operator=

analytics.  3-4 slightly different stacks

[https://analytics.vectorworks.net/crashes?crashId=6267543]

[https://analytics.vectorworks.net/crashes?crashId=6256227]

 

  		Justin Hutchison

VB-169644

More efficiency in background rendering

Using test file in https://jira.vectorworks.net/browse/VB-169642
There is an efficiency that seems like we should be able to make.

VGMPolymeshAccumulator::AddVGMVertexData uses map and the memory allocation shows up significantly in OpenGL background work.
This duplicate vertex check? I would think a loop over existing vertex data would be much faster than a map.

VB-172464

Site Model Surface Highlighting Fails, Makes it Difficult to Add Enscape Assets

The attached movie and test file show this in VW 2018 compared to VW 2019, since the problem appeared between the two. The file contains a Site Model with several modifiers.

To reproduce:

-Open the file in each version
-Activate any tool that supports Automatic plane highlighting
-Place the cursor over the top of the Site Model

In VW 2018, note that the surface of the Site Model gets highlighted as expected.

In VW 2019, note that the bottom face of the Site Model gets highlighted instead.

The same thing happens in VW 2020 and 2021.

In 2020 SP4 we added support for the Enscape Asset Library, where Enscape objects are placed inside VW. The basic workflow for adding Enscape vegetation involves snapping to the surface of the Site Model in 3D views, so this bug disrupts that workflow. 		Justin Hutchison

VB-173878

Opening one file in VW 2021 is so slow as to be unusable

The attached VW 2021 file takes about 3 minutes to open and draw something on the screen, but remains unusable for up to 10 minutes while waiting for spinning beach ball to vanish.

I originally started work in VW 2019, and experienced slow file performance. I then exported the file back to earlier versions of VW and noticed much quicker program response. I also opened the file in VW 2020 and VW 2021 where performance got worse.

In VW 2020, the progress display vanishes in ~5 seconds, but screen redraw continues until 4:22 after clicking OPEN. File is editable, but very slow on redraw. Each full screen redraw takes another 4 minutes.

In VW 2021, the progress display vanishes in ~4 seconds, but the VW window does not completely refresh and pauses until for about 2:45 sec to 3:45 sec (measured on several attempts.) The items in the window are not completely drawn and continue to fill in slowly, while the computer fan becomes audible and accelerates. In the next minute or so, the entire computer becomes sluggish and the fan contintues to race. It took me nearly a minute to invoke the "Force Quit Application" window to open and to click on the VW 2021 app, then click the two OK buttons to kill it. After the VW 2021 app was killed, I took a screenshot of the CPU useage in Activity Monitor. All 4 cores (8 threads) were very red. Once while waiting for VW 2021 to open the file, I took a screen shot of Activity Monitor showing 390% CPU Usage. Images attached.

 

I am attaching the VW 2021 file and exports in VW 2020, 2018, 2016, and 2014 formats that I used to test VW opening times in older versions. File opening times are shown below.


Opening the file in the following versions resulted it these times:
VW 2014 - 8s
VW 2015 - 7s
VW 2016 - 11s
VW 2017 - 5s
VW 2018 - 2m 38s
VW 2019 - 3m 15s
VW 2021 - 2m 45s, redraw is not finished and computer fan becomes audible. File is not editable at this time, only partly visible.

 

On one test run where I waited for VW 2021 respond after opening, the beachball spun for over 10 minutes. Closing the file then took more than 4 minutes and I killed the program. Fan was at full blast.

On another run, I received an Alert that showed VW2021 paused, due to no more application memory. Image attached. 

 

I am also including one crash log when I terminated VW 2021 with  the fan running full out.

 

Computer MacMini i7 (late 2012), 16 GB RAM, Intel HD Graphics 4000 1536 MB, Mac OS 10.12.6 		Justin Hutchison
VB-167551

3D Focusing of RW Cameras Fails in SP3

I've attached a movie and test file that show this in 2020 SP2 compared to SP3. The file contains an RW Camera and an Extrude.

To reproduce:

-Open the file in SP2
-In any 3D view, drag the Camera's middle blue handle and snap to any point on the Extrude

Note that the Camera gets focused correctly.

-Now open the file in SP3 and try the same thing

Note that now the Camera gets focused on some random area.

It looks like this regression was caused by the 519255 change, which fixed VB-164699 and VB-165934. 		Justin Hutchison
VB-169745

Custom fonts show pixelated in PDF export

A client has downloaded and installed several fonts on her computer to use in VW. The fonts look fine on the sheet layers, but when exported to PDF they are shown pixelated. Big or small font size doesn't matter.
Editing the DPI does nothing. I've tried it with both the OpenType and TrueType.
Client uses VW2019, I tried it in VW2019 and 2020 (last SP).

Fonts work fine on client's other programmes such as Indesign and Illustrator.
----
Install font on computer.
Create a sheet layer in VW. Set font to the previously installed font.
Export sheet layer to PDF. Zoom in on PDF. 		Josh Loy
VB-176062

FBX exports with the wrong object cordinates.

We've had a few complaints that Augment3d isn't getting the positions of objects when exported - the objects 'appear' in the right place, but their XYZ coordinates are always (0,0,0)

Our users are expecting to be able to see the original positions within Augment3d.
This is so they can use the Eos/Augment3d features like "Scenic Element Movable" to move the pieces of scenery around using the 'real' position values in Eos, and see the actual set piece positions when adding other items (fixtures, mobile set pieces etc)

Unfortunately, it turns out that while Vectorworks' Collada exporter is creating a reasonable hierarchy, every node has an identity transform and instead the actual positions of objects are being baked into triangulated geometry.

This makes the export effectively unusable for many of our users - the only way we've found so far to get the actual scenic object positions into A3D is to manually re-enter all the important positions so Augment3d can reparent the objects.
That takes a very long time for a large set!

For example:
If you create a 2x2x2 cube centred at the position (0, 0, 10) as displayed in Vectorworks.

On export, the user expects a node at (0,0,10) containing a cube mesh with opposite corners (-1, -1, -1) , (1,1,1) - the same as appears in Vectorworks.

Instead, Vectorworks exports a node at (0,0,0) containing a cube mesh with opposite corners at (-1,-1,9) and (1,1,11).

We see the same thing with FBX export. I don't think the user has tried any other formats.

So:
Is there an option to include the object transforms in the export that our users and ourselves may have missed?

If not, can this please be fixed for either the Collada (DAE) or FBX exports?
(We can point users to the 'right' format once we know which one works)

Are there any other export formats where Vectorworks does​ preserve the original object transforms in the export?
Justin Hutchison
VB-175619

Crash on Big Sur 11.0.1 when updating viewports (M1 only)

 
* Update all viewports in Artistic.vwx file
* Vectorworks crashes. Crash log attached. 		Justin Hutchison

VB-174988

FBX Export: This object causes empty or corrupt FBX, and Cineware Error

I have a model with a few thousand objects in it which I've been trying for a few days now to export as an FBX to send to a film VFX company. However the export kept on failing: either no FBX file would be created at the end of the export process, or the file would be empty or unopenable.

After spending a few more hours today trying to isolate WHICH of the many objects was causing the problem I believe I narrowed it down to a hamper symbol which I've attached. The mesh was originally imported from the SketchUp 3D Warehouse. It seems to specifically be the casters which are causing the problem, because if I delete the casters entirely then the FBX finally exports properly.

I'm also attaching an 'empty' FBX that I just export of the problematic meshes. Notice it's only 6KB. When I delete the casters the exported FBX ends up being 785 KB.


The other telling sign of the FBX failing was that when I close Vectorworks I get a Cineware Error message (attached, along with the .txt file it references).


While I've worked around the bug for the moment, if there are any insights gained about the underlying cause I'd love to know so I can avoid it in the future. Unfortunately I wasted about 5 hours this week dealing with these FBX issues.

Thanks! 		Justin Hutchison

VB-175361

Potential bug caught by clang static analyzer.

clang-analyzer detected a potential bug in UMCPolyline2.cpp, in `TMCPolyline::OffsetControl`.

if VertType is not always of type vtArc a garbage value is compared against 0. causing the type to nondeterministically be assigned to vtCorner. 		Justin Hutchison
VB-173945

Editing a Shadow Catch Texture Hangs Vectorworks

This problem takes me a few repeated attempts to reproduce but it happens very often.  I originally was working on a file using shadow catchers and had to force quit several times before I could get (and save) the settings I needed.
# Open the attached VWX file
This file was created from a new blank document and only has a Texture resource in it.
# In the Resource Manager, edit the "Shadow Catch Texture:
# In the Edit Texture dialog, click the "Edit" button for Transparency.
# Without making any changes, Click OK to exit both dialogs.
# Repeat steps 2 - 3 several times until Vectorworks hangs.
Usually Vectorworks will hang within 10 tries.  If it does not hang, try reverting the file and repeat them again. 		Justin Hutchison

VB-172990

Clip Cube Shifts in 2020 When Rendering Inside Rotated Symbol

The attached movie and test file show this in VW 2019 compared to 2020. The file has Clip Cube enabled, and contains a simple 2D/3D symbol rotated 90º.

To reproduce, in each version, enter the 3D Component and render in RW.

VB-172722

Viewport Missing Walls

When user tries custom, Fast, or FQRW, the walls will not render in the viewport.  The walls will render if using Open GL.  Going back to the Design Layer, the walls are indeed there.  

I found as a work around is to right click on the viewport and click edit and returning to the design layer.  I set View > Layer Options to show snap modify others and from that perspective view, create a new viewport.  That new viewport will render, and an interesting byproduct of that new viewport, the original viewport will now render.

I found that exporting this file down to 2019, the viewport renders as it should without issue or need to recreate a perspective view. 		Justin Hutchison

I have tried all export options will all render modes and get the same issue. 		Justin Hutchison
VB-167375

Option "Update When Values Change" is always on

Hi Vetorworks

The option "Update When Values Change" is always on. If you edit a material trough the OIP you can switch off this option. When you edit a different material, the option is set on again.

Best regards, Marc 		Justin Hutchison

-Now zoom/pan in the drawing

Note that the objects show their graphics incorrectly. If you switch to Top/Plan view again everything will show correctly except for the RW Camera, which will be invisible. If you switch to 3D and then back to Top/Plan one more time, the Camera will then become visible.

This only seems to happen if an RW Camera exists in the file and the export is done while in Top/Plan view.

VB-167751

Inconsistency when making changes while editing renderworks camera

Steps:
# Open the attached file
# Double click the viewport
# Select the camera
# Zoom out and enable the clip cube if it is not already enabled
# Change the clip cube to cut off a portion of the aforementioned viewport
# Select "Return to Viewport"
# Update the viewport

_Notice the clip cube is not visible when viewport is updated_

 

_NOTES:_
* _Doing these same steps selecting the design layer instead of the camera does show the correct edit (shows the clip cube in the render)_
* _Moving an object when editing a RW camera does cause the viewport to go out of date and shows the changes_

_Overall some changes when editing a document when editing in a design layer via edit camera and edit design layer seem to be different._ 		Justin Hutchison
VB-167421

RW Renders Show Object Stacking Incorrectly Inside Containers

I've attached a movie and test file that show this. The file contains a Group with a Rectangle and an Extrude placed inside. The Extrude is at the front of the stacking order and in front of the Rectangle in 3D space.

To reproduce:

-Render in any RW mode

Note that the stacking shows correctly, where the Extrude displays in front of the Rectangle.

-Now enter the Group and render in RW again

Note that now the Rectangle always renders in front of the Extrude.

The same thing happens inside Symbols.

I see this in previous versions as well. 		Justin Hutchison

VB-173697

Renderworks: Image not displayed through glass material

The video shows the problem being reproduced.

I remember with 2017 and 2018 (and I believe 2019 too) I could do a Workaround, in which I would create an Extrude object and create a group together with the image. Then the image would be seen in 3D RenderWorks, because of being grouped with an Extrude. Right now with 2020 and 2021 I'm not being able to execute this Workaround anymore.

--------------------------

--------------------------
How to Reproduce
--------------------------

Steps:

1) Open the sample file (sample10653original.vwx)
2) Check Unified View
3) Execute RW rendering
4) Set Indirect Lighting of Lighting Options to "Exterior, 3 Bounces"
5) The Texture Color Image of Shaders is not displayed.
Only the Texture Bump Image is displayed in a valid state.

"Off_Unified view.png","On_Unified view.png".

------

The rule to reproduce is uncertain.

VB-172505

--------------------------
Target environment
--------------------------
Mac/Win
v2020 25.0.3(537701),

v2021 as well
--------------------------
About Problem
--------------------------
The rendering result of Area Light and the representation of area light figures are different from the previous version.

-Please refer to "sample200709.vwx", "movie12265.vwx"
*The color of the Area Light is light blue so that it would be easy to understand.

v2019 or below:
-Area Ligh turns white,
the surface is not rough.

v2020, v2021:
-Area Light itself turns black,
the surface of the Extrude illuminated by the light reflects the specified color, but it has a rough expression like noise.

*Remarks*
*The same result was obtained by switching the OIP Quality to "Very High".
*If I remove the option of "Render Geometry" of OIP, the shape of Area Light disappears, but the rendering result will be the same as 2019 or below.

VB-167418

Tangent snap and Option Tangent snap not symmetrical

# Draw a line (Line A), then a circle centered on A so that one endpoint of the line is outside the circle. EG start the circle in Diameter Mode and draw from one end of Line A to mid point of Line A.
# Engage the tangent snap.
# Draw Line B from the circle to the end point of Line A. Result: Line B is tangent to the circle? One end point on the circle. Other endpoint at end of Line A.
# Draw Line C, same as B, but hold the Option key to reverse the tangent direction . Result: Line C is tangent (?) to the circle and ends at end points of A & B.
# Draw Line D connecting start points of B & C. Results: ____D should be perpendicular to A but it is not. ____B & C should be same length. But they are not. ____B & C should represent a mirrored condition across A. But they do not. ____C seems to be especially not tangent. See also Community board thread: [https://forum.vectorworks.net/index.php?/topic/68092-tangent-snaps-not-reliable/] 		Josh Loy
VB-172686

PDF Publish: pdf files size comparison

Attached are two different .vwx files.

1. 477_Details Trockenbau Flure.vwx
This file when Publishing to PDF, gives PDFs with sizes between about 1MB and 5MB

2. 477_Details Akustikdecken Klassenzimmer.vwx
This file when Publishing to PDF, gives PDFs with sizes between about 3MB and 28MB

Both .vwx files have more or less the same objects in the drawing and RM. Even though they aren't exactly the same and normal that there is some difference. Between 5MB maximum size compared to 28MB, was enough for the Customer to complain and ask why.

This are Viewports, which do not include all the objects in the drawing. When the PDF is exported, it calculates all objects including the ones that are not seen by the Viewport. When removing all objects outside of the Viewport area, the PDF file size decreased significantly.

Is this situation wished? Is there a possibility to have calculated int he file size only the objects shown in the PDF? If this is WAD... would be possible to have this changed to an Enhancement, please?

Thank you in advance. 		Josh Loy
VB-174764

Can't zoom in close to PDFs

About 80% of the time when I try to zoom in close to a PDF, the contents disappear at a certain point once I'm too close. This makes looking at and tracing details quite difficult.

I happen to be working with rasterized PDFs; not sure if that's part of the issue or not.

The Navigation Graphics setting doesn't seem to have any affect on this issue.

Two screen recordings are attached. The first one is more recent and shows the issue on a freshly imported PDF. (Not sure why the re-rendering of the PDF at each zoom level is particularly slow for this screen recording).

The second screen recording is a bit older; I originally thought the problem had to do with cropped PDFs specifically. I was finding that adding a crop caused the disappearing issue to occur, but then entering and exiting the crop edit window would solve it.

But I've since found that the issue also pops up with uncropped PDFs, so I'm not too sure what the cause might be.

Also attaching a Vectorworks file containing the uncropped PDF from screen recording 1. 		Josh Loy

VB-174392

Structural Grid Lines do not display in section viewport with the "Display extents before cut plane" option selected

The attached VWX file contains a Tool/Plan viewport and a Section viewport on a sheet layer.

Notice the section viewport correctly displays grid lines.

Select the section viewport and select the "Display extents before cut plane" option in the Object Info palette, then update the viewport.

Notice the grid lines no longer display.

The "Display extents before cut plane" setting should have no effect on the display of Grid Lines. 		Josh Loy
VB-170161

Question : The PDF file size of VW2020 may be larger than that of VW2019.

The size of the PDF file created by the “Export PDF” command of VW2020 may be larger than that of VW2019.

This problem can see in the user created file.

Is this a bug? Or is it a file-specific issue?

 

Why is the PDF file size of the Mac version larger than the Windows version even with the same file?

 

◎Mac PDF file size

VW2019(2019_Mac.pdf) : 2.5MB

VW2020(2020_Mac.pdf) : 7.5MB / Reduction : None (highest image quality)

 

◎Windows PDF file size

VW2019(2019_Win.pdf) : 734KB

VW2020(2020_Win.pdf)  : 1MB / Reduction : None (highest image quality)

 

Hayato Wada

VB-174291

Export PDF doesn't support classes for referenced viewports

Hi Vectorworks

Export DWG/DXF has a checkbox to export classes (as layers) and this also works for referenced viewports.

Export PDF has also a checkbox, but it's not working for referenced viewports.

Unfortunately export of classes into a PDF-document is a requirement in a current project of one of our customers and this project has several building in severals documents and uses ref. viewports.

Best regards, Marc

  		Josh Loy

VB-170909

Symbols with nested classes that are different than the root symbol class can't be selected when Classes are set to Show/Snap Other

In this drawing I have a symbol...nested in that symbol are lines on a class that is NOT the None class. But when I place that symbol on my drawing, it is placed in the None Class. If my Class Options is set to Show/Snap others (and the None class is the active class)....I can marque around that symbol and select it, but I +can't+ click on it to select. Is that WAD? I've never noticed this but it makes no sense. The symbol itself is sitting on the None class, my active class, so shouldn't I be able to click on the symbol to select it?

I can send a video if necc to demonstrate.

 

thanks,

Cory 		Josh Loy

VB-175172

Then switch to rotated plan, and switch to Top... Now when you move the Image Prop and snap to another object, it changes the Z height of the Image Prop to match the Z of the snapped point. It does this even when the Active Plane is set to Screen Plane.

There is no reason the Z value should be changing since that's perpendicular to the view.

VB-172164

Clip Cube Fails to Show Fills of 3D Spaces

Movie and test file are attached. The file contains a building model with Spaces for each room. The Spaces have "Show 3D" enabled and have been fitted to the roofs/slabs above.

To reproduce:

-Render in OpenGL
-Activate the Clip Cube and resize it as shown

Note that some of the Spaces show their fills in the cut plane, but most don't.

Using the Clip Cube is a good way to error-check the 3D Space fittings to make sure there are no unwanted gaps, so this bug kind of kills that option.

If you create a Section Viewport that cuts through the Spaces, all of them will show their fills in the section plane graphics. 		Josh Loy
VB-168764

The length of the “Polyline” with executing the "Unfold Surfaces" command is different from the original circle length (Perim).

The length of the “Polyline” with executing the "Unfold Surfaces" command to “NURBS Surface” is different from the original circle length (Perim).

 

■ How to Reproduce

1. Create a “circle” (Dia : 1000mm / Perim : 3142mm) and execute the “Extrude” command. (Height: 2000mm)

2. Select the “Extrude” object with "Extract Surface Mode" of the "Extract" tool.

3. Select the created “NURBS Surface” and execute the “Unfold Surfaces” command.

4. The polyline's “Perim” is 3129mm while the “Perim” of the circle is 3142mm.

5. The “Perim” of the “Polyline” that was executed with the “Unfold Surfaces” command on the “Extrude” object (Solid Section) on which the ”Split” tool was executed also does not become 3142 mm.

6.The “Perim” is 3129mm and 3131mm, even if compareing the “Polyline” that executed the "Unfold Surfaces" command in the attached file.

 

Hayato Wada

VB-167390

Best Performance causes Tile Geometry to appear in Viewport Annotations when the Class is Off in the Viewport

See the attached test document.

In this document, you will find a viewport. Inside of the viewport annotations, there are two rectangles with tile fills. The tile resource geometry is in the class called “Geometry in Tile”. This class is currently turned off in the viewport class settings.

If you are in the navigation graphics for Best Performance, the geometry in the tile shows; however, it doesn’t export or print.

If you are in the navigation graphics for Good Performance and Compatibility or Best Compatibility, the geometry doesn’t show on screen and it doesn’t print/export.

This appears to be an issue with the Best Performance navigation setting. 		Josh Loy

VB-168383

KLS: Ghostobjects in Vectorworks 2020

Hi there, since 2020 we randomly do have sort of "ghostobjects".
This could be our german windows or doors, or a lighting device.
Considering windows and doors this might happen when using section viewports, edit section in place, edit 2D-components.

The video "Ghostobjects.mp4" is from a customer (with a sense of humor). In this video you see a red ghostobject.

Or see the screenshot "GhostobjectGermanWindow.png". The ghostobject here was located at Vectorworks origin and seen in every layer, even sheet layers.
I also attached my testfile "GhostobjectGermanWindow.vwx".

The big problem with ghostobjects is, that they disappear after closing and reopening the file.
So, in my testfile the ghostobject is gone. However, maybe you still could analyse something in this file.

Video "Geisterobjekte.mp4" is from the same customer (with the sense humor) as above.
Also from this customer the scrennshots in folder "Ghostobjects on three Macs". Here you see screenshots of ghostobjects on three different Macs.
Up to now the ghostobjets seem to be related to Mac only. But that is only a guess of mine.

All ghostobjects do have in common, that they disappear when you close (better say save and close) and reopen the file.
Also that the ghostobjects do appear only randomly and not very often. 		Josh Loy

VB-173897

Space Boundary Wall Picking Fails When Wall Coincides with Edge of Space

Movie and test file are attached. The file contains a wall network with a Space object whose top edge coincides with the bottom edge of a virtual wall.

To reproduce:
-Select the Space and choose "Pick Boundary" from the OIP Auto-Boundary menu
-Try to highlight the virtual wall

Note that it can only be highlighted if you zoom-in closely on the wall.

If the virtual wall coincides with the edge of another 2D shape or plugin the picking works fine, so this only seems to happen when the wall coincides with Space edges.

Since the "1-Walls" layer is stacked on top of the "1-Spaces" layer it seems like the virtual wall should have picking priority over the edge of the Space, so you should be able to highlight it at any zoom level.

The same thing happens in past versions.

Christopher Graye

VB-167699

Extrude - Push/Pull 2D Object changes Class

The attached video shows the problem being reproduced

1. Draw a Rectangle in a blank Document. This Rectangle will be in the Class None by default.

2. Create a New Class and change and activate it.

3. Select the Push/Pull Tool and create a 3D Object from the rectangle. The newly created 3D Object will now be part of the New Class, instead of the Class None like the original object (rectangle) was.

Customer complains that the object should remain in the original class and not switch to whatever class we have active in the moment. 		Christopher Graye
VB-169795

Visibility Tool Seeing Too Deep in Reference DLVPs

When using the Visibility tool to check Class visibility for Symbol Classes in Reference DLVPs the tool sees Classes embedded in Symbol definitions instead if the Classes to which Symbol instances are assigned.

See attached files.

If "ReferencedFile" is opened, the Visibility tool is invoked, and the cursor is hovered over 1 of the 4 Symbol instances in the file, the tool will display "1 Container Class" (the Class to which the Symbols are assigned).

The Symbol definition in "ReferencedFile" contains geometry assigned to each of 4 embedded Classes.

"CurrentFile" references "ReferencedFile."  If the former is opened, the Visibility tool is invoked, and the cursor is hovered over 1 of the 4 Symbol instances in the DLVP that is visible, the tool will display "VP-Ref:None," "VP-Ref:2 Embedded Class 1," "VP-Ref:2 Embedded Class 2," or "VP-Ref:2 Embedded Class 3," depending on which portion of the given Symbol over which the cursor is hovering.  The Visibility tool should be displaying "1 Container Class," as above. 		Josh Loy
VB-170307

Creating DLSVP Workflow shows Inconsistency in "Create Section Viewport" Dialog

 

I've attached a short movie that shows this issue
* Launch VW
* Draw a sphere
* Create a section viewport (View > Create Section Viewport...)
* Draw the section line over the sphere
* In "Create Section Viewport" dialog, create the section on a new Design Layer .
* uncheck "Display Extents Beyond Cut Plane" option

# When testing this on Windows, when you uncheck or check this option, the other control below this option stay grayed out. I assume this is the intended behavior.
# When you uncheck/ check the option on Mac, the controls below become enabled. Note the buttons are enabled, but they don't open any dialogs, except for "Hidden Object Display..."

If the description in (2.) is the intended behavior on Mac, then "Hidden Object Display..." dialog shouldn't open.  		Christopher Graye

VB-169221

VS GetObjWallInsertMode: flags in help/documentation not correct

GetObjWallInsertMode returns following flags:

0 = Center

1 = Left Edge

2 = Right Edge

But in the documentation it states:

{color:#de350b}*1*{color} - Center
{color:#de350b}*2*{color} - {color:#de350b}*Leaf*{color} Edge
{color:#de350b}*3*{color} - Right Edge

file:///Applications/Vectorworks%202020%20/VWHelp/Script%20Reference/Pages/ObjectsWalls.html#GetObjWallInsertMode

Developer wiki already corrected 		Christopher Graye

VB-168518

VB-169473

Double line/Double-line polygons: Inititial setting of the pen attributes by class doesn't work

Create a new file, create a class and set pen attributes.

Select Double line tool or Double-line polygon tool and set a component in the Prefereнce dialog which is "Make all attributes by class" from a newly created class.

Insert lines by the three options in Preferences dialog - create lines, create polygons, create lines and polygons.

Notice that the pen is set only in line created with option Create polygons.

If you select the component and click "Remove by class settings"  attributes will be the same but they will work as expeted. After that if you select again "Make attributes by class" in the current or a newly created file it will work as expected until restart of VW.

Please see the attached file and a movie. 		Christopher Graye
VB-173920

C4D exports for Twinmotion should bake alpha masks into color map

There is a thread on the forum from a user who is having trouble with image props not showing their masks in Twinmotion.

 

Twinmotion does not handle color and alpha masks being separate.  The mask must be baked into the alpha of the color map.

 

I looked into this and there is a routine that runs when you edit textures, that Tamsin requested, that if the maps are the same size it does try to bake the mask into the color map.  But what I am seeing is that the PNG file that comes out is 32 bits and I think has the aplha but is not a "PNG with Alpha" for some reason.  I think the fix is to get the result of that routine to go out as PNG with alpha, when doing C4D export.  I ended up in the raw image image export code at one point.  Maybe the flag can be set in there.  The routine that manipulates the color image when you use the Edit Texture dialog is 

MultiplyColorImageByMask.

 

https://forum.vectorworks.net/index.php?/topic/72107-vw-imageprops-texture-export-issue-or-something-more-nefarious/ 		Justin Hutchison
VB-167653

3D locus point is very large when first moving to 3D in attached file

Steps:
# In a new document, import the attached file
# Switch to the light plot design layer
# Then using flyover tool move the document to 3D and zoom out a little

_Notice the 3D Locus points are now very large.  Eventually it does fix itself._ 		Justin Hutchison

VB-172946

*VW Freezes/Crashes When Rendering in OpenGL --GetObject() crashed on multi thread

GetObject() crashed on multi thread:

[https://analytics.vectorworks.net/crashes?crashId=6071869]

 

I've attached a few movies and a test file that show this. The file contains a building model saved in Multi-View.

To reproduce:

-In the top-left pane, use CTL+Middle Mouse Button to activate the Flyover tool in boomerang mode, and do a few flyover operations
-Now quickly press Shift+CMD+G to render in OpenGL

Note that VW will sometimes either freeze or crash. Overall I've gotten 4 freezes and 4 crashes. Most were in build 557162 but I also got a crash in build 558073.

The attached movies show three of the crashes. Crash logs are also attached.

Based on the crash logs some of these might be different crashes. If they need to be moved to separate reports just let me know.

This might have to do with the timing of how quickly the shortcuts are pressed, though it's hard to be sure. I have a habit of pressing these quickly and often throughout a project and haven't had this problem before, so it looks like a 2021 regression.

This might be related to the bug reported in VB-171383, though I can no longer duplicate that in recent builds.

I'm not seeing these crashes in Analytics for some reason... 		Justin Hutchison
VB-169776

*Vectorworks crashing

Customer has reported crashing when working on a particular file. They said they are mainly doing annotations as the drawing had already been done. The customers colleague has also reported crashing on the following file.

I have been unable to see the crashing first hand as it happens randomly.

I have tried:
* Reset user folder
* Ran repair
* Checked file for rogue geometry
* Purged file
* Changed navigation graphics
* Updated to latest service pack

VB-168445

Direction arrow is inconsistent about straigh truss, lighting pipe and polyline

Please watch the attached movie.

Notice that direction arrow is setting in the OIP of the straigt truss which set the arrow only for the selected trusses.

But for lighting pipes and polylines when you check "Show direction" it turns on the setting for all lighting pipes and polylines.

If you select lighting pipes and polylines after truss which has checked "Show direction" they will have direction arrow.

If you select lighting pipes and polylines after truss which hasn't checked "Show direction" they will haven't direction arrow.

  		Kevin Linzey

VB-168213

VS GetWorkingPlaneMat() returns the N and U vectors swapped

When the output of GetWorkingPlaneN() is compared to the output of GetWorkingPlaneMat() it is pretty obvious that the N vector is swapped with the U vector.

Here is the output of one such comparison:

GetWorkingPlaneN:     WP cen= \{-0.5, 0, 0.5}   WP Nvec= \{-1, 0, 0}   WP Uvec= \{0, -1, 0}

GetWorkingPlaneMat: WP cen= \{-0.5, 0, 0.5}   WP Nvec= \{0, -1, 0}   WP Uvec= \{-1, 0, 0}

Note: The Normal (N) vector in one output is the U vector in the other. The output of GetWorkingPlaneN() returns the correct values as determined by drawing the vectors manually.

 

Please see the attached file. There is a script and stored working planes with a text object on each stored plane. Activate a plane and manually select the object on that plane, then run the script "Show WP Mat" to show the returned values in the Message Window. Note in all cases the N & U vectors are swapped.

I believe the problem has existed since the function's inception in VW 2011. I have tested this back to VW 2013 with the same results.

  		Josh Loy
VB-171999

Site Model Sculpting Falloff not visible

I'm not seeing the interactive color range for falloff when using the sculpting tool on a site model. Josh Loy
VB-168180

VS GetWorkingPlane() and GetWorkingPlaneN() only work the first time they are called

After the first call in a script to GetWorkingPlane() or GetWorkingPlaneN(), on subsequent calls they fail to return correct data. On the second, third, or more calls GetWorkingPlane() GetWorkingPlaneN() return data representing the Layer Plane.

On the second (or more) call, GetWorkingPlane() returns (0, 0, 0) for the plane's center and (0, 0, 0) for each of the rotation values. This describes the Layer Plane.

On the second (or more) call, GetWorkingPlaneN() returns (0, 0, 0) for the plane's center and (0, 0, 1) for the Normal vector, and (1, 0, 0) for the U vector. This describes the Layer Plane.

 

See attached file. In the file there are two scripts, a named Working Plane, and an extruded rectangle with Planar Text on one of its faces. Follow these instruction to reproduce the error.

1) Open file "WP Test v2020.vwx"

2) Open the Working Planes palette.

3) Double click on "Working Plane 1".

4) Run script "Show WP".  Note: in Message Window the second  line shows data for the Layer Plane.

5) Run script "Show WPN".  Note: in Message Window the second line shows data for the Layer Plane.

 

Expected Behavior: GetWorkingPlane() and GetWorkingPlaneN() should return values describing the current Working Plane no matter how many times they are called in a script. When GetWorkingPlane() was tested in VW 2009 and VW 2010 it returned correct values for user defined planes on multiple calls, so this is a regression. 		Josh Loy
VB-167554

RW Camera Focus Operations Create Two Undo Events in 2020

I've attached a movie and test file, containing an RW Camera, that show this in VW 2019 compared to VW 2020.

To reproduce:

-Open the file in VW 2019
-Drag the middle blue handle to focus the Camera
-Now Undo once

Note that the edit gets reverted.

-Now open the file in VW 2020 and try the same thing

Note that now it takes two Undos to revert the edit.

The same thing happens going back to SP0. 		Josh Loy

VB-167402

Sketch Mode problems in Top/Plan

In the attached file, the two dimensions are set to use an object Sketch mode in the Render tab of the OIP. The top is set to No Sketch. The bottom is set to Tentative.

With the drawing in Top/Plan, change the render mode to Sketch. For me, even though I have the Sketch Options set to Rough, the objects render as Tentative, even the objects with object Sketch modes set.

Switch to Top view and set the render mode to Sketch. Everything displays as it should using the default Sketch style and object custom modes.

Switch back to Top/Plan. The incorrect sketch returns. 

Go to Sketch Options. Click the Preview button. The display is correct with the overall objects using the default sketch mode and the objects with custom sketch styles displaying correctly. 

Desired result. The display should always show as if the Preview button is pressed or the view in Top mode when Sketch rendering is selected. 		Justin Hutchison
VB-170015

When importing an image the process bypasses the Import Image Options dialog box a places the image directly on the design layer. 

See the attached screen capture video. 

Fundamentals customer has tested in both 2019 and 2020 and yielded the same results.

Having the customer reset the Prefs via the Preferences dialog resolved the issue for one import but all subsequent imports reverted to bypassing the options.

I cannot replicate this on any other device using a Fundamentals license. 		Josh Loy
VB-168332

Request for investigation- Why is there a difference in animation processing between macOS before High Sierra and macOS after Mojave?

Our customer asked us to investigate animation.
The customer is using High Sierra and it takes a long time to process the animation.
 
I have a question.
Why is there a difference in animation processing between macOS before High Sierra and macOS after Mojave?
 
Clicking the "Play" button in the Animation Path OIP has the following differences:
[MacOS before High Sierra]
"Calculating Animation" is displayed in the progress bar at the bottom right of the application window, and it takes a long time to process.
Reproduction movie: 10614_High Sierra.mov
[MacOS after Mojave]
The progress bar at the bottom right of the application window is not displayed, and the process ends immediately.
Reproduction video: 10614_Catalina.mov
 
* Notable occurrence when any key frame speed is set to "-99%"
Sample file: 10614.vwx

VB-170429

T02137 - Hatch/Tile Fill Not Updating after Styled Space is Resized and Planar Object is Added

I've attached a short movie that shows this issue

 

-Open test file 

-Enable Attribute mapping tool and scale (Up) the Tile fill in the Space Object

-After space is scaled, select both the space object and the rectangle

-Right click while hovering over the objects and select "Add Surface" from context menu

-Notice the 'new' space object shows the tile fill prior to the scale operation

This looks like a redraw/reset problem. To fix this you have to select the AM tool and reset the resize rectangle to show the correct 'Tile Fill' 		Christopher Graye

-Go to the "Graphics Attributes" and double click the Treads > Top

-Change the Material to "Wood 2x Framing Insulated" then close "Attributes Tread top face" and "Stair Settings" dialogs

VB-174051

Copy/Paste gives different planar ref ID for Extrude Along Path's profile object

In the attached file, there are 2 extrude along path objects. In the Profile group, the original arc node has a planar refID of 1; the one that was copied, then pasted in place has a planar refID of 0xfff..ff. This happens whether paste or paste-in-place is used. When paste-in-place is used, there are 2 coincident identical objects that look different to Purge.

Steps to create object with this problem:
# Create an extrude along path (I used a line and a circle, selected both, used line as path object and created extrude along path).
# Copy/paste or copy/paste-in-place. Look at the planar ref IDs in the extrude's profile group's object (an arc node, in my case). Compare its planar ref id to the one in the original extrude.

Haven't tested it in other versions. 		Rick Berge
VB-175391

Shortcuts Fail After Focus is Changed from the Drawing Window (Big Sur)

Movie and test file are attached.

To reproduce:

-Do any operation that requires you to click outside the drawing window (for example choose File/Save or activate the "View A" saved view from the mode bar menu)
-Now move the cursor back over the drawing window and try a shortcut (for example press the Middle Mouse Button to Pan, or press CTL+Middle Mouse Button to flyover)

Note that this fails. In order to get it to work you have to first left-click back inside the drawing window.

I don't see this problem in 10.14.6 or in 10.15.6 so it looks like a 11.0.x problem (tested on 11.0.1).

It's also possible that this just happens over VPN and has nothing to do with 11.0.x, though it's hard for me to confirm with my current setup. I know past new OSX versions have had focus problems so it feels like it could be OS-related... 		Ian Lane
VB-176017

Section Viewport: wall remains black

The attached video shows the problem being reproduced

In the Section Viewport 410 Ansicht Süd, there is a wall that despite the class color / material changes, it remains black. What could be the reason for this?

In the drawing the wall is displayed with its correct color / material, only in the Section Viewport remains black.

Thank you in advance. 		Rick Berge
VB-176121

OpenGL settings from viewport creation window are applying to Design Layer

* Have a complex 3D model (example file attached with arbitrary geometry... this issue is not file-specific). 
* Be in OpenGL.
* View > Create Viewport.
* Click on OpenGL settings within the Viewport creation window. Any changes made in this pop-up seem to erroneously apply to the Design Layer still visible in the background.
* For example, changing the Detail level from Low to Very High causes a hang of a few seconds while the higher detail level is apparently cached (unnecessarily).
* Changing the other settings such as Edges, Textures, and Color causes the geometry in the background to change as well.
* This is all unexpected and unnecessary, since when you hit OK to create the viewport, it's an out-of-date viewport that must be rendered anyways.
* Additionally, when you return back to the Design Layer, the settings you determined for the viewport are now applied to the Design Layer, BUT the Design Layer OpenGL settings don't reflect that. There's a mismatch. You have to turn settings off then back on in order for it to be correct again.
* This I all shown in the attached screen recording.
* A user should be able to change any of the settings in the OpenGL settings window when making a viewport without having to wait multiple seconds each time a setting is changed. There should be no calculations performed at that time. This issue is particularly annoying in files that are even more complex than this, since each OpenGL checkbox might cause a hang of up to 20 seconds in certain files. 		Rick Berge
VB-173498

Material Volume and Area calculations are very slow

Open the attached document.
This is a simple document with a chair symbol.
Recalculate the worksheet named "Materials All - Itemised"
The worksheet list object with materials in a chair symbol. 
Notice that it takes 30sec to recalculate the worksheet.

A profile shows that calculating volume and area is very expensive with these objects.  		Josh Loy

VB-173557

DOM: Site Protection Server HostID changes

There is an improved support traffic based on the Site Protection Server. There are different reasons for that. A higher Number of Site Protection Servers is uses for Licensing and the other reason ist, that the Protection system changed from Dongle/Mac Adresse to Activation Code.

Reported Problems:

The Host ID Changed and there is no Access to the activated Host. There Are different reasons. Some of them are comprehensible others lesser:
# User Migrate Site Protection to a new server. It is dealable that the user have to release his license and re-activate on the new server. This ist noch a real issue. We think this acceptable that this needs a new Activation code.
# User have another Harddisk connected and mitgrates his system to this new harddist. Not tested, but users reported that they do not have released the license and could not activate with the same activation code. Would be good, Harddisk ID is not used for generating new Machine.
# Server is broken and ist installed new with new Hardware. This is dealable (very rarely). We think this acceptable that this needs a new Activation code.
# We got reports, that updating from Mojave on Catalina Server needs to release and reactivate license (respectively they did not release). We think this acceptable that this needs a new Activation code.
# We got reports, that updating form catalina 10.15.5 on 10.15.6 requires a new activation code (or a License release bevore Update)
# Site Protection is installed on a virtual Server. This Servers sometimes are are running in Datacenters. This Systems somehow renew or auto-migrate the server on other Hardware. So they need a new Activation code every two weeks or ever month maybe.

 

While some points are manageable and and are allowed to stand. Point 5 and 6 are real issues for the customers. Others also come to real issues if Licenses not running (If it is customer's blame or not do not help if Vectorworks is not running)

If they have an accident with the Site Protection, their Vectorworks Licenses not running and the Office is blocked. We cant help them immediately and we need some hours to get a new Activation code.

Mainly Big customers are using Site Protection server. And the activation System growing to a real problem. Some customers want their Dongle back or asking for a Dongle.

 

 

At least we don't really know how to fix but the actual state is insufficient for our customers and for us.

 

Possible solutions ideas:

1. Taking less restrictive Parameters to generate HostID

2. Linking Activation to a Server so Activations could be reseted Online on a Server (from us directly maybe like E-Serie Activations)

3. Maybe allow an emergency timeout for licenses

4. Possibility to get License directly from the cloud or the internet. Tracking and controlling could keep License secure.

5. Maybe a possibility to create directly an activation code without latency.

6. Or more informations about from what HostID is addicted. So we could make more precise manuals.

  		Tim Ardoin
VB-175867

Image Props hard to select in 3D OpenGL

When working in 3D OpenGL, Image Props cannot be selected by clicking on their surface. They can only be selected by clicking along the outer perimeter of the object. This makes interacting with them in 3D incredibly difficult. Whenever you grab one to move it, the object BEHIND the Image Prop is selected instead, which is confusing and inconsistent with how other 3D objects work. Walid Remaili

VB-169514

Question: Unable to open large size files by environments.

This is a question from our major customer.
They say that when opening files on their server, some people can't open, depending on the file sizes.
It seems an error message will shown that says "Internal Error - general failure encountered during disk I/O operation. (Failure on attempt to open file)"
Around 10MB files, everyone can open. But in case of about 50MB files, 2 out of 4 people can't open.
They can open properly if downloading the files to the local.

They are doing tele-working as the countermeasure against the novel coronavirus.
So, the PC environments are different each.
And they are using Series G via VPN.

Based on above things, we would like to ask you the followings...
1) What do you think the cause of the particular 2 people are unable to open large size files?
2) Is there any time limit or something to open files as a Vectorworks design?
(For example, it will show an error message, if you can't open a file in 60 seconds. etc...)

VB-175073

Components randomly becoming unfilled in roofs and roof faces

Logged on behalf of Ion Webster from the Beta Forum. I have been unable to duplicate after many attempts to trigger the issue and documenting the bug at this point, until we can duplicate.
---
I do not know how to bug list this, because it is not consistent enough, but happens enough to drive me crazy.

So in the three screenshots, are a mix of Roofs and roof faces. 01 was the state of the file when I opened it, you can see the Roof Framing component is showing as wire frame for the lower roof face. I was able to reset the roof face by double clicking as if I was going to edit the shape geometry and exiting the dialog (shown in image 02)without doing anything. This time it corrected the first time, occasionally I do this and the framing fills in, but the tile component becomes unfilled, rinse and repeat until all components are filled. 03 shows a roof, that I selected and toggled the soffit setting (could be soffit, fascia, or attic, it is only about forcing a reset of the PIO)

This was all created from scratch in 2021 over the past 6 weeks, into a default Architect(Imperial) template file. The roof items use the default 'Sloped Wood Struct Insul Spanish Tile' roof style. The roofs can be stable, then randomly opening the file something is unfilled.

I used an Artistic RW Style: 'Pencil (Sketch Concept) when only one roof was showing as unfilled and all roof components rendered as unfilled as shown in 04. Making sure all roof components in all roof items are shown as filled as shown in 05.

Again this is consistently inconsistent, and I cannot isolate it enough to make a real bug report. Because I could upload a file with a 'problem' roof and when it is opened it could appear as normal. I cannot record a video because it doesn't always occur.

Thanks for listening,

Ion 		Christopher Graye

VB-174691

Partner installer scripts do cannot manually create InstalledProductsManifest.xml

I need the functionality to deal with dependancies that support multiple products, and thus need a separate uninstaller.

Ultimately, I would also like to offer a bundle installer that shows each individual product as installed. 

I have found that I can write to the xml file if it already exists on disk, however, if I write to the xml and it does not yet exist, the file gets overwritten.

My solution in the betas was to create the xml during the add_to_workspace script, but the code does not create the file any more.
{code:java}
xmlFile = vs.GetFolderPath(12) + 'InstalledProductsManifest.xml'
xmlRoot = '/Products'
userFolder = -1 # We're getting the path ourselves
global xmlID
xmlID = vs.InitXML()
success = vs.ReadXMLFile(xmlID, userFolder, xmlFile)
if success != 0:
success = vs.CreateNewXMLDocument(xmlID, xmlRoot[1:])
vs.WriteXMLFile(xmlID, userFolder, xmlFile)
xmlID = vs.ReleaseXML(xmlID)
{code}
Running this code outside the install process works as expected, but it does nothing in the install script. 		Vladislav Stanev

VB-174309

File opens without workable viewports

First off, I want to apologize for the large files.  I have been working on this for the majority of the day and have not found a meaningful way to simplify the files or steps.  But the end result are large rendering issues.  Some part of  this strikes me as odd and may be linked to the undo table.

 

Steps:
# Open the attached file [^EthanRoschSlowFile18017 Carto NYC Design 2018.vwx]
# When prompted to linked missing reference files, select to relink them
# When the file browser is opened, press cancel and then select no to all
# Once the file is open, change the default 3D render view to use OpenGL and press num-5 or go to top view
# Select the walk through tool then open the document preferences
# In the first tab, uncheck use cropped perspective view
# walk through the file a little bit and close the file
# Open the attached file [^LuisGradient Opacity Control v2019.vwx]
# Notice the viewports are missing geometry
