VB-174722

Object Style Class Can't be Changed in Some Cases

Movie and test file are attached. The file contains a styled Window object.

To reproduce:

-Edit the Plugin Object Style Options
-Change the Class from "None" to "<Active Class>"
-Click OK to accept the change, then edit the style again
-Change the Class back to "None"
-Click OK to accept the change, then edit the style again

Note that the Class has reverted to "<Active Class>".

The same thing happens with all plugin object styles, but it only seems to happen when going from "<Active Class>" to "None". If you switch from "<Active Class>" to another class and then to "None" it works fine.

The same thing happens going back to 2021 SP0. 		Christopher Graye

VB-169204

AHA: Railings can use a lot of RAM (cannot switch to viewport in this case)

Well, this is actually not a bug. But we see regularly that customers doing BIM projects are using the railing tool. Sometimes the railings have round profiles. Of course this can become very "expensive".

In this case the custom cannot switch to sheet layer "Portrait" anymore because of this. To many objects are rendered. And even worse rendered with "shaded polygon". However, I log this as a bug anyhow. Maybe you see a way to "cache" the railings.. but don't know what kind of technology is available for this.

Steps to reproduce the problem:
# Open "Testfile 20200326_01"
# Try to switch to sheet layer "PORTRAIT"

As you can see this takes very very very long. We know that the amount of railings is a problem and also the chair is not optimized. But the main issue in the file are the railings.

Maybe you see a way to optimize railings in the future. 		Christopher Graye
VB-174464

In Section Viewport, Section Style class is not following visibility settings of the VP

Not sure if this is some kind of improvement or a bug...it feels like a bug. See the attached video.

You'll see that I create a Section Viewport and assign one of my own custom classes called *Section Style for the Cut Plane. The Section VP is created and the Cut Plane is shown in Green. As I change the color of that class in Organization, you'll see the lines changing color as you would expect. However, if I click into the Class settings and turn the *Section Style class OFF, it continues to show in the VP. This time changing the pen color of the class does not change the color of the geometry until I update the VP. An update does accept the proper color, but technically the Class should not be showing at all because it is turned off. Upon converting the VP to a group, the *Section Style class switches to being invisible, and I have to turn the class back on in Navigation to show it (as you would expect)

So it seems that the unusual 2021 behavior is that the Cut Plane class is ignoring it's Class Visibility setting. Seems like a bug? 		Josh Loy

If executing ”Borrow" button again, one user will be in a state where two licenses are borrowed.

 

We do not know the cause.

VB-172188

User submitted a file where a viewport has a random line showing up.

I found if I deleted this hatch from the file, the line will disappear, but of course so will the hatch.  I found if I went into the CMU Running Bond texture and changed the hatch to another hatch of any kind, the wall will render with a new pattern but that line will not appear. 		Justin Hutchison

VB-172982

T01757: Column and Pilaster Instances and Styles unselect Use Material option when copied or imported into another document

# Place an unstyled Column or Pilaster in a new document.
# Edit its Class/Materials and choose "Use Material" for both the Architectural and Structural component.
# Copy the object
# Create a new document and paste the object
*Notice* the "Use Material" options are unselected for both the Architectural and Structural component.
# Go back to the original document
# Create a new style from the unstyled Column or Pilaster
# Import the new style into another document.
*Notice* the "Use Material" options are unselected for both the Architectural and Structural component in the style definition. 		Christopher Graye

VB-173508

Partner Product Installer should alert the user when finishing installation on quit

The partner installer finishes installation on putting Vectorworks, which can take a bit of time. Currently the user gets no feedback that the installer is working — I added a progress dialog, but this comes after a considerable pause.

A test user of mine assumed that Vectorworks was hanging and force-quit, which likely interfered with the install. 		Vladislav Stanev
VB-172793

T01948 - Smart Options Display on Windows does not work when idle time is set to 5 seconds or higher

Smart Options Display feature is not working on Windows, when the mouse is idle. The default setting is 10 seconds, however, the Smart Options will only appear, when you set the trigger time to 4 seconds or less.

-Launch Vectorworks and don't move the mouse for 10 or more seconds and you'll notice the new Smart Options do not appear
-Go to Tools > Options > Vectorworks Preferences > Smart Options Display and set the timer to 4 or less seconds
-Click OK
-Don't move the mouse and you'll notice the Smart Options are now appearing

Ian Lane

VB-168675

Graphic attributes for Class overwrite fill and pen color for the text style when "use on creation" is also set to on for the class.

Create a custom test style in resources Create a new class Edit the Class properties Set use at creation to ON for Graphic Attributes Set use at creation to ON for Text Style Select the custom text style, created in step 1 for the class text style. Set the new class to be the active class Enter text. The text will be un-styled not class style. Therefore text does not have the text style applied on creation - the text style must always be applied after creation, by hand. Rick Berge

VB-172642

Horizontal Section Viewports displaced, bounds not updated

1. Create a HSVP (Horizontal Section Viewport)
2. Rotate it - notice its bounds are not updated
3. Undo and rotate again - notice the displacement here

I've come to the conclusion that if the viewport was not updated properly, its view matrix may be desynchronized from its transformation matrix. This may be causing problems with manual transformations of some plugin objects inside the HSVP that rely on correct view matrix. 		Rick Berge

VB-167961

Mirrored Objects Behaving Unexpectedly When Adjusting Sizes Via The OIP

The user creates an object within a document, a rectangle for this example, and then mirrors that object. Then the user selects both objects and chooses to adjust the size of the objects by typing a new size into the OIP. In this example the user changes the Y dimension and the upper left control point is chosen as the hold point. When change is made the rectangles grow by the dimension requested but in two different directions and only the original object grows relative to the control point selected. The mirrored object grows in the opposite direction. Josh Loy
VB-172189

Preformatted Room Finish Schedule displays incorrect information

The preformatted room finish schedule worksheet, when used with the Space tool, populates the material tag number cells with both the material descriptions AND the material tag numbers.

Earlier versions only diplayed the tag numbers. The material descriptions, on the other hand, were (and continue to be) shown in the preformatted room finish legend.

I believe the correct behavior is the one found in earlier versions: the *schedule* should include room number, name, and material tags. And the room finish *legend* should include the material descriptions.

As an aside, in the preformatted room finish schedule, the cells are too small to include clearly both the material tags and the descriptions (which confirms, in my mind, that this is a bug and not WAD).

A friend of mine, whose knowledge of such things exceeds my pitifully small universe of understanding, suggested this:

"You want to use the SUBSTRNG function in the row formulas. This looks for a delimiter character (in this case the space after the ] ) then returns the text up to that point:

Instead of this:
=Space'.'Finish Floor'
use this:
=SUBSTRING('Space'.'Finish Floor', ' ', 1)"

The attached file has two schedules–one the preformatted version exhibiting the problem; the other with the row formulas altered per the advice described above. The latter indeed shows just the tag itself, as appropriate. 		Chris Baccala
VB-169120

FS: Loft Surface -Tool - Arrows very small

Hi, as you can see the arrows are very very small, when you try to select a curve in the "Loft Creation" dialog...

I have a new MacBook Pro... 		Josh Loy

VB-171675

Trimmed Surface Arrays Fail to Show Objects When Placed Inside a Symbol

Movie and test file are attached. The file contains a Surface Array that has a 3D Symbol in its Array Items.

To reproduce, change the Edge Condition to "Trim".

Note that this causes all the NURBS Surfaces in the array to disappear.

If you convert the symbols to standalone objects inside the Array Items the problem goes away, but there's a massive performance hit that makes the Surface Array almost impossible to work with for slightly more-complex objects.

The same thing happened in previous versions. 		Josh Loy
VB-169334

Subdivision converted to Generic Solid - File size increases

Hi All,

This may not be a bug as such. But I don't understand why it would work this way at present.

I have a mesh object from SketchUp warehouse, when converting to Subdivision, then generic solid - the file size balloons.

Mesh file size - 1.9mb
Subdivision file size - 9.3mb
Generic Solids. - 131.mb


When I try to convert the same mesh directly to generic solid - it does not work but also doesn't appear with an error messages.

File Attached with symbol.

I currently need to manually simplify other meshes in the file, so i am trying to figure out the best workflow for this 'other than the simplify mesh command' As this is a workflow that might benefit Interior designers bringing in lost of mesh files.

If there was a script which could help me simply multiply meshes at once by a percentage. That would be great.

Or is there another process you could recommend?

Thank you 		Josh Loy
VB-171457

Class Attribute Text Style Inconsistency

The attached video screen capture should demonstrate that body of text that uses a Text Style Class Attribute will change in the OIP from being listed  'Class Text Style' and will revert to 'Un-Styled' when the class has an attribute color change.

Files used in screen cap video also included. 		Rick Berge
VB-170971

Question : Selecting multiple structural member objects and entering static text for the material parameter does not replace the same parameter value.

When multiple structural member objects are selected and static text is input for the material parameter, the parameter value input for only the last selected one structural material object is reflected. The other structural member objects remain unchanged from the original material parameter values.
 
Is this a limitation related to material parameter specifications or is it a bug?
 
--------------------------
*Target function*
--------------------------
Structural Member tool
 
--------------------------
*Reproduction procedure example*
--------------------------
1) Select the Structural Member tool and place three structural member objects in the drawing as an example.
2) Select all structural member objects.
3) Select the "Select Shape..." button in the OIP.
4) Enter any static text for the "Material" parameter and select the OK button.
5) If you check the material parameter in the structure property in the OIP, only the newly selected structural member object reflects the newly entered material parameter value.
Note that the structural member objects selected first and second remain unchanged from the original material parameter values.
 
*Remarks*
In the case of parameters that enter numerical values such as "Major Depth" and "Major Breadth", the same value is reflected in all structural material objects.
 
Please refer to attached "12244.mp4" and more files.
 
Best regards,
Kentaro Takesue
A&A 		Christopher Graye
VB-171905

Geoimage unable to update in Project Sharing

If a *Geoimage* is "checked out" by a user while in P*roject Sharing* no other user can "update" the Geoimage. This should work similarly to viewports where you can update a viewport without needing to check it out otherwise not all users can benefit from the Geoimage background.

 

See video. 		Vladislav Stanev

VB-169722

VGM Wireframe: grid is not depth-tested

VB-171365

Surface Hatches do not conform to Texture settings

Surface Hatches aligned using the 'Edit Surface Hatch…' facility, do not render the way they have been edited to do so. Not in the Design Layer, nor in Sheet Layer Viewports. 

This is seemingly a longstanding issue and has been the subject of many posts on the Forum for years: 

[https://forum.vectorworks.net/index.php?/search/&q=hatch%20texture%20align&search_and_or=and&sortby=relevancy] 

See the attached screenshots (in order by date-and-time) and the client's sample file to appreciate the issue. 

*Additional Finding:* As shown in the last few screenshots, only when the hatch 'alignment frame' is 'snapped' to the edge of the full-colour area of the image preview do the hatch and image align with each other in Hidden Line and OpenGL/Final Quality Renderworks.  		Justin Hutchison
VB-168577

VS ForEachObjectAtPoint did not work correct for all pio's

Attached you will find a .vwx document and a short movie which explains the problem.

If I run the VS you can see that all objects will be found except the grade object and the Site Modifiers pio. As these two objects also "run" through the "point" area these two must also be found. What can we do that all objects within this area will be found? 

 

Code:

PROCEDURE Example;
VAR
gx1, gy1 : REAL;

FUNCTION DoIt(h1 :HANDLE) :BOOLEAN;
BEGIN
AlertCritical('ObjType No = ', Num2Str(0, GetType(h1)));
DoIt:=true;
END;

BEGIN
DSelectAll;
ForEachObjectAtPoint(DoIt, 0, 0, 0.0, 0.0, 10); 

END;
RUN(Example);

 

Also in Mainline with the new function:

gSDK->ForEachObjectAtPoint it will not work. So this seems to be a problem of the core of this call.

SDK Code:

gSDK->ForEachObjectAtPoint(allObjects + descendIntoAll + descendIntoAuxLists, WorldPt(0.0, 0.0), 100,  [&](MCObjectHandle h){

    TXString tx;

     tx.itoa(gSDK->GetObjectTypeN(h));

      gSDK->AlertInform("ObjTypeNum =  ", tx);

   *return* *true*;  // continue

});

  		Rick Berge

VB-170128

Sheet Layer Section Viewport Wall Component Class Overrides not sticking

Sheet Layer Section Viewport Wall Component Class Overrides do not automatically update when the VP is updated. 

Observe the attached SLVP-WallComp.vwx file. 

Generic WallStyle-1 has been created with 4 components. Each component is set to use the attributes of a unique Class. 

In the Sheet Layer Section Viewport, override the attributes (eg; pen colour and thickness). 

Observe the attributes do not change even upon updating the Viewport. 

[Workaround: In the Navigation Palette, select Class None and edit. Do not make any changes. Click OK. Notice this triggers the VP to require an update. Update the VP. Observe the VP Class Overrides will now stick.]

  		Christopher Graye
VB-168494

When Browsing to Files in 2020, Clicking on File Names Activates Text Editing

I've attached a movie and test file that show this. The file contains two simple VWX files.

To reproduce:

-Open "Main File.vwx"
-Run the Project Sharing command to convert the file to a Project File
-In the Resource Manager, browse to the attached folder
-Click on the "Resource Source.vwx" file

Note that this causes the file name to enter text editing mode (it should just get highlighted).

It looks like the process of converting a file to a PF is triggering this somehow. If the file is already a VWXP when you open it, the problem won't occur.

This is a regression from VW 2019. The same thing happens going back to 2020 SP0.

This only affects Mac. 		Ian Lane
VB-170900

Cloud processing loses Dropbox Connection

I just had an oddity when attempting to export a Panorama, I was prompted to save the file, navigated to the Dropbox folder where the VWX file lives. I then received a message that the folder had to be on Dropbox. I did this several times. Then I went and 'reconnected' Dropbox to VCS (I had not disconnected the relationship) and then it worked fine.

  		Lyuben Hadzhipopov
VB-169159

Site Model: Existing and Proposed Modifiers don't give desired result.

Hello

I hope you are all coping with working from home and that you and your family are well.

I have been looking at the use of existing and proposed modifiers on a site model, with a customer.

Existing site modifiers in isolation do a great job. They add features to a site without affecting the cut and fill. However, if the customer wishes to add a proposed modifier, that touches or overlaps a site modifier for the existing site, it does not give the desired results.

I've attached an example which clearly demonstrates this. The modifiers are separated on different design layers, and the model is set to be updated by visible layers only. So, you can turn on the different modifier layers and see the problem.

Of course, the workaround is to place the existing modifiers into the site model source data. However, they must be ungrouped, and then other source data needs to be edited. I've attached an example of this method too.

I am not sure if this is something that can be fixed, or if it's something that we will have to live with, hence I've filed as a bug. Please give me a shout if you would like to discuss... at my desk!

Stay safe. 		Bozhidar Stanchev
VB-170275

Chamfer Object Cannot Be Split Vertically. (PR8449251)

-Open the attached file.
-Notice the 5 objects, the first 3 objects from left to right illustrate how the last object (Chamfer was created).
-First from left, a simple extrude from a Polygon object.
-Second from left, a an extrude that was modified using the Deform Tool (4th mode Bulge Solid), turning into a generic sold.
-Third from left, a shell object using Shell Command.
-Fourth from left, a fillet object (multiple fillet operations on the edges of a shell object)
-Fifth from left, a chamfer object (multiple chamfer operation on the edges of a shell object.)

When you try to split vertically(3rd mode line trim mode) the first four objects will work.
The the fifth one (chamfer will fail) 		Josh Loy

VB-170691

Floating Data Bar not correct after use of multiple view panes

* When you (for example) want to draw a wall with the rectangle mode, you will see deltaX and Y (correctly).
* When you then activate multiple views and do the same action in a (for example) isometric view, the floating data bar will show L and A (and not deltaX and deltaY).
* When you then go back to plan view and do the same action, the floating data bar will still show L and A and not deltaX an deltaY 		Josh Loy

VB-169470

Section Viewport: navigation graphics defective display

There are two videos attached that show the different behaviors being reproduced.

Video 1
1. Make sure that Navigation Graphics is Good Performance and Compatibility
2. Open the attached .vwx
3. Section Viewport ANS West/WP 300 should be selected
4. Update the Section Viewport
- Section Viewport will become empty, only with the red lines remaining.
5. Go to Vectorworks Preferences and switch to Best Performance
6. Update again the Section Viewport
- Objects will be again correctly displayed.

Video 2
1. Navigation Graphics should be Best Performance
2. Open the attached .vwx
3. Section Viewport ANS West/WP 300 should be selected
4. Update the Section Viewport
- Section Viewport objects will still be displayed, but with the red lines.
5. Go to Vectorworks Preferences and switch to Good Performance and Compatibility
- The objects have disappeared
6. Update the Section Viewport again
- Objects will be again correctly displayed and without the red lines. 		Rick Berge
VB-170043

Symbol Causes Referenced DLVP Bounding Box Error in VW 2021

The attached file set contains two files; a source file with several Walls and an in-Wall 3D Symbol, and a target file where the source file has been referenced through a DLVP.

To reproduce, open the target file in VW 2020 and VW 2021.

Note that the DLVP's bounding box matches the contents' size in 2020, but in 2021 the bounding box is much larger (see attached screenshots).

It looks like the bounding issue it being caused by the "Sardis Window" 3D symbol in the source file. The problem only happens when that symbol is placed inside the wall.

I don't see this problem with non-referenced DLVPs. 		Rick Berge
VB-168990

Question- Information on Vectorworks causing problems with the Ice Lake CPU.

Here's what we know about problems with Ice Lake CPUs:
 -Fixed an issue where Vectorworks crashed on VW2019SP6 and VW2020SP2 and could not start. (VB-166316)
 -In our customer inquiry record, there are several cases where VW2018 crashed and could not be started, and we recognize that there is a problem.
 -According to information from our customers, there is a case where VW2017 started without crashing.
 
However, we do not know formal information about whether there is a problem with each version of Vectorworks.
 
So we have a question.
Is there any information on whether there is a problem with the Ice Lake CPU for each version of Vectorworks?
We want to share that information with our customers.
 
{color:#172b4d}Best regards,{color}
{color:#172b4d} Takaaki Mizuno{color}
{color:#172b4d} A&A{color} 		Walid Remaili
VB-170237

VS-Any error on a Plug-in Command causes a fault OIP behaviour

Please install the Command "Kill My OIP".

It contains following lines of code, which are wrong, causing thus an error during execution.

The error in this case will raise an alert, after the alert (wether you open the alert dialog or esc-it without opening) the document is faulty in building the OIP and cannot be restored but closing and re-opening the document. In more complex cases you won't have the alert, but the fault OIP will occur nevertheless.

Tested on VW 2019 and 2020.

Please see the movie.

 

 
{code:java}
PROCEDURE Test;
BEGIN
AlrtDialog('Hey') : { <-- The colon ist wrong, should be semi-colon }
END;
Run(Test);
{code}
  		Vladislav Stanev

VB-169297

T02101 ConnectCAD: ConnectCAD tools remember their toolbar settings in a session

Open a document and set pannel name and port name of the connector pannel.

Create a new document.

Notice that the Pannel name and the port name of the connector panel are remembered in the new document. Pannels and ports are cleared after restart of VW. The same behavior has toolbar settings of Distribution panel, Jackfield, Term panel, Socket, Socket loop and Linked Jackfield. Port of the tools continues to increment in the new document.

CMP: Please fix Connector Panel tool to load existing CTP devices in the document as options in the tools Panel modebar popup. 		Conrad Preen
VB-167691

Graphics Modernization: smooth lines missing

The "quick and easy" smooth lines from OpenGL are no longer available. This means that workflows that counted on this look aliased. In particular, section edit-in-place (HL) and VGM pseudo-hidden line used it to look much nicer. Also selection indication via the VGM dynamic object API. Justin Hutchison

VB-169163

Progress Bar Cancel Button not always working

When running a Progressbar on OSX, it it luck if the Cancel button is taken into account.
So sometimes when you click it will cancel, but sometimes not.

https://developer.vectorworks.net/index.php/VS:Progress_Dialog

hasCanceled = False

def TestProgressDlg():
global hasCanceled

def DoHalfTheWork():
global hasCanceled

kWORK = 26

# we do 50% of the work in kWORK loops/calls to yield
vs.ProgressDlgStart( 50.0, kWORK )

i = 1;
while (i <= kWORK) and (not hasCanceled):
vs.Wait( 1 ) # well, we work by waiting

vs.ProgressDlgYield( 1 )
hasCanceled = vs.ProgressDlgHasCancel()

i = i + 1

vs.ProgressDlgEnd()


vs.ProgressDlgOpen( "I'm about to do some heavy work", True )
vs.ProgressDlgSetTopMsg( 'Top message to inform about something' )
vs.ProgressDlgSetBotMsg( 'Bottom message to force the information in' )

vs.ProgressDlgSetMeter( 'Doing the first half of the work...' )
DoHalfTheWork()

vs.ProgressDlgSetMeter( 'Doing the SECOND half...' )
DoHalfTheWork()

vs.ProgressDlgClose()

TestProgressDlg() 		Ian Lane

# Open the attached file
# With the curved wall selected, select View > Create Section Viewport...

# Change the create on Layer to a new design layer, and give the design layer a name

VB-169265

NBL door styles don't show up in design layer viewports in Top/Plan

See attached file and movie
In Design layer 1 on left has set of walls and few doors and styles inserted in to wall
On the right is DLVP created in design layer 2.
Note that NBL door styles are not showing up in the viewport in top plan. 3D view is fine
Switch to sheet layer in the same file you will see the styles show fine.
Looks like the problem is the custom door related classes are turned off in DLVP by default. I am not sure this is intended behavior though I believe it is a bug?

Christopher Graye
VB-169217

Python script exported from drawing containing a tile cannot be imported without error.

Python script exported from drawing containing a tile cannot be imported without error.
# Create a drawing with a tile resource.
# Select the menu, File > Export > Export Script...
# In the displayed dialog, change the "Save as type" dropdown to "Python Script (*.py)" and click Save.
# Create a new second drawing document.
# Select the menu, File > Import > Import Script...
# In the displayed dialog, select the exported python file and click OK.
# NOTE: the script error dialog is displayed. Click View Error Output... to see errors. 		Vladislav Stanev
VB-169178

Flat-section-of-section: Section viewport on design layer shows a copy of the viewport geometry seperately

VB-169144

Loft Surface: deformed result

To reproduce the problem, do the following steps:

1. Activate the Loft Surface Tool

2. Select the first 4 NURBS like shown in the video, from left to right and press enter or on the green checkmark to complete the operation.

3. The Loft Creation menu will open.
3.1. First curve Reverse direction to the right. click next
3.2. Second curve is already to the right. click next
3.3. Third curve is already to the right. click next
3.4. Fourth curve Rever direction to the right.
3.5. See that Select Alignment by Point or by Percentage cant be changed.
3.6. Activate "Create Solid"
3.7 Click OK to close Dialog and complete the operation.
3.8 You should get a result like seen in the S01.png. Which isn't a Solid.

4. Now, please go to File and Revert to Saved.
4.1. Do the same steps, but this time with as many NURBS as possible. Seems to exist a limit of 13 NURBS. There are 15 NURBS total in the drawing.
4.2. Make sure that all NURBS have the same direction and Create Solid selected.
4.3. Again "Select Alignment by Point" (or by Percentage) isn't possible to be used.
4.4. You should get a result like seen in the S003.png.

Important: The NURBS were created from a Subdivision, with the Create Contours Tool. Compare S003.png and S004.png to see the difference.

S003.png shows the NURBS result.
S004.png shows the Subdivision object from where the NURBS originated.
S005.png you can see all objects and compare the differences aswel. 		Josh Loy
VB-168911

Migration Manager (process) corrupts Workspaces

In my role providing Tech Support for our users, I've encountered quite a number of users who's issues were particular to workspaces that had been migrated from a prior version. I've encountered this issue where workspaces had been migrated from the previous version and none before that, and other instances where workspaces had been migrated through multiple versions but not shown symptoms until migrating to 2020. 

This problem was occurring in prior versions too but seems to have become more prevalent when migrating to Vectorworks 2020. 

I would like to submit enough data for you to verify the problem, attribute cause and fix it. 

*What data do you need to do this?*  		Ian Lane
VB-168924

Subdivision Snapping Fails in Some Cases Until File is Close/Reopened

I've attached a movie and test file, containing several Subdivisions, that show this.

To reproduce:

-Activate the Edit Subdivision tool in Translate and Rotate Mode, and select an object
-Move its vertices as shown
-Now select an adjacent object and try to move its vertices so that they snap to the previously-moved vertices

Note that the snapping fails.

-Now save the file, then close and reopen it
-Attempt to move and snap to the same vertices as before

Note that now it works fine.

The same thing happened in VW 2019. 		Josh Loy

VB-167478

Push/Pull Tool doesn't work with specific file

Note: The attached video shows the problem being reproduced.

1. Open the attached file and use the Push/Pull Tool on the already selected rectangle. It will not work.

2. Copy that same rectangle to a new blank document and use the Push/Pull Tool. It will now function.

3. If we copy the rectangle that was copied to the new file back to the original file. It will also be possible to use the Push/Pull Tool.

Nevertheless, it is not possible to use the Push/Pull Tool in the Client file.

VB-167496

Vectorworks gets stuck on Save panorama JPEG file

Steps to reproduce:
- Open the attached test file in Vectorworks
- Go to File -> Export -> Panorama
- Set the render settings to the ones shown on the attached screenshot
- Choose a destination for the output image and click Save
- Open the destination folder and notice that the placeholder OpenGL image appears shortly afterward, but Vectorworks remains stuck on the Save panorama JPEG file dialog (Mac). On Windows, I don't see the Save panorama JPEG file dialog at all, but Vectorworks remains stuck not making any rendering progress. If I just start rendering the view in Vectorworks in the same render mode, I am seeing progress as expected. I realize that the Panorama rendering is much more intensive than the rendering of the view, but I wanted to submit this for further checks just in case. I am able to submit cloud rendering jobs with the same render settings and the job progresses as expected, so I suspect that there may be resources limitation on both of my computers, but there is a chance that there may be an issue with the actual process of starting the rendering locally.
Justin Hutchison

VB-173354

sanitizer read overflow in SetSameVisibilityToAllRoofGableWalls

SetSameVisibilityToAllRoofGableWalls is using a `short` to populate a tagged data kUint32ArrayID, causing us to read random memory for the top half.

Similar problems in neighboring code, too, using the same pattern.

  		Christopher Graye
VB-172128

Column in Wall not working from 2018 to 2021(b3)

So far I have not found a way to get the Column into the Wall working in Vectorworks 2018, 2019 or 2021 respectively, but I now know how to get failure and success on purpose in Vectorworks 2020 (SP4).

The short of it:
The bug: you cannot insert the column into a wall.
Vectorworks (2020) is affected by this bug, if you attempt to pull a Column into a Wall +within the default start document+ _before_ doing the same in a file you saved in a prior session.

 

To fully understand the scope of the bug, *four runs of opening and closing Vectorworks* are needed:


1st run
 * start 2020
 * draw a wall, insert a column into the document, pull the column onto the wall
--> the column will not go into the wall and the wall doesn't show the red indicator that it's possible. :( FAILURE no. 1
* save file as "not working", quit 2020

2nd run
 * start 2020
 * close start document
 * open file "not working"
 * pull column onto wall
--> it works. :) SUCCESS no. 1
 * save file as "working", quit 2020

3rd run
 * start 2020
 * draw a wall, insert a column into the document, pull the column onto the wall
--> as we expect: it doesn't work. But wait, we now have a working file, right?
 * open file "working"
 * pull column onto wall
--> it doesn't work. :( FAILURE no. 2
 * quit 2020

4th and last run
 * start 2020
 * close the starting document
 * open file "not working"
 * pull column onto wall
--> it works!
 * open new file "blank"
 * draw wall, insert column, pull column onto wall
--> it works :) SUCCESS no. 2

At first I thought it had to do with the user folder, but it doesn't look that way. Whether it's a German or US version doesn matter either and neither does whether you use styles or not.

Please watch the attached video where I go through all the runs in quick succession.

Food for thought:
In conclusion - insofar the column seems to be working better in 2020 SP4 compared to 2021 b3, this might actually be considered a regression bug. 		Christopher Graye
VB-175664

Truss Missing 3d Geometry

The customer has sent me a file where anytime a truss is placed or rotated vertically the 3d geometry disappears. This is happening in a new blank file with Christie Truss Kevin Linzey

VB-168045

GDTF is still patchable via the Patch Window

It was decided that for SP3, no GDTF should be patchable inside of Vision. This is in part due to Vision's UI/UX and in part due to the way GDTF was implemented. It will not be possible to ship GDTF patching for SP3.

However, while the Properties Window is now correctly read-only for Universe and Channel, GDTF fixtures are still showing up in the Patch Window and therefore are still patchable. 		Kevin Linzey

VB-167861

SBE: LB direct editing: CGSMenuItemValue loses id (fMenuItemId) and can't be identified

I added several menu items to an LB cell in the list browser's EListBrowserDirectEditType::QueryItemListRetrieval handler like this:

int i = 1;

while (!done) {

BOOL ok2 = true;

gSDK->GetVWResourceString(s,str_popup,TXString::ToStringInt(i),EEmptyHandling::eAllowEmptyResult);

ok2 = (!s.IsEmpty());


if (!ok2) {
done = true;
} else {
CGSMenuItemValue item( s, i-1 );
item.SetCheckedState((i-1) == val);
item.fMenuItemId = i-1;
c->AddMenuItem(item);
}

i++;

} // *** while ***


When ItemEditCompletionData handler is called after selecting a menu item,

I call

auto& sceb = eventArgs.GetCellMenuItemValue();

Now sceb.fMenuItemId is 0 for all menu items I chose (and fMenuItemIdStr contains garbage which also looks rather suspect). Somehow Vectorworks loses the ID value or doesn't pass it correctly. This means that the plug-in can not identify which menu item was selected and the menu is useless.

eventArgs.GetCellMenuItemValue() should of course return a CGSMenuItemValue that has the same ID the menu item had when it was created. 		Payne Chang
VB-171885

Braceworks Libraries thumbs do not display correctly in the Resource Manager

Hello,
This relates to:

Vectorworks Enhancement RequestsVE-100654
Spotlight Truss libraries have to have rendered thumbs and previews without simplified box obscuring

I opened the enclosed library file and seeing no symbols on the page selected all the symbols in the Resource Manager in one of the thumbnail viewing modes and changed them all to right isometric.

+3 observations:+
1. Wireframe shows corners correctly with no 'simplified' outer.
2. Hidden Line render show some with the 'Simplified' outer *and* others not.
3. OpenGL shows *all *of them with rendered with the 'Simplified' outer drawn.

So there is an inconsistency as to how they are displayed whether wireframe, HLR or OpenGL.

I label this 'high' because users are now forced to go to the manufacturers website look at a catalogue and work out what symbol to use. Not nearly as easy as looking at a thumbnail and seeing the correct corner straight away.

Snapshots and file enclosed.

Cheers,
Peter 		Kevin Linzey

VB-170995

Sketch Acceptance Test: OIP Render Tab Display Dependent on Order Objects are Selected

What is displayed in the Render tab of the Object Info Palette (OIP) when heterogeneous objects are selected is dependent on the order in which the objects were selected. What is displayed in the Render tab of the OIP when heterogeneous objects are selected should only be dependent on which objects are selected and not the order in which they were selected.

Please watch the attached video for an example of this issue. The file shown in the video is also attached.  		Rick Berge
VB-172173

T02122 - Users cannot undo an accidental "Auto-Color" button press.

If a user accidentally clicks that button, they must cancel out of the dialog to preserve their old settings. This would mean that all changes they had made since opening the dialog on that occasion would be lost.

It would be much better if users could undo that button press. (Or if values are set to different custom values, an "Are you sure?" dialog would also be welcomed. 		Rick Berge

VB-174769

Callout error message is incorrect when trying to adjust keynote legend controlled setting

As seen in the attached video and file, when a callout is placed as a keynote and then the user tries to switch off the callouts'  "auto fit bubble width" option in the OIP, the resulting error is incorrect. The error produced refers to the Bubble *Shadow* Settings (which also cannot be switched on/off) but the error should read "Bubble *Width* Settings cannot be changed..."

VB-175290

Spotlight Cable Tools preview - unsafe adaptor options

Exploring the new Cable Tools I noticed that the user can select options that if they ever became reality would be potentially lethal. I'm talking about cases such as Schuko -> Stereo Jack for example. An adapter like this would result in 220v AC exposed on the bare metal of the audio plug.

You might say no-one in their right mind would ever do this. But Murphy's Law deserves our respect. I'm as uncomfortable seeing this as an option in Vectorworks as I would be seeing an adapter like that in real life. 		Kevin Linzey

VB-174964

Landscape area: Edit Components with multiple selection.

When working on multiple selection:

- Edit Components dialog shows the components of the first selected object.
Note that it is the first selected and not the selected which is ahead on the document list (compare to the multiple selection component editing for walls, slabs and hardscapes).

- Changes from Edit Components dialog are applied only on the first selected landscape area.

VB-175679

Ungrouping a Landscape Area without 2D Plants Visible causes a Second Stray Line with Record Data

Please see the attached example file. The file is from 2019/2020, but the same issue occurs in a new file in 2021 (SP2).

 

1) Draw a Landscape Area and apply a plant to it.

2) Make sure "Show Plants 2D" is unchecked.

3) Ungroup the Landscape Area.

 

When you do this, it looks like it works perfectly up front to continue going as the resulting polygon has the record data still applied so it will still work with your schedules and such. Unfortunately, the ungrouping actually generates a very small Line/polygon that also has the data attached which results in problems with your worksheets. 		Bozhidar Stanchev

VB-171181

Existing Tree Tool: Root zones and TPZ can only be changed by class not by colour in the 2D properties dialogue

Hello,
Place an Existing Tree object on the page and show both root zones and the TPZ.
Click the 2D Properties in the OIP and change the colour for these 3 things. Note that only the line thickness and type is changed but the colour goes to black each time.
The only way to do it is via class.

File and movie enc.

Cheers,
Peter 		Bozhidar Stanchev
VB-167676

Existing Tree List browsing

Hitting a letter key doesn't select the available tree in the list.

See attached screencast 		Bozhidar Stanchev
VB-168530

KLS: Foliage - Default Value seem to be Millimeters

Hi there,

the default values, especially the height, seem to be millimeters. So, when creatimg e.g. a hedge in a document with document units meters, then the height suddenly is 2000 meters. When doing the same in a document with document unit millimeters, then the height is 2000 millimeters which is 2 meters which is correct.

This is low priority. We do have customers which are complaining from time to time. I guess this can be fixed easily.

Please see video. 		Bozhidar Stanchev
VB-169003

ALA: Marionette Object Node - geometry/position change after altering network

After changing a random Node name and exiting the Marionette Network, the geometry and position of objects within the Object Node are distorted and can only regained by changing the value present in the OIP.

 

Steps to reproduce (see video):

1) open file & take a look at the Festoon Strings
2) double-click the object to get to the network
3) change the name of any node & exit script

4) see, how geometry and object position are distorted

Current workaround: change any value in the OIP -> the Object Node will reset itself and show the corrent geometry and palcement.

 

[~sbarrett2]
[~mfarrell2] 		Konstantin Lalkovski
VB-170025

Title Block Border - The manager does not open via properties

# Create a TBB
# Right-click - Properties...
# Click on Title Block Border Manager - it won't open *
# Close the dialog - the manager will open automatically

* also, in debug: VerifyValidHandle failed because the controllers tries to update the object (OnWidgetChanged activated) 		Nikolay Zhelyazkov
VB-169146

ALA: Marionette Rotate Node Description (or Script) Wrong (Input: vAng)

The description of the Port-In vAng says:
(a) "It could be a 2D/3D rotation vector or Point2/Point3 in the Input category."
and
(b) "Angles are in degrees"

(A) With either 2D vector or 2D point there will always be an error message, because the third component "r[2]" of the vector is used in lines 48 and 50.
Also: for planar objects the first two components are never used.
(B) Given that the user has to supply a vector, merely writing "Angles are in degrees" is not sufficient to explain what is happening and causes more confusion than necessary.

I suggest removing the 2D parts from the description and adding information, that explains how the vector-components are used for the rotation (in angles).

 

[~mfarrell2] 		Konstantin Lalkovski
VB-171579

Marionette: Changing the default text font results in the font on nodes changing as well

By default Marionette Nodes have a couple different text objects with certain sizes and Arial as default font. After changing the default font to something other than Arial creating or moving Marionette Nodes will result in the text objects on the node using this new font instead of Arial.

Just as changing the default text size doesn't change the Marionette Nodes' texts, changing the default text font shouldn't change the Marionette Nodes' texts.

To reproduce:
1) open new file
2) insert a Marionette Node
3) Text > Font > choose a font other than Arial
4) move the Marionette Node you inserted earlier
--> see that the font of the text objects on the node changed

Just as the default text size doesn't influence the appearance of Marionette Nodes, so shouldn't the default text font. (Inconsistency error)

I don't think this needs any more explaining, but here's a good reason the current behaviour is bad: if someone setup a Marionette network with many neatly arranged nodes, this would all become a mess when the font changes, since fonts don't all have the same properties (height, length, spacing).

When you change the default text properties and then move a text object you had created before, then this text object doesn't suddenly take on the new default values, now does it? 		Konstantin Lalkovski
VB-167401

Incorrect IFC opening by Wall Hole

Wall hole component in combination with the Wall export options as separate instances: the opening object in IFC does not create an opening and is located outside the wall. When the Export options is turned to no instances, the wallHole opening is correct. Mihail Rizov

It's not possible to select multiple DV to export them to a user or workgroup-folder. You have to export every DV single.

VB-169443

ConnectCAD: User Defined symbol should have a confirmation if no in or out are created

VB-167933

IFC entity functioning as container

Just wanted to confirm the function of the IFC entity. 

 

In the attached file, there are two IFC entities in the same class. 

The objects are using class attributes. 

As you can tell, the two objects are different colors. 

This is because the original extrude within the IFC entity is still using a different class. 

 

Essentially, should the overall IFC entity class apply to all internal objects as well or is this working as designed? 		Mihail Rizov
VB-173037

T02122 - Scaled symbols and dimension-related object functions

Scaled symbols do not work very well with visualizations that use a dimension-related object function (eg, area, perimeter, insertion pt). The values are calculated from the unscaled symdef, so DataVis does not respond to scaling of the symbol instance. This applies to overrides for the symbol instance itself, as well as its "children". Karthick Chilaka
VB-173052

Notes of Ungrouped dimensions can't be selected normally

Steps to Reproduce: 
# Draw a dimension
# Add a note to the dimension in the Object Info Palette 
# Ungroup the dimension
# Click to select the note - It won't select. But marquee select over or around the object and it will select. 

The behaviour can be observed before the dimension is ungrouped also. The note part of the dimension cannot be click-selected. 

See video. 

Also, [this post|https://forum.vectorworks.net/index.php?/topic/73745-dimension-note-text-not-selectable/] on the Vectorworks Forum reports it occurring in VW2019 SP6.  		Karthick Chilaka

VB-174772

Quick Search will Sometimes show the wrong keyboard shortcut for the tool the user is searching.

This is minor but worth noting.
Base on my testing, this will only happen when you intially start a new document and you use the tool for the first time in that document.

Steps to duplicate.
-Start a blank document
-Press the "F" keyboard shortcut to lunch quick search.
-Search the command "Lower Right Iso".
-The command is found but notice how it's showing the wrong keyboard shortcut.
-It's showing "Alt+1", the other command "Lower Left Is" the suggested keyboard shortcut is "0",
which is the command for Top/Plan view.
-After the first use the Quick Search, the wrong keyboard command will not show anymore. 		Ian Lane
VB-174752

Inconsistent appearance of Quick Search on Mac and Windows when it returns no result.

This is a minor Quick Search UI inconsistency found between Mac and PC.

+When the Search returns 0 result:+
* On Windows, *you only see the filters*: the browser and the search count are hidden. See attached image.
* On Mac, *you see all UI*: you get a blank browser and the search count says "0 items". See attached image.

I think Mac's behavior is preferred.

Any comments? 		Ian Lane

VB-169199

When changing the User Origin, the size of the Reference Grid changes between 2D View and 3D View.

--------------------------
Target environment
--------------------------
Win Mac
It occurs in v2020.
--------------------------
How to Reproduce
--------------------------

When changing the User Origin, the size of the Reference Grid changes between 2D View and 3D View.

Steps:
1) Check that the Reference Grid is set to X: 10 and Y: 10 in the SmartCursor Settings.
2) Switching between 2D View and 3D View does not change the grid size.
3) Mouse-click the User Origin anywhere.
4) When switching between 2D View and 3D View, the grid size changed X: 30, Y: 30 at 3D View.

We don't know this is bug or by design.

Please refer to "sample10682.vwx","movie10682.mov".

VB-169587

Creating Label Legends from rotated instruments using a Non-Rotating Label Legend causes labels to rotate

When making a label legend from a rotated instrument, if we're using a Non-Rotating Label Legend, the locations and positioning of the Labels may appear differently than where they're originally positioned.

This is a bit tricky to describe, so I've included a video with the process and a sample document displaying this behavior and the resulting label legends.

I would imagine this may be working by design, since it seems to be using the location of the labels as if the lighting instrument weren't rotated.  (This may also be an enhancement request to change the behavior, if it's working by design.)

This was reported by one of our users on a call, Peter Leonard (PeterL@uvu.edu). I'm including their information here so I can reach back out to them after this has been reviewed.

Thank you for your time, and have a great day! :) 		Kevin Linzey

VB-174792

PDF Page Crop is invisible in the editor (Best performance only)

To reproduce:

Import a pdf. Select the imported pdf page.

"Crop visible" should be unchecked in the pdf page properties.

Edit crop, draw a circle for example. It is selectable, but invisible.
Exit and all invisible, zoom out - visible, zoom in - invisible.
 
 
Check "Crop visible" in the pdf page properties.
Edit crop.
Now it is visible.
I don't think this setting should affect the editor 		Josh Loy

VB-173327

"Zoom Line Thickness" not working with Section Viewports

Create a Section Viewport on a Sheet Layer.

While looking at the Section Viewport, turn the "Zoom Line Thickness" button on and off. The geometry created by the section viewport does NOT respond to this setting; it always displays as though Zoom Line Thickness were off. All other viewports and geometry respond accordingly.

It's critical to be able to see true lineweights while working on sheet layers. 		Josh Loy
VB-174653

Splitting a Hidden-Line Rendered View Pane Results in the New View Pane Rendering Incorrectly

Splitting a Hidden-Line rendered View Pane results in the new View Pane rendering incorrectly. Panning or zooming in the new View Pane does not fix the rendering, but a View change or re-render of the View Pane does.

VB-172453

Symbol Edit Mode's Default View Shifts on Non-Zero Layer

Movie and test files are attached. The files are identical except on has a layer elevation of 0" and other has a layer elevation of 300'.

To reproduce:

-Open the "non-elevated" file
-Edit the 2D Component of the symbol

Note that the view gets centered on the symbol contents.

-Now open the "elevated" file and try the same thing

Note that now the view gets centered far away from the contents.

It looks like the distance that the view "shifts" matches the layer elevation (it shifts 300' on the Y-axis in this case).

This only happens when the symbol is edited in a 3D view. You can also see it by editing the 3D Component, switching to plan view, then choosing "Edit 2D Components" from the context menu.

The same thing happened in previous versions. 		Josh Loy
VB-173904

VB-173104

Viewport Opacity Issue

Hi Guys, 

We have a user who has been experiencing Viewport opacity issues. They have this set up by class styles. However, if they override this on the drawing to a number of lines, to change the opacity. This change doesn't come through to the viewport.

I have tested this in a new file and all seems to work as it should and the opacity comes through. I just can't seem to get this to work in the user file. 

Any ideas would be great. I am still trying to work this out but thought it would be great to get your thoughts too! 

Best Wishes

Helen

Please see the video and file from the user. 

Email from user:
Hi
 
I'm struggling with the opacity of some lines getting transferred through to the viewport. I'm not sure what the issue is.
 
I've changed the style of the lines from the class style of 100% to 25%. This would normally show in the viewport immediately but isn't. I can only do it by changing the class style in the viewport which I don't want to do because this will make all the lines in that class 25% opacity and I only want some of them to do this.
 
The viewport class settings also seem a little broken as it won't let me untick the box to unlink the pen and fill attributes without also changing the opacity to 25%.

Rie Ichimura 		Josh Loy
VB-172440

VectorScript: several Text Style variables not working

If I go by the Appendix of the Function Reference, there are 10 object variables, that can be set by using either
SetObjectVariableInt,
SetObjectVariableLongInt,
SetObjectVariableString or
SetObjectVariableBoolean

So far I have only gotten the Style Name to be set and the font size.

None of these though:
* Text Style Font Index
* Text Style Vert Spacing
* Text Style Style
* Horizontal Alignment
* Vertical Alignment

The Marionette script was provided by a customer. In order to control for Marionette bugs I rewrote the script as VectorScript, where I get the same results.

Also (goes for both the VS-Scipt and the Marionette Network):
To actually see the Style show up in the resource browser sfter running the script, you need to delete an object from the resource browser or change the folder within the resource browser.

Another strange thing is: The Marionette network puts out an object type 109 None. The Appendix does not list the "209". Why is it "None"?

 

Could the ID of the settings be different from what is written in the Appendix. 		Tim Connors

VB-175394

Found this while testing for Changelist 562177.  Created new LD parameters in the Spotlight Preferences, and noticed the Pop-up drop down didn't show correctly in the Accessory OIP (Lighting Device OIP is correct).  I included a video, these are the steps:
# In Spotlight Preferences, under Parameters, create a New LD Parameter
# Select 'Pop-up' as type and make a list of choices
# Click Ok
# Check the box to the right for 'Accessory'
# Click Ok
# Insert a Lighting Device
# Click 'Edit Accessory' and attach an Accessory
# With the Accessory selected, notice the new Pop-up parameter is in the OIP, but the drop down doesn't contain the list entered.

Other default drop downs seem to be working in the Accessory OIP and this doesn't seem to be an issue with the Lighting devices. 		Kevin Linzey

VB-174713

Placing Lighting Devices with Second Click on Wall Features Causes Issues

Please see my attached screen recording.

 

1) Create a wall.

2) Draw a rectangle next to the wall, and use Create Wall Projection to create a wall feature (like a bump out/column).

3) Select a lighting device with the Instrument Insertion Tool.

4) First click can go anywhere. Second click for pointing the light, click on the midpoint of your wall projection. The lighting device ends up a "lighting device in wall" object and the selection on it is completely wrong.

VB-174733

Tool modes jump around on the Previous Tool SOD on mouse click

VB-174734

Tool Mode SOD instantly disappear when a dropdown option is selected

This is a minor inconsistency found between Mac and PC.

On Windows, as soon as you select a dropdown option from the Tool Mode SOD (e.g., an option from the *Text Style* dropdown of the *Text tool*), the Tool Mode SOD will instantly disappear, regardless of the distance between your mouse and the SOD.

On Mac, the Tool Mode SOD will remain on screen, and will disappear instantly when you move your mouse (if you select an option far away from the SOD, e.g., "_Notes 10 pt_" in the dropdown). 

I feel the SOD should not be deactivated when a dropdown option is selected. Same for the Resource Selector dropdown: users might still need to go back and pick the tool modes they prefer.

Any comments? 		Ian Lane
VB-174306

Issue resizing Resource Manager in Tools on External Monitor

 

When I resize the Resource Manager window found in Tools like Speaker Array, Truss, Lighting Device, the image becomes distorted and gives a scaled down view of the window behind it (see video for better visual clarification).  This issue does not occur when resizing the actual Resource Manager palette.

This issue is only occurring when Vectorworks is on my external monitor, this does not occur when Vectorworks is on my laptop.

My current set up is a Dell Laptop (XPS 1509550) with an External Monitor (Dell P2715Q Color Profile).  I included snap shots of the display resolution, Laptop is Display 1 and External Monitor is Display 2.

  		Ian Lane
VB-173406

VW Highlight Color Bleeding through to Save As Dialog Box

In the attached screen shot notice that the folder pane of the Save As dialog box is highlighted green the same as the highlighted objects in the VW2021 window behind. If you move the dialog box the folders pane changes background as if transparent. VW2020 shows the same behavior.

 

Only the Folder pane shows this behavior. The rest of the window is opaque not translucent.

I could not find any other applications that use a Save As dialog box that is not pinned to the window, so I can't tell if this is Mac OS15.6 standard behavior or a VW anomaly. 		Ian Lane

VB-171080

Wrong information in Workspace Info Export (Navigation palet)

The command and tools script uses the output of the Workspace Info Export (Menu Debug/SystemTest Manager/Workspace Info Export) and creates a pdf of it.

In this output the Navigation palet is pointed out as Fundamentals. But a Fundamentals user doesn't have access to this palet. The information in the Workspace Info Export is wrong. This way, the information in the command and tools palet is also wrong.

 

Information List Menus.Win:

Standard Palettes-5 Navigation F, F: Window/Palettes, SDK Menu Item (Chunk) Foundation F: Ctrl+Shift+N, Standard Palettes-5 Navigation F, F: Window/Palettes, SDK Menu Item (Chunk) Foundation F: Ctrl+Shift+N, Standard Palettes-5 Navigation F, F: Document Context Menu/Palettes, SDK Menu Item (Chunk) Foundation F: Ctrl+Shift+N, 

 

I will add the Information List Menus.Win list with the wrong information. And a screenshot of the command and tools pdf. 		Ian Lane
VB-174700

[Win] Data field on Tool Modes SOD requires enter key to confirm value

To observe this behavior:

1. Start a blank file
2. Select the _Regular Polygon tool_, by default the _Number of sides_ should be 6.
3. On drawing area, activate Tool Modes SOD, modify _Number of sides_ data field to 3
4. Move mouse away from SOD, create the polygon in the drawing.
* Notice that on Windows, you end up with a hexagon.
* On Mac, you get a triangle.

It turns out on Windows, you need to *hit the enter key* to confirm the value on Step 3, so that a triangle will be created. Whereas on Mac, the value is confirmed without hitting the enter key.

I think we should make it consistent. I prefer Mac's behavior.
Any comments? 		Ian Lane
VB-168297

Org dialog box buttons do not always have the shortcut key underlined

In the attached video I bring up the Org dialog box by using the cntrl-shift "O" shortcut.  If you look closely, you will see that every other time I do this, that the hot key is not underlined for the menu button.  Then I switch to using the icons to bring up the org dialog box, and now the hotkey is not underlined at all.  This is very inconsistent, the behavior will come and go.  Once I press the alt key the underlines will come back if they are not present. Ian Lane

VB-175869

Vectorworks client cannot automatically find VW2021 Site Protection Server for Mac when logging in.

Vectorworks client cannot automatically find VW2021 Site Protection Server for Mac when logging in.
* VW2021 Site Protection Server for Mac specific.

Reproduction procedure:
1) Start VW2021 Site Protection Server for Mac.
* RLM software version: v14.0 (build: 2)
* vektorwrx software version: v14.0 (build: 2)
[Reproduced server OS]
Big Sur / Catalina / Mojave / High Sierra

2) Start the Vectorworks client, check "Automatically find servers" in the Login Settings dialog box, and click "Login".

3) VW2021 Site Protection Server for Mac is not automatically detected and you cannot log in.
[Reproduced client]
OS: Windows / Mac
Vectorworks: VW2021 / VW2020 / VW2019 / VW2018
* No matter how many times we tried, the client couldn't find the server automatically.
* It was useless even if the firewalls of the server and client were disabled respectively.

Postscript:
Currently, the version of VW2021 Site Protection Server for Windows is v12.2 (build: 2) and it is automatically found, but when it is updated to v14.0 or higher, it cannot be found automatically?
We are worried about that too.

Best regards,
Takaaki Mizuno

VB-172582

Pen Opacity doesn't uncheck by-class setting when custom value entered

Using the flyout at the bottom of the Attributes Palette, choose the "Make all attributes by class" option. Then draw a 2D shape such as a Line. Click on the opacity settings button in the Attributes palette. When you type in a value for Pen Opacity, it does not automatically uncheck the "Use Class Pen Opacity" button. It should.

If it were a shape with a fill, such as a Rectangle, when you enter a custom Fill Opacity, the "Use Class Fill Opacity" button DOES uncheck itself, so it's only the Pen Opacity checkbox that isn't working correctly.

Checking in older versions, this bug did not exist in VW2018, but does exist in 2019, 2020, and 2021 Beta 4. 		Josh Loy

-Notice the operation seems slightly slow. Note this Auto - hybrid was created from a simple 30' extrude 		Christopher Graye
VB-171342

Subtracting Extrude from Drape Surface

Take a circle extrude it by about 10" with a 6" radius, then convert it to a drape surface with the number of points set to 100 for U & V and 1" for the plane Z value. Now take a rectangle making it larger than the circle and extrude it about half the height of the drape surface, and then solid subtract the extrude from the drape cutting the bottom of the drape surface off. 

 

It doesn't subtract the bottom of the drape surface 		Charlene Mao

VB-175353

Flyover Tool's View Center Mode Behaves Incorrectly in Rotated 3D Views

Movie and test file are attached. The file contains a few objects and has a modified user origin.

To reproduce:

-Toggle the button in the mode bar to enable Working Plane Views
-Switch to a Front view
-Now activate the Flyover tool in View Center Mode and do a few flyovers

Note that the view rotation gets centered on the objects, as expected.

-Now switch to Top/Plan
-Rotate the plan as shown
-Again switch to Front view (which will now be a "rotated 3D view") and then do some flyover operations

Note that now the rotation gets centered on some point in-between the objects and the origin (where the temporary Working Plane exists), making it hard to keep the objects in-view.

This only happens when the file has a modified user origin.

The same thing happened in past versions.

This may be related to the bug reported in VB-138866, where switching from Top/Plan to Top view in similar situations also causes centering issues. 		Josh Loy
VB-174724

the position of a lighting device is changing, when to my understanding position should not be affected by this command. 		Kevin Linzey
VB-170379

Unfold Surface is inaccurate

Hi Vectorworks

The command "Unfold Surface" is inaccurate. In the attached file you see, that the value 2 is pretty precise. We think that this precision is enough for production.

But the value 1 is for the production industrie (f.ex. wood work or exhibition industry) not precise enough.

Best regards, Marc 		Justin Hutchison

# After you have created the basic shape (a rectangle) press esc
** _Notice the tool is still active_
# Without finishing the tool, select the selection tool

VB-174176

Column Story Bounds Can't be Changed When 0" Height Would be Result, Alert Doesn't Show

Movie and test file are attached. The file contains a Column with story-bound Architectural and Structural components.

To reproduce:

-Change the Structural Top Bound to "Layer Elevation"
-Now try to manually change the Structural Height from 2" to 0"

Note that you get an alert saying the Structural Height must be greater than 0".

-Now try to change the Structural Bottom Bound to "Layer Elevation"

Note that now it just fails with no alert. Technically the reason this is failing is because the change would result in a 0" structural height, so all the user needs to do is enter any top/bottom offset before changing the bounds. Without the alert though it's not really obvious what the problem is, so it feels like a bug.

The same thing happened in past versions. 		Christopher Graye
VB-175041

Enscape disconnects when multiview is turned on and off

This might be necessary but they are asking us to check if it is necessary.  If we don't do anything about it the user has to press the connect button again when switching between MV and non-MV.

 

If when going from single pane to MV the focused pane is still the same as the single view, then we don't really need to separate.  We could either not disconnect or maybe automatically reconnect.

 

If when going from MV to single pane the focused view becomes the single pane then for that case too we could stay connected.  If instead the single pane becomes not the focused pane but instead say always the upper-right pane then we would need to disconnect.

 

I guess this is because of scene IDs and it is OK if we have to do this but would be better if it could be avoided.

  		Justin Hutchison

VB-169680

Footcandle measurements with a Photometric Grid differ from Dialux in User's File

A user is getting different Footcandle readings when using the Photometric Grid tool in Vectorworks compared to what they see in Dialux.

When looking in the "House Light Compare LS Mini 81 - JMR Compared" VWX file, the light is about 29'9.5" from the Photometer. The Photometer reads 3.52 FC. Based on the Mini-Pendant 2019-08-14 2 Page.pdf, that should be about correct (I believe).

When using a Photometric Grid in the "Mariners Church House Lights_LS Mini Replacement" VWX file, Vectorworks will display some points being above 60 FC, but the report from Dialux (Mariners Church, Irvine CA - Photometric Report 1 for 1 Mini Pendant.pdf) seems to show that none of the Photometers go past 40.

I don't know of any way to check these calculations, and would like to know which measurements are accurate. Any assistance is appreciated.

This was sent to us by user Jonathan Ramage (ramage.jon@gmail.com), and I was hoping to send feedback his way for an update.

Thanks for your time, and have a great day! :) 		Kevin Linzey

VB-175783

Animation Path: Adding points doesn't update frames in plan.

See attached video. If you have an Animation Path with "Display Frames" checked and then use the Reshape tool to add a point to the path, the frames do not update to the new path. Even unchecking and re-checking "Display Frames" does not make them update.

You have to click "Play" and then un-check and re-check "Display Frames" in order to make then show up properly.

This Animation Path was created using the Saved Views method. Haven't tested with other types... 		Josh Loy
VB-175009

Wrong crop line when using a Line Type (Best performance)

Please, use the attached file.

Note the wrong crop line (big outer Rounded rectangle), please, see the picture. It disappears while zooming and moves to the place it should be inside borders of the viewport.

Seems it is caused by the fact the crop is using a double line as the Pen.

Select the blue viewport, edit crop, change the crop's pen to Solid.

Exit. Extra rectangle is not there anymore.

Steps to create this sheet layer.
-I create a sheet layer (Cover_View_1) that had an original 8.5X11 page size.
-Once the sheet layer was created, I created a sheet layer viewport. Since the default viewport
was larger than the page size.
-I change the page size (drawing area) to ASME D through the page Setup.
-In addition to this I added the a Title Block that is ASME D base and unstyled it.
-I also adjusted the crop of the viewport then change the scale to 1:100 so the house and DTM
can be seen inside the viewport.
-Notice when I change the Projection of the Viewport to perspective through the Object Info
Palette, the viewport crop will change to almost it's original page size of 8.5 X 11.

VB-171357

Japanese Text disappearing on next click of text tool

While testing VB-139865, I needed to type Japanese text to recreate the bug since the files provided were beta versions.  I noticed this issue on Windows ONLY.

 

+*NOTE: Windows needs to be set to Japanese Region and typing Japanese text*+

(Video provided by Walid to show how this is done)

 

- Select the Text Tool and type some text

- With the Text Tool still active click again to start a new text box

- Noticed the first text box has disappeared, orange highlight can be seen when hovered over it

- Create a third text box and the first text box will reappear while the second will disappear.

 

This issue does not occur when typing English text while Windows is set to Japanese Region.

The text box will not disappear if the selection tool is activated after creating the text box.

  		Josh Loy
VB-169025

Creating 4k Movie With Animation Path will cause Vectorworks to run out of memory (Mac Only).

This is a Mac only issue, I’m not sure if there is anything we can do but it’s worth mentioning.

-Open the attached file
-Select the Animation Path.
-In the Object Info Palette (it takes a while to calculate: VB-VB-168828).
-When it’s finished calculating, click “Create Movie”, with the movies set
the following settings

>Duration 5 seconds (default)
>Frames per seconds = 20 (default)
>Quality = High
>Time Range = “Full Duration”
>Frame Size = 3840X2160: 4K UHDTV

Or see attached screen shot.

VB-175175

When HogNet is selected but no DMX is present, Vision renders random dmx data

I'm not sure if there is anything we can do about this or not. I'm not even sure what steps are required to reproduce. However, [~jwoodward] seemed to be able to confirm what I saw in a customer screenshare; which is that this is an issue.

Perhaps, we have a timeout in HogNet or maybe it's a simple bug and HogNet just needs to initialize/memset it's memory to zero. Hard to say until we investigate more.

A Windows PC and some Hog console (hardware/software) capable of sending HogNet will be required for the testing/implementation of this bug/fix. 		Kevin Linzey
VB-174946

Sketch Render Mode: Hatch in floor sketches when floor is set to 'No Sketch' render

In the attached file I have a couple of floor objects to which a hatch has been applied. Even though I have selected the option not to sketch even in sketch modes for these floors, the hatch still shows the sketch style.

If an object is assigned a specific sketch style (or non), all components of that object should behave that way. Moreover, sketching a hatch can lead to very slow screen redraws, and we need a way to override the sketch of a hatch. How else if not with the object being hatched? 		Josh Loy

VB-174249

Push/Pull Mode of 2D Tools shouldn't be enabled when editing Extrudes

Draw a 2D shape. Extrude it. Go into 3D view. Edit the contents of the extrude (so you're seeing the 2D profile in a 3D view). Draw a new 2D shape. Push/Pull Mode and Combine Mode are both available even though the Extrude can't contain 3D objects. The red highlighting is confusing so these modes should be disabled when in Extrude containers (and similar situations where only 2D objects can exist).

Video attached.

(Yes it's possible to just turn the mode buttons off, but the possibility to Push/Pull in this context shouldn't even exist.) 		Josh Loy

Tried the same with the other of the 2 crops and it seemed to delete properly and stay deleted.

Tried deleting the first crop which had reappeared and nothing happened when clicking the delete crop button. 		Kevin Linzey

VB-172876

SOD: On-Demand Palette Style Needs to be updated on the Mac

Currently on Mac, the two quick access buttons are set on an attached "ear" palette of an ODP as shown in attached image. We proposed a new style during the initial round of UI review. However, to prevent introducing any unknowns in the late development cycle, this has not been implemented.

In future release, the "ear" palette should be updated so that:

- The new proposed style (as shown in attached figure) should be used on Mac. All controls will be set on one palette, a divider will be set to separate the quick access buttons and other controls.

- The two quick access buttons will always remain on the top corner (instead of far corner) of the ODP 		Ian Lane
VB-172630

Inserting Light Instruments with Label Legend

User found that he was unable to insert light instruments into his design layer with a different label legend associated with it.  It would always default to a previous legend.

I found that changing the active label legend does not always choose that new active label legend.  

Steps taken

Open Label Legend and choose any legend to be active.

Insert light instrument and that active label legend is applied

Open Label Legend and deactivate current legend and choose a different one.

Insert light instrument and the previous legend is applied

Reopening label legend manager can see that 2 legends are active.  Deactivating one will deactivate both legends.

 

Workaround

Choose an active legend, and insert a light

open label legend manager, and deactivate label legend and close label legend manager

reopen label legend manger and select new legend to be active

new inserted light instruments will now have the active legend attached 		Kevin Linzey

Is there any way you can recover this?
It's quite urgent.

VB-171268

VB-171638

Section Viewport Creation Alert Dialogs/Messages are Inconsistent and Unclear

Some of the alert dialogs/messages that appear when attempting to create a Section Viewport (SVP) are inconsistent across similar contexts or could stand to be clearer in some instances. Attached is a video that shows both of these issues. You will note that a different message appears when SVP creation is attempted when a SVP is selected on a Sheet Layer vs. when editing that Sheet Layer SVP's Annotations and attempting to create a SVP. Attached is a screenshot of the message that appears when SVP creation is attempted when a SVP is selected on a Sheet Layer and that also appears when SVP creation is attempted when a Section-Elevation Line already associated with a SVP is selected in the Annotations of a Sheet Layer Viewport. In the case of a SVP creation being attempted when a Section-Elevation Line already associated with a SVP is selected in the Annotations of a Sheet Layer Viewport, the message saying "Please select an unsectioned or horizontal section viewport." does not make much sense since you are already in the Annotations of a Viewport (i.e., an unsectioned viewport).

Furthermore, I think the strings related to kSectionErrorWarningStrings that are used in LiveSection.cpp, SectionLine.cpp, and ViewportUI.cpp should generally be examined for consistent use and clearness as part of this bug since the ability to create SVPs from viewport annotations is becoming a more common workflow and the ability to create SVPs from HSVPs was just added for Vectorworks 2021. The strings themselves can be found in "//depot/Engineering/VectorWorks/Mainline/AppSource/Vectorworks.vwr/Strings/4076 Create Section - errors and warning and Misc strings.vwstrings". 		Rick Berge

I found a similiar Jira report, VB-162142 PDF becoming invisible at about 1500% zoom. It was fixed for 25.0.0.

In this case the PDF becomes invisible pretty earlier.

Please have a look. 		Josh Loy
