VB-169797

VectorScript: NewField() uses old ID numbers

At some point, the field types returned in GetFldType() changed to be the same as PIO parameter types, with an object variable being the method to set the numeric type. NewField(), however, still uses the old constants, so any field of type 7 or higher is impossible to create via script.

 

You can see this if you create a blank file with a record format of the type popup. Export as script. Open a new file and run the script.

 

Real - Coordinate Displacement
7
Text - Popup Menu Item
8
Text - Radio Button
9
Real - Coordinate Location X
10
Real - Coordinate Location Y
11
Static Text
14
Text - Class Popup
18 		Vladislav Stanev
VB-168123

Site Model Is Not Marked for Update After Creating Site Modifier Using Create Objects from Shape Command

Follow theese steps:

1) Create a 2D Shape over existing Site Model.

2) Use the Create Objects from Shape Command for the 2D Shape

3) Select Site Modifier and press OK

4) Note that a Site Modifier is created but the Update Button of the existing Site Model is not red (the Site Model is not marked dirty)

This behaviour is only reproduced using the Create Objects from Shape Command. If you create the Site Modifier using the Site Modifiers Tool it won't happen. 		Bozhidar Stanchev
VB-167473

When workspace is enlarged, the characters tend to shrink and disappear.

--------------------------
Target environment　　　　　
--------------------------
Windows (shrink and disappear), Mac (disappear)
It occurs in v2020, v2019.
--------------------------
How to Reproduce
--------------------------
When workspace is enlarged, the characters tend to shrink and disappear.

<Target tool>
・Text
・Viewport
・Space
・Door
・Window
・Constrained Linear Dimension
・Unconstrained Linear Dimension
・Angular Dimension
・Arc Length Dimension
・Radial Dimension
・Worksheet＊

Please refer to
"sample10586_1.vwx"
(Sheet Layer:Sht-1,Design Layer:charctor verification )

"movie10586_1.mov".

*Remarks*
-In Mac, when “Interior Elevation Viewport” is enlarged, the characters become black solid coating. The others tool’s characters disappear.
(Informed VB-167186)

-There are times when characters shrink and times when they do not.
When the characters are much,the characters tend to be thin.

-＊Worksheet text hardly disappears at the same magnification. But when the characters are much, they tend to be thin.

-I haven't seen all of the tools, but there may be more.

-This problem is a shaky.

 

Best regards,
Rie Ichimura
A&A 		Josh Loy
VB-169901

User Origin Tool Has "Disable Dragging..." Option Enabled by Default in 2021, Tool Fails on Second Attempt

I've attached a movie that shows this from a blank file.

To reproduce:

-Open a blank file
-Activate the User Origin tool and click anywhere

Note that the dialog appears with the "Disable dragging for the user origin button" option enabled. Because of this, the User Origin tool will now be disabled and will show an error on the next attempt in any file.

This option was disabled by default in past versions so it seems like enabling it could cause confusion. In order to use the tool again the user would need to know to go to the User Origin dialog and disable the "Disable dragging..." option.

The wording of this option (and its help text) are also kind of confusing. The tool doesn't actually require "dragging" or "click-drag", you just click to activate the tool and then to place the origin, so it's not really clear that this option disables the tool entirely. 		Rick Berge
VB-169883

Closing all documents OIP still shows recently selected object

See attached movie.
This a minor issue and not a regression.
Create a new document and place an object
select the object
Close the document
Now there are no documents open.
Note that OIP still shows the object and properties are editable.
Nav palette and other tool palettes are were not functional as expected. 		Ian Lane
VB-169787

Label Legend text overlaps when device is focused

When a lighting device is focused on a focus point, it rotates (Top/Plan view) to point toward the focus. When this occurs, some Label Legend fields will overlap because they also rotate. There seems to be no way to keep text rotation relative to the device in a label legend. Basically, there should be a way to have the fields rotate with the device, but still maintain their orientation. It seems to work better if I just rotate the device manually instead of focusing it. Kevin Linzey

VB-168560

"Reset All Plug-Ins" menu command should use lowercase, "i" to be consistent with similar menu items

-Go to the Tools menu
-You'll notice the, "Plug-ins" menu and the "Plug-in Manager" menu items use a lowercase, "i"
-Go to Tools > Utilities > Update Plug-in Objects also uses a lowercase, "i"
-Go to Tools > Utilities > Reset All Plug-Ins uses an uppercase, "I"

VB-171251

Worksheet performance is terrible

I find worksheets in our typical size project files to be unbearably slow.  This goes for editing both regular worksheet cells with simple text and database cells in any worksheet that has one or more databases rows.  Worksheets that do not have any database rows perform better.  When a worksheet has a DB row it seems like VW is parsing though unnecessary data when only editing a standard worksheet cell not associated with a DB row.  In regard to editing database cells there also seem to be a lot of overhead occurring to edit data as if VW is parsing though the entire file even if the data only affect a few items.  Below is a simple movie showing the issue.  Ever time I edit a worksheet my computers fans spin up to full and VW commands a lot of resources.  So much so that trying to create the below screen move at the same time caused my Mac (2017 MacBook Pro top model w/ 16 gig RAM, 3.1 GHz Intel Core i7, Radeon Pro 560 4 GB) to shut down which is something I have never seen before. Karthick Chilaka

VB-172215

Updating references takes more than 20 Minutes

Hi there,

I'm not sure if this is a bug or it just has to do with the fact that the project is huge. However, I think it is worth to analyze what takes the time when updating the references in this file. The customer complains that updating the references takes more than one hour. Well, to be honest it does not take that long. We did several tests on different computers (files were locally stored) and it is between 20 and 30 minutes.

We would appreciate if you could analyze the process when updating all the references and  maybe you find a hint what takes that long.

Steps to reproduce:

1. Download "Archive_01", "Archive_2" and "Archive_03"

[https://cloud.vectorworks.net/links/11eac117c178c2fca50a0e4ea18416f9/]

[https://cloud.vectorworks.net/links/11eac117cb437f0ca50a0e4ea18416f9/]

[https://cloud.vectorworks.net/links/11eac117d230ac4aa50a0e4ea18416f9/]

The files are huge therefore you get 3 archives.

2. Copie all files in one single folder. The references are relativ already.

3. To be able to reproduce the problem you have to change the following files first. See attached image. Open all these files, add a rectangle to it and save the file.

4. Open "1602_1 GR-SN gesamt_ohneSchnitte.vwx"

5. Update all the references in this file

As you can see it will take between 20 and 30 minutes depending on your computer.

 

We are in risk in this office and already log VB-17200. This is the reason why I log it as high.

The customer is willing to buy new computers, a new switch and also a new server (MacMini at the moment :)). They actually don't want to switch. Therefore we are happy if you could analyze the the steps and maybe you find a reason why it takes that long. I mean, your answer of course could be "the files are huge and we cannot optimize the process".

Note: We did not yet convert them to 2021.

Any info are appreciated.

PS: I know that the files are huge. If you have troubles just let me know.

  		Josh Loy
VB-172200

Updating references during file open although auto. Update is turned off

A few days ago we went to a "confidence" mission to a customer with 15 seats. They mainly complain about "performance". I have to say that it is a pretty complex and huge project containing multiple buildings. We already were able to figure out different issues which are causing performance problems and told them to change the setup and their work-wlow slightly. In addition they are also upgrade their Macs and server as well.

Unfortunately they already bought some ArchiCads to start with a new project. They were afraid that Vectorworks is not able to handle big files. The good thing is that they give us a chance to prove that Vectorworks is capable to handle these kind of files.

One thing we are currently analyzing is the file opening time and the time that is needed to update references. Both take a lot of time. Here the challange:

Although all references are set to "Save referenced cache to disk" and "auto. Update references" is turned off it takes pretty long to open the "main" file (7min. 30 sekonds). We deleted all the "sections" in the file "1602_1 GR-SN gesamt_ohneSchnitte.vwx" and are also sure that no section is references into this file because we know that this cause slow downs.

We are wondering why we anyhow see the message "Updating References" for a long time when opening the file "1602_1 GR-SN gesamt_ohneSchnitte.vwx". This is probably the main reason why the file opens pretty slow.

Would it be possible to analyze with your possibilities why the file opens so slow and why the references are updated although we turned "auto. update of referecnes" off?

Currently we fear that the sections in the source file are updated too and therefore the target file takes that long to open. But it is a guess.

Steps to reproduce the problem:
1. Download "Archive_01", "Archive_2" and "Archive_03"

[https://cloud.vectorworks.net/links/11eac117c178c2fca50a0e4ea18416f9/]

[https://cloud.vectorworks.net/links/11eac117cb437f0ca50a0e4ea18416f9/]

[https://cloud.vectorworks.net/links/11eac117d230ac4aa50a0e4ea18416f9/]

The files are huge therefore you get 3 archives.

2. Kopie all files in one single folder
3. Open "1602_1 GR-SN gesamt_ohneSchnitte.vwx"

As you will see you get the message "Updating references" which takes a long time. We are wondering why?

Can you please analyze what exactly happens during file opening and if there is a way to optimize this? This is an office where we are in risk (14 seats) and therefore we log it as high.

PS: You can also open "1602_1 GR-SN gesamt.vwx" this is the original customer file. But this one still contain some NOT referenced sections. 		Josh Loy

1) When switching active from a design layer to a sheet layer.

3) When creating an object in the annotation mode.

VB-173981

Spell check is unable to process file in acceptable time.

VW is takes an enormous amount of time to do a full spell check of the attached file ultimately resulting in having to force quit the application. During this spell check process it would take approx. 3 minutes to change one instance of a word and as much as 3-5 times that to execute a 'Change Al'l or 'Ignore All'. As the process progressed it got slower and slower to where even ignoring a single instance would take minutes on occasion. This same instance of spell check ran for two days before I eventual got a Mac out of application memory error and had to force quit VW without it ever completing the check.

I also tested spell check on this document for each of the areas (text blocks, symbols, records, worksheets and viewports) individually. Each one ran fine until I got to checking Records. This seems to be the problem area. Running spell check just on records performs better by itself at first but then suffers the same fate of slowing down to the point of having to give up. I ran this process for 3 hours and never reached the end. It again followed a progression where changes to a single instance of a word would eventually take about 3 minutes on average and using the 'Change All' or 'Ignore All' would take exponential amounts of time.

I also suspected that project sharing might play a role even though there were no other users with anything checked out. I saved the file as a regular vwx file type and tested this again. The results were a little better but it still took about 1.5-2 minutes when trying to make any single instance word corrections. Using 'Change All' took proportionally longer as well. Ignoring words seemed to be quicker but overall it was still too long.

I have not had the chance to convert this file and test it in 2021. 		Rick Berge

VB-169979

AHA: Creating of objects slower in 2020 than in 2019

Well, this is actually not a bug. But we got complains that the drawing speed in Vectorworks 2020 is slower than in 2019. We report this again because customers are sensitive about this. Of course there are a lot of things in 2020 which are much faster. But as you know, the discussion is always about the problems and not what is better :). We also see that the drawing speed has changed over the last view versions. Of course the application is more complex today and you can do a lot more. But we anyhow think that a noticeable slowdown from one version to a new on is not "optimal". Therefore we hope you can analyze the following slowdown from 2019 to 2020.

Steps to reproduce the problem:
# Watch the attached movie first
# Open Testfile "import dwg v2019" and reproduce the problem in 2019
# Open Testfile "import dwg v2020" and reproduce the problem in 2020

You will realize a noticeable slowdown when creating objects.

 

I did not tag this as "CW_HighPriority" or "QRT" because the problem occurs in big files (a lot of objects) only. But I think you should have an eye on this one anyhow. 		Josh Loy

VB-168460

Schematic View take 1.5 to 14 minutes to change fill color

While testing for T02141 (Performance Improvements for Schematic Views and Lighting Devices), I came across an issue changing the fill color of the 2D geometry in a Schematic View (working with just truss and lighting devices).  The fill color would take affect quickly after selecting it from the Attributes Pallet, but the "Update Geometry" would take any where from 1.5 minutes to 15 minutes for the action to complete and the red stripe border to go away.  

+I included two different Vectorworks files:+

*"Lighting Plot"* (created myself clean from an 2020 SP3 build, 8MB)

*"My Big Festival Gig 2020"* (came from VB-167265 - Lighting device redraw, 103MB)

From the times below, the large file clearly took longer to complete this action on both OS.  Both files took longer on MacOC than Windows. 

*The Schematic View I used is on Layer SV for both files.*

*+Windows:+*

"Lighting Plot" Schematic View  - 1 minutes 30 seconds

"My Big Festival Gig 2020" - 4 minutes 30 seconds

*+Mac:+*

"Lighting Plot" Schematic View  - 2 minutes 40 seconds

"My Big Festival Gig 2020" - 14 minutes 20 seconds

I conducted this same round of testing in 2020 SP2, and it definitely took longer to conduct this action as well as moving and creating Schematic Views.  So, there is an improvement over all.  "My Big Festival Gig 2020" took 19 minutes to change color on Mac and on Windows it took 8 minutes.

  		Kevin Linzey
VB-170589

Adding or removing lighting devices to a large selection is slow

See the attached screen movie and file. I've duplicated a simple Lighting Device 200 times. I also set Obj Info options not to display any Lighting Device fields, have the Label Legend set to none, and turned off Selection Highlighting to eliminate a number of variables.

Doing a select all or deselect all is fairly fast. Adding or removing a light to the selection, however, takes a fair amount of time to process. The more lights I have selected, the longer it takes. 		Kevin Linzey

VB-175292

Performance decrease between VW 2016 and 2020

Users have a number of projects which was created in Vectorworks 2016 and has recently been transferred over to Vectorworks 2020.

One of them (The Priory & Orchard - Survey) is quite heavy to the point where I would expect it to slow down Vectorworks 2020 however this file functions perfectly fine in Vectorworks 2016.  Any ideas on why this is?

 

 

 

Message from the user:

As describe in our conversation, the principal issue is very slow selection, lots of lag and a degree of freezing of the program when trying to manipulate simple lines / polygons. This make the program incredibly slow, frustrating to work with and difficult to control. As discussed the below link is for a download of a sample set of files we have this issue with, but it is not exclusive to these files and is an issue generally. 

 

1938_C_GA        This file created in vw2016 worked without any significant issue, certainly not the lag in selection, movement & without the program freezing – these issues are present in vw2020.

                                The issues were experienced both on the new PC with windows 10, and on the old PC which runs windows 7 and has no issues with the files in vw2016

 

28 High Street   This file was created in vw2016 and has experienced the same issues as above, and the file size is significantly smaller / less layers etc.

                                The issues were experienced both on the new PC with windows 10, and on the old PC which runs windows 7 and has no issues with the files in vw2016

 

The Priory           This file was created in vw2020 and only contains a few imported dwg / dwg from pdf, there are a lot of lines but we did this type/level of survey import with vw2016 with no issues.  

                                The issues (same as above) were experienced both on the new PC with windows 10, and on the old PC which runs windows 7 and have no issues with the files in vw2016

                                The main imported PDF file is also contained.

 

The issues were experience in when running files on the local machine and on the network alike, with WFH we have generally not been using the network so I doubt this would be an issue.

 

Please let me know if you need any further information, I have tried vw 2021 now with the last file and its hard to tell if it is an improvement on 2020 so far but its still the same problems. 		Josh Loy
VB-174695

External GPU not being used with VW 2021.

Whenever user tries to launch Vectorworks using an external GPU it seems that Vectorworks stops using any of the available graphic cards and only the CPU does calculations. Without enabling the external GPU it works quite fine with the integrated graphics card, but when external GPU is enabled Vectorworks slows down by a mile and it becomes impossible to use it. When we checked the activity monitor while VW is does not have the external GPU enabled it seems to be using the integrated one. When we turn on the external one it stops using both. Only started happening when user installed Catalina. 

 

See user message below:

When working on either Vectorworks 2021 or Vectorworks 2020 on a Mac mini (2018) with a sonnet eGPU Breakaway Box 650 plus a Radeon Vega 64 graphics card, I had Mojave installed originally on this Mac but have had to upgrade to Catalina 10.15.7 (19H2) due to other software compatability and now Vectorworks no longer works correctly with the eGPU connected and the Prefer External GPU ticked originally this worked on the older OS with prefer external gpu ticked and increased the speed of what it Vectorworks processes but now with the prefer external ticked Vectorworks lags and goes really slowly even in a blank file and is more noticeable on projects. I have included my system report in the test file attachment, I have also wiped the machine and done a fresh clean install of the OS and Vectorworks and still the slow down is so noticeable for now I have unticked prefer external GPU for now. I don't have a problem with other software on the Mac using the eGPU as I have modo installed and it fully utilises the eGPU like it should. 		Josh Loy

VB-171699

Initial Change to 3D is Much Slower in VW 2021

VB-176020

The freezing model - part 1

Hello

*Strictly confidential.  Do not even use this as an example of what not to do!*

I attach the original 3d and 2d survey from a survey company that uses vectorworks 2013 as far as we can tell, although it looks like the attached started life before 2013, and even before 2011 since the file was originally named with 'v2011' at the end.

This file was stupidly used by my client as the basis of their design model, converted directly to 2019.

The file demonstrates many issues, and notwithstanding the complete lack of care and lack of coordination between 2d and 3d, the junk in the file, some of which we don't even think was authored by the surveyor, makes it even more challenging to determine why the 2019 conversion is now crashing on open and/or on save.

There are so many things wrong with the file it is difficult to explain but hopefully you will recoil in horror, or quiet admiration acknowledging that to get it so wrong takes some effort!

We aim to update the surveyor to the latest version or at least explain that if he wants the work he has to be able to work in and supply 2019, or later models to his clients, since the model is going to be used as the basis of the Architect's model and the model must not be converted from an earlier version.

A short statement to the effect that 'we do not recommend converting from previous versions because of x, y, z', would be useful, e.g. because the wall technology changed between version a and b, etc.

TBH the file behaves better in 2021 but we have not been able to use the file for any sustained period in 2021 because my client is using 2019.  We have suggested updating to 2021 but this would introduce a further conversion of the model from an unknown version, to 2011, then 2013, then 2019, and then 2021.  Something is bound to break.

I would welcome a critique of the attached file as a warning to all vectorworks users to keep current and only use one version of the software on any one project. 		Josh Loy
VB-175630

Slowness in 2021/High Sierra

Hi Everyone,

 

I have been in contact from a customer that is have unworkable slowness in VW 2021 when working on, what seems to be text heavy files.

 

These files have been tested on our computers and are working fine without issue. The customer has three licences with three computer. Two are Mac OS High Sierra and the other Catalina. The file works without issue in VW 2021 on Catalina. However, when the file is working on VW 2021 on High Sierra the issues happen.

 

When panning they receive a spinning wheel. When typing new text, this is extremely slow and takes a while to catch up. They have no crashing, just total slowness when what looks to be working with text.

 

I have;
* Reset user folder
* Ran repair
* Updated Vectorworks
* Uninstalled/re installed
* Validated fonts on the Mac
* Checked the energy saver settings
* Tried moving some on the text to a new file
* Changed navigation graphics

After all these tests the issue is still there. I did a comparison with my Mac and the customer Mac working with High Sierra. His Mac is newer and has better spec, apart from maybe the processor so this shouldn't be an issue. The anomaly in this issue is the Mac OS is different.

I have tested Vectorworks 2020 on the computers running High Sierra and the file has no issues.

I have attached one of the customers computer spec and a file. If you need anything else please let me know. The customer is very un happy with how the upgrade has gone. 		Josh Loy

-Note this take s a while

-Notice it takes some time to reset the section for this particular render

VB-175947

DOM: Section Viewport Performance

A bigger Customer of us is blocked by his workflows and I try to get a Workaround or another Workflow for him. Also we have pressure because they evaluated other CAD Application ArchiCAD.

What he want to do is to integrate a Revit Exported IFC File into his Vectorworks Modell. So far the IFC can be imported and VW 2021 can handle ist pretty good.

As soon as we have a section viewport through this IFC geometry, Memory fills and HDD fills also. Maybe the Amount of Poly-Faces is just too big or there is another issue we can not find. I still search for a Workaround. So good possible I will deliver further Informations.

Attached to this report:
- IFC File "2011_Roesslimattstr_39_HG.ifc"
[https://cloud.vectorworks.net/links/11eb3faa754aef748fce0e8109945acd/]

- Vectorworks File with the imported IFC File (you can also import, but it takes 30 Minutes app) "Roesslimattstr_39_HG.vwx"
[https://cloud.vectorworks.net/links/11eb3faa4a88013c85ba12bd733fbe07/]


- Movie I made for the customer as an "actual" feedback.
[https://cloud.vectorworks.net/links/11eb3faa5fef46ca85ba12bd733fbe07/]

- Master File "51.02 AP SUVA VWX"
[https://cloud.vectorworks.net/links/11eb3faa6a83234085ba12bd733fbe07/]


It is a huge number of Objects in the IFC, so we could say 30000 IFC Object are 30000 IFC Objects and please search another Workflow.
Unfortunately I also tested this with ArchiCAD 24. Import also takes some Minutes (Faste as in VW but still 10 Minutes). After that I have horizontal Sections on the Floor Structure and after creating A Section after some seconds the section was created without any tweaking.

My approaches in Vectorworks:

1. Tried to seperate the Meshes. If I hide all Meshes Section takes 50 Seconds which is all right. But Half of IFC are Mesh geometry.
I used a little Marionette Script for that.

2. Simplify Mesh would help but we are not able to manually simplify 30'000 Mesh Objects. Is there a Sript command for the Simplify Mesh?

3. Maybe open Polys in Meshes are an issue. I also not was able to test this.

The ground bottleneck here is the performance of the hidden Line rendering. Just one Design (Tested Layer 'DA') Layer with Hidden line takes very long (I aborted this test don't know).

What would help:

1. Integrate this Kind of geometry in your performance optimization tests for future Versions.

2. For this specific Project/Customer I need a workaround. I am searching on different directions:
1. Simplify Geometry with a Vecorscript (can you help?)
2. Simplify with an external Software (did not found anything yet)
3. Workflow adaption (wether we like or not). How coordinate the Design with the IFC Geometry. And How create Documentation of the Building contains Technique geometry based on IFC Data.
4. Filter Objects (Script which search Objects and informations and delete them or set to differenc classes)

Thanks











 

 

 

 

  		Josh Loy

VB-171804

Vectorworks is slow with a document containing imported DWG graphics (exported from ArchiCAD).

Source of the issue: [https://forum.vectorworks.net/index.php?/topic/72969-dwg-import-drawing-slow/#comment-355803]

What I posted there:

I can confirm the delay when working with the document. From what I see there, you have either imported the DWG in an already existing Vectorworks document, or have updated it later adding more staff. Or you might have imported multiple DWG files - probably 267 according to the number of Design layers?

The rest of the things, which I found:

- The document contains nearly 4 735 000 objects, screen plane;

- Created symbols are 97623; There are also lots of groups;

- Imported hatches are actually groups with lines - Vectorworks imports hatches as hatches, does not decompose them - so probably this is how the DWG file has been exported by ArchiCAD;

- Seems that dimensions are also presented as groups of lines and text - by default we import dimensions as dimensions, except if the linear scale parameter is different than 1.0 or you have explicitly chosen to import them as groups;

- There are lots of classes and sheet layers; 		Hugues Tsafak

VB-170066

Ifc opening objects dislocate if associated object is NOT extruded along the Z axis

The following file shows symbols containing objects assigned with IfcOpening. This approach works if the associated Vectorworks object has been drawn on the Z plane and extruded in the Z axis. ( See eg 04 in the file for a successful example ). 

However, if the associated object is instead, drawn on the Y plane ( ie from front or back view ), then the IfcOpening fails when exported and reimported back into Solibri.

 

This has been puzzling users for a while and has taken us a while to track this down, but hopefully this file documents the issue. We can add an explanatory movie if that would be useful. 		Mihail Rizov
VB-173706

Wall items appear in IFC export that are not in VWX file

We have had reports from OMI that they are seeing incorrect wall items appearing in their IFC exports that are not seen in the VWX file. We are not sure if this is related to the previous QRT which had corrupt walls - however, we have run the script provided by the QRT team to try and fix this prior to export. The IFC file is being taken into Navisworks and Revit. When we query the GUID of the items in Revit, and then run a search for the same GUID in the IFC file using Text Edit, we can see that the GUID is indeed there.

A further complication is that the same objects seem to be being filtered out by Solibri - as a similar GUID search yields no results.

The IFC file provided by our customer is attached as are a number of screenshots. Here are some examples of GUIDs from the problem items.

04BxX0vw5DfhVCURX3tmZf
2U1YJB7Cj1gutDbeTu2FRI
$yar11SuyPpFBdUJVf
1k5C6BlDv0luD_1JQHs4op

Is it possible to tell from the IFC file whether these walls are corrupt? Is it possible that Solibri knows they are corrupt and is filtering them out, but that Revit/Navisworks is simply converting everything it sees? And if so - is it possible to locate these walls in VWX.

The other QRT tht is may be related to is VB-170455 		Mihail Rizov

In the attached file one exports a corrext IFC file with SP2, but with SP3 one gets to big opening Elements in the roof. You can see that on the left side of the attached picture.

  		Mihail Rizov

VB-175539

Order of Data Files in Data Mapping is wrong

Hi Vectorworks

The order of Data Fields of a Record Format in the Data Mapping Dialog is not the order of the record format. It's alphabetical instead of the order of the record format.

After a few days working with the Data Mapping we should from my point of view have both orders enable.

Best regards, Marc 		Mihail Rizov
VB-174839

Project freezing while being turned off. Screen locks.

We have multiple users now coming back to us with issues that when they close down files it freezes the screen on Vectorworks and it seems whatever they would do on the file the changes are applied on to another file in the file tabs. Impossible to change active file. Vectorworks eventually crashes or needs to be restarted anyways as it completely locks the application. Resource manager shows a wrong file as active file when brought up. Design layer screen just gets stuck and freezes, but tools can still be selected. At the moment we only seen Windows computers have this issue. 

We created a new user account for user. Set up Vectorworks there and requested not to install anything else while testing. User used VW for a week and found the issue happen again. 

User bought and set up a new computer for himself and installed windows from scratch. The computer is completely different. Same issue. 

 

We have updated graphics drivers. Computer dxdiag file attached. 

 

Looking into this further we noticed that user is now and then opening old files. This user used Vectorworks 11 files. We have information that this is happening on all new files as well. My thoughts are that this could be related with something in the resource manager as it seems it does not switch the active file when highlighted so it could be related with old resources. 

 

As we had this issue with new files i suspect users might be using templates with old objects migrated from year to year. 

 

Just for the record and users request we had him testing the license on a different serial number. We used an Eval temporary license. 

 

Any help would be appreciated.  		Rick Berge
VB-174204

SBE: Tile in Swap Graphic not in sync with tile in wall

Please see attached screenshot and testfile. The PIO creates 2D swap graphics in which a part of the wall cavity is drawn using the wall cavity's attributes. One of the wall cavities has a tile fill. Despite the PIO uses this same tile, the orientation of the tile within the PIO does not match the orientation of the tile in the wall in the viewport (but it does in 2D plan, see construction layer). This looks very ugly and should be fixed. Josh Loy
VB-173926

Closing the Document Preference dialog with OK button causes screen redraw BEFORE dialog closes

When I close the Document Preferences dialog by clicking the OK button, VW 2021 forces a screen redraw before the dialog closes. In the attached file this takes my machine 3.5 minutes to complete, then the dialog closes and I can resume working. 

No changes are required to the dialog before closing it. Clicking the OK always causes a screen redraw. At the very least, the dialog should close BEFORE the screen is redrawn. Ideally, if you do not change any settings and click the OK button, no screen redraw should occur.

Clicking the Cancel button works as expected with the dialog closing and no redraw occurring. 

 

1) Before opening the attached file, set VW PREF Navigation Graphics to *Best Compatibility*. 

2) Open file "Wafer Chip2 v2021.vwx".

3) Open the Document Preferences dialog – under menu *File > Document Settings > Document Preferences...*

4) Click the OK button to close the Document Preferences dialog – no need to change anything.

NOTE: Dialog box remains open while screen redraws. In this file it is a long time to wait for the dialog to close.

I don't believe this is a regression, as redraw times used to be so much faster that I never noticed this behavior before.

 

  		Josh Loy
VB-168052

--------------------------
Target environment
--------------------------
Win Mac
It occurs in v2020.
--------------------------
How to Reproduce
--------------------------
In Renderworks Camera,set [Crop Frame Scale] to 101% or more, click“Active Camera View”, click“Fine Tune Camera view”and click“OK”, and some values will change in the OIP.

Target tool:Renderworks Camera

1)Set [Crop Frame Scale] to 101% or more

2)Click“Active Camera View”

3)Click“Fine Tune Camera view”and click“OK”

4)The camera value “Focal Lengh is” changes to 10mm and“Field of View” changes to 130°.

*Remarks*
-In v2017,v2018, v2019
if [Crop Frame Scale] is set to 101% or more, some values(Focal Lengh is/Field of View) will change.

-May be related to VB-130944

Please refer to "sample10606.vwx","movie10606.mov","10606.png".

VB-175659

Area, Perim and Volume SDK functions return 0 for Curtain Wall components

All of the following SDK functions return 0 for the components of a Curtain Wall (kCurtainWallFrameNode, kCurtainWallPanelNode):

GetMaterialArea,

ObjSurfaceArea, 

ObjArea

CalcAreaN

GetComponentNetArea


GetMaterialVolume, 

CalcVolume, 

ObjVolume 

GetComponentNetVolume,

 

CalcPerimN

 

They also return 0 for the Curtain Wall itself.

The values for Area, Volume and Perimeter for the components of a Curtain Wall are essential for the implementation of T02169 – IFC Default Quantity Takeoffs. 		Vladislav Stanev

-Open test file

-From the navigation palette, make 'Floor 1' the active layer and set layer options to "Active Only"

-Edit the Stair in the basement, maybe you can change the treads texture with a different Material then close the Stair Settings dialog.

-Perform the 'Revert to Saved' menu command

-This is where VW hangs. Not a consistently reproducible bug, although I saw it twice with this file. 

 

See Symbolized sample crash log below 		Rick Berge

VB-176015

Scripts generated by "Custom Tool/Attribute" don't change the Smart 3D options in the Grid tab of SmartCursor Settings

# Open Tools->Custom Tool/Atribute and check "SmartCursor Settings"
# Name the script something like "enabled"
# Disable the same option from step 2
# Create another script named "disabled"
# Running any of the scripts won't change the option, but it seems to work with the other options in the SmartCursor Settings

See attached video 		Josh Loy
VB-176000

Unrotate 3D Objects command needs renaming

The *Unrotate 3D Objects* command has a confusing name, which affects our localization efforts. According to the Help:

The *Unrotate 3D Objects* command returns any 3D object that has its own coordinate system to its upright position. Use the command to rotate symbols, extrudes, multiple extrudes, and sweeps so that they align with the world coordinate system.

 

I've been informed that this commands sets the rotation back to match the coordinate system in the file for the 3D object. The concept is “to restore the orientation of the 3D object” in that regard.

I recommend changing the command to *Restore 3D object orientation* to match its original meaning and to help improve the localized names.

 

!image-2020-12-17-13-17-19-739.png! 		Josh Loy
VB-175956

Mosa Pattern download causes multiple Beta Undo Alerts

VB-175488

Click-Dragging Fails on Some Group Objects in 2020/2021

The attached movie and test file show this in VW 2019 compared to 2020, since the problem appeared between the two. The file contains a Group made from several complex solids.

To reproduce, in each version, try to quickly click-drag on the Group to move it.

Note that this works fine in 2019 but usually fails in 2020. In order to get it to work you have to click, then hold for a second or two, then drag.

It looks like this is happening because the interactive drag preview is trying to show more geometry in 2020.

The same thing happens in VW 2021. 		Josh Loy
VB-175454

Memory Creeps up when Editing Section In Place within Model House while using the Flyover Tool

I've attached a short movie that shows this issue

-Open test file 

-Double click the Section viewport and choose 'Edit Section In Place'  option, then close "Edit Viewport" dialog

-Render in Open GL ( if not already rendered) and use the Flyover tool

-Render in Hidden Line and use the Flyover

-Notice the Memory goes up in the Activity Monitor and you'll notice the 'Spinning Beach Ball' in the document window

-Render in Open GL again and use the Flyover. Note the Spinning beach ball comes back and the memory jumps up.

 

The spinning beach ball comes back when repeating the above steps while in Fast RW. Maybe this is worth profiling to see what eating up the memory in this case? 

  		Josh Loy

VB-174958

The path created by selecting "Active Layer Plane" in the Rotate about center of option of Create Orbit Path will be the same path as when "Selection" is selected.

Create Orbit Path... > Orbit Options Dialog > The path created by selecting "Active Layer Plane" in the Rotate about center of option is the same as selecting "Selection".
Reproduction example:
1. Open “12271.vwx”
2. Execute Create Orbit Path... with Extrude selected at the lower left position from the active layer.
3. Select "Active Layer Plane" for Rotate about center of: in the Orbit Options Dialog and click OK.
4. The center of the created path is drawn around the selected Extrude instead of the active layer plane.
* The same path as when Rotate about center of: in Orbit Options Dialog is set to "Selection" is drawn.

If it’s hard to understand, please refer to reproduced movie "12271.mov".

Best regards,
Takaaki Mizuno

VB-174697

Current View Menu Fails to Show Rotated Plan Option When Inside Containers

Movie and test file are attached. The file contains a Group with a few objects.

To reproduce:

-Make sure the "Working Plane Views" view option is active (button in the mode bar)
-Rotate the plan as shown
-Now switch to any 3D view

Note that the Current Plan Rotation field in the mode bar still shows the plan rotation angle, and the Current View menu shows an option for "Rotated Top/Plan" (letting you easily return to a rotated plan view)

-Now switch back to un-rotated Top/Plan and enter the Group
-Again rotate the plan and then switch to 3D

Note that now the Current Plan Rotation field shows 0.00º, and if you expand the Current View menu it fails to show the "Rotated Top/Plan" option. At this point if you want to return to the rotated plan view you need to set the angle again.

This also happens inside symbol edit modes.

The same thing happened in past versions. 		Josh Loy

VB-174599

I've attached a short movie that shows this issue

-Open test file 

-I've noticed that after working in the file for an hour or so, selection sections rendered in Open GL seems slow, so it takes 3 - 4 secs for the data to show in the OIP.  		Josh Loy

-Again place a symbol instance

Note that now it gets inserted with the wrong location/rotation.

VB-173719

PushAttrs & PopAttrs don't work for Snapping

The following should remove and replace Snapping options, but it doesn't. PopAttrs is not reinstating Snapping options. procedure Main; var pt1, pt2 : vector; begin PushAttrs; SetConstrain(''); PenSize(0); GetPt (pt1.x, pt1.y); GetPtL (pt1.x, pt1.y, pt2.x, pt2.y); RectangleN (pt1.x, pt1.y, 1, 0, pt2.x - pt1.x, pt2.y - pt1.y); SetFPat (LNewObj, 1); PopAttrs; end; run (Main); Josh Loy

VB-173384

SBE: SDK: VWDialog doesn't receive kBeforeResizeMessage and kAfterResizeMessage

In some of our dialogs, we need to do some stuff after the user resizes a dialog manually.

Unfortunately, the events

const Sint32 kBeforeResizeMessage = -12640;
const Sint32 kAfterResizeMessage = -12641;

(defined in MiniCadCallBacks.x.h)

are never sent to the dialog (but kResizeMessage is).

I tried both overloading OnBeforeDispatchEvent and creating a custom handler (see code fragments below), but nothing helped.

To me it looks like a bug in VWDialog class or the dialog framework. THe messages are simply not dispatched to the handlers.

Tested on Mac, no tests on Windows.

Best regards,

Stefan Bender



class fetu_bs3d_sub_dlg::public VWDialog {
....
....
virtual void OnBeforeDispatchEvent(TControlID controlID, VWDialogEventArgs& eventArg);

void OnTestEvent(Sint32 controlID, VWDialogEventArgs& eventArgs);

DEFINE_EVENT_DISPATH_MAP;

};

/**********************************************************/
EVENT_DISPATCH_MAP_BEGIN( fetu_bs3d_sub_dlg );

ADD_DISPATCH_EVENT( kAfterResizeMessage, OnTestEvent );
ADD_DISPATCH_EVENT( -kAfterResizeMessage, OnTestEvent );


EVENT_DISPATCH_MAP_END;
/************************************************************/
/**********************************************************/
void fetu_bs3d_sub_dlg::OnTestEvent(Sint32 controlID, VWDialogEventArgs& eventArgs)
{
was never called before/after resizing
}
/**********************************************************/
void fetu_bs3d_sub_dlg::OnBeforeDispatchEvent(TControlID controlID, VWDialogEventArgs& eventArg)
{

was never called before/after resizing
.....
}


Vladislav Stanev

VB-172970

Snapping to PDF

I have recieved a PDF from a customer. They are trying to snap to the geometry within the PDF so that they can trace over the top of it.

This only seems to be possible when importing the PDF into VW 2017 & 2018 and ungrouping the PDF. The information is there and the customer is able to work with it.

However, When importing into VW 2019, 2020 & 2020 there is no information to snap to/work with.

The customer says:
The PDF mapping file was purchased online via the Irish Ordnance Survey mapping website. I pay for each may and then also have to pay an annual copyright fee for use of their maps.
 
See link below to OSI planning pack information.
 
[https://www.osi.ie/products/professional-mapping/planning-pack/]
 
The website works just like the UK mapping websites in that you search for your site and then lock in the co-ordinates - pay - and a PDF version of the map is issued (generated from digital vector information).
 
All Architects in Ireland would use the OSI service as there is no third party mapping sellers unlike in the UK. 		Josh Loy

VB-172202

Web based plug-ins fail to redirect to Google account log in page

Open the Furn/Fixtures Tool set and open the BIMObject web site from the BIMObject tool. When the sign in page opens choose to log in with a Google account. The page hangs for a few seconds and after that you are redirected to the Application Access page and given access to the BIMObject site without signing into your Google account.

Open the GIS tool set, choose the Geolocate tool and press any of the three "Select Service..." buttons in the Geolocate Preferences dialog. Press the "Login" button and when the Web browser opens the Sign in page choose again to log in with a Google account. The browser should close after you sign in, but in this case it closes a few seconds after pressing the Google button.

VB-171059

VB-171160

VB-171107

Invisible Groups are Selectable When Unified View "Display Screen Objects" is Disabled

Movie and test file are attached. The file contains a few Screen-plane objects, including a Group containing a Screen plane object.

To reproduce:

-Open the Unified View Options dialog and disable "Display Screen Objects"
-Now draw a marquee over the area where the Screen objects were

Note that the Group becomes selected even though it's invisible.

Technically Groups can contain both Screen and non-Screen objects, so the Group itself isn't on the Screen plane, just the contents. I'm guessing that's why the Group remains selectable. Ideally VW would recognize that all of the contents are hidden and would make the Group un-selectable, similar to how Groups work when all of the contents are in invisible classes.

The attached screenshot shows an example from one of our users where their setup caused this problem to show.

The same thing happens in previous versions. 		Josh Loy

Hover anywhere on rectangle and highlighting appears so object is selectable
Change the hatch to Sand from Details file resources
Now hover over on rectangle. Only center and edges of rectangle will give object highlighting and selection works. Hover on other areas will fail selection
Reproducible in previous versions too. 		Josh Loy

As you can see, the polygon doesn't show any activation or snap points. If you move the symbols in VW 2018 into another symbol folder, they will convert fine.

Best regards, Marc 		Josh Loy
VB-168310

Huge RAM use for the attached documents.

Hi Vectorworks
If you open the 4 attached documents Vectorworks use a lot of ram and if you close all the 4 documents not all of the used ram is give back.

Is the amount of RAM used normal? Is there a memory leak because the RAM is not released again?


Best regards, Marc 		Rick Berge

-Now expand the Grid list again

VB-168949

T02047 - Mosa Browser Lists Grid Patterns that are Unavailable Based on the Selected Options

I've attached a movie that shows this from a blank file.

To reproduce:

-Launch the Mosa browser
-Change "Set Application" to "Wall", "Surface" to "Unglazed, and "Sizes" to "Single Sizes"
-Choose "Blue" as the Color, then change it back to "All Colors"
-Expand the Grid Pattern menu

At this point the browser should only list patterns that are available based on the selected options, but it seems to show all of them. For example if you choose the "GR019-001" pattern it says "No patterns found" and the "Surface" menu becomes blank.

It isn't really clear to the user at this point that they would need to change the "Surface" option to "All surfaces" in order to get the patterns to show again, so ideally the list would only show patterns that are actually available.

Vladislav Stanev
VB-168923

Snapping Fails and Highlighting Shows Incorrectly After Switching to Plan View Inside a Group

I've attached a movie and test file that show this. The file contains two Groups with Extrudes placed inside of them.

To reproduce:

-Disable the "Show other objects while in editing modes" VW preference
-Enter the selected Group
-Switch to Top/Plan view, then exit
-Now place the cursor over the other Group

Note that the snapping fails on the objects in that Group, and the highlighting shows the wrong shape.

If "Show other objects..." is enabled the problem won't happen.

I see the same thing in VW 2019, but not in VW 2018. 		Josh Loy
VB-168862

Edit images effects message dialog needs to be reworded.

This is minor but worth mentioning
-Open the attached file.
-I've imported an image
-As expected, it shows up in the Resource.
-Right click on the Image and choose the command "Edit Image Effects"
-Notice you will get a message dialog, "This action cannot be undone. Are you sure you want
to continue with this action?" Prior to the image effects dialog appearing.
-But this is not necessarly true.

preset settings. In this particular situation, all I have to do click on reset
on the Image Effects Dialog and it will revert back to its original state. 		Josh Loy

VB-168557

Scripts for Saved Views should execute after the other settings of the Saved View

Hi Vectorworks
If you use a script like "SetScale(50)" in combination with a Saved View, the script runs before switching the active layer.
From my point of view these order is wrong. In the attached file you can see, that depends of the active layer the Script of the Saved View change the layerscale of Design-Layer 1 or Design-Layer 2

VB-167623

Beta Undo Alert 4 Shows After Undoing Deletion of Plugin Vertices

I've attached a movie and test file, containing a simple Hardscape, that show this.

To reproduce:

-Select the Hardscape and activate the Reshape tool in the first tool mode
-Draw a marquee around a few of the vertices, then press the Delete key to remove them
-Undo the delete operation
-Switch back to the Selection tool

Note that "Beta Undo Alert 4" shows in the message bar.

The same thing happens with other path-based plugins (Slabs, Spaces, Massing Models, etc) but I don't see this with regular polys. 		Josh Loy
VB-168269

T02047 Import Mosa Pattern command doesn't appear in the, "Recent Changes" section of the Workspace Editor

VB-168094

Flyover Tool Centers on the Wrong Location When Subdivision Operations are Active

I've attached a movie and test file that show this. The file contains a Subdivision placed away from the document origin.

To reproduce:

-Make sure the Flyover tool is set to use "View Center Mode"
-Activate the Edit Subdivision tool in Transform Mode
-With the Edit Subdivision tool is active, press CMD+Middle Mouse Button (CTL+MMB on Windows) to activate the Flyover tool in boomerang mode, and do a few flyovers

Note that the view centers on the Subdivision object, as expected.

-Now click-drag on any face/edge/vertex and begin moving it
-While the operation is active, again do a Flyover using CMD+MMB

Note that now the flyover centers on some random point, making it difficult to keep the Subdivision in view.

I see the same problem in VW 2019 but not in VW 2018. 		Josh Loy
VB-167917

SBE: Listbrowser Direct Edit: Pattern menu is never initialized

I tried to set the interaction type of a cell to EListBrowserItemInteractionType::kListBrowserItemInteractionEditPattern, but the cell remained empty. Debugging revealed that EListBrowserDirectEditType::QueryItemValue message is never sent to the dialog when the list is created. Only if the user clicks in the cell, the pattern popup opens and QueryItem handler is called. This should have happened before so the list browser's cell is actually filled.

 

 

I think the same bug also happens for other cell types like hatch, tile or gradient menu. 		Josh Loy
VB-167900

Constrained Resize Operations Fail Inside Containers When Rotated Plan is Active

I've attached a movie and test file that show this. The file contains three copies of the same Polygon, including one that's been placed inside a Group and one that's been placed inside a 2D Symbol.

To reproduce:

-Rotate the plan -30º
-Click-drag the top-right corner of the poly that's outside of the containers
-While dragging, hold down the Shift key to constrain the object's aspect ratio during the resize

Note that this works fine when the object is outside of a container.

-Now enter the Group or Symbol
-Again resize the poly while constraining the aspect ratio

Note that now the resize gets constrained to some random area, causing an unpredictable result.

The same thing happened in previous versions. 		Josh Loy

1. The roof hatches are not displayed in on top the building.
2. If I set the length range to infinite in the advanced properties, the section is rendered in a weird way.
3 and 4: 3 has the correct fillings for the roof. But in 4, if I change the advanced property, the fillings are all disappeared. 		Josh Loy
